translated: The four prostrations by the bodhisattvas indicate the teaching of the realization.

original: legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis de rnams la tshigs su bcad pa bdun gyi lan bstan to //
analyzed: legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis de rnams la tshigs su bcad pa bdun gyi lan bstan to //
translated: The reply by the Tathagatas to them with seven verses beginning with Excellent!

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos de kho na nyid khong du chud par bstan to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos de kho na nyid khong du chud par bstan to //
translated: Then, from Then, the bodhisattvas... it shows the bodhisattvas' understanding of the suchness of phenomena.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang gi rtog pa sel ba bstan to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang gi rtog pa sel ba bstan to //
translated: Then, from Then, the bodhisattvas... it shows the dispelling of their own doubts.

original: gang zhig dus gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa la tshigs su bcad pa bcus bstod pa sngon du 'gro ba nas /
analyzed: gang zhig dus gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa la tshigs su bcad pa bcus bstod pa sngon du 'gro ba nas /
translated: From Those who... and so on, with ten verses of praise,

original: bstod pa'i tshig ni zhi ba 'dis //
analyzed: bstod pa'i tshig ni zhi ba 'dis //
translated: up to With these peaceful words of praise...

original: zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis nye bar bsdu ba bstan to /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis nye bar bsdu ba bstan to /
translated: the text shows the conclusion.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyud yongs su rdzogs par bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyud yongs su rdzogs par bstan to //
translated: From The Tathagatas... and so on, it shows the complete perfection of the tantra.

original: de ltar dri ba lnga bcu rtsa brgya dang / rtsom pa'i dri ba gcig dang / badzra dhri ka ces bya ba la sogs pa dri ba bcu gsum dang lhan cig 'dri ba dang / lan bdun cu rtsa gnyis bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar dri ba lnga bcu rtsa brgya dang / rtsom pa'i dri ba gcig dang / badzra dhri ka ces bya ba la sogs pa dri ba bcu gsum dang lhan cig 'dri ba dang / lan bdun cu rtsa gnyis bstan to //
translated: Thus, there are fifty-eight questions, one question about composition, and thirteen questions together with the question about vajradhrk, etc., and there are seventy-two answers.

original: de ni le'u bco brgyad pa'i don bsdus pa'o /
analyzed: de ni le'u bco brgyad pa'i don bsdus pa'o /
translated: This is the summary of the eighteenth chapter.

original: // / da ni tshig gi don bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni tshig gi don bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the meaning of the words will be explained.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, etc.

original: de nas kyi sgra ni le'u bcu bdun pa'i 'og tu 'das ma thag pa'i don la 'jug go //
analyzed: de nas kyi sgra ni le'u bcu bdun pa'i 'og tu 'das ma thag pa'i don la 'jug go //
translated: The word then refers to the immediately preceding meaning after the seventeenth chapter.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: snga ma 'das pa la ltos dang // bkra shes dang ni dbang byed pa //
analyzed: snga ma 'das pa la ltos dang // bkra shes dang ni dbang byed pa //
translated: Looking at the past, the present, and the future,

original: de nas sgra dang de phyir sgra //🔽dam chos rim dang rgyud don ston //
analyzed: de nas sgra dang de phyir sgra // dam chos rim dang rgyud don ston //
translated: the words then, thus, and therefore,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: are taught for the meaning of the holy Dharma, sequence, and tantra.

original: byams pa la sogs pa ni byams pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa ni byams pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: Maitreya, etc. refers to the bodhisattvas such as Maitreya.

original: byams pa smos pa ni ma 'ongs ba'i chos kyi rgyal srid kyi gtso bor ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: byams pa smos pa ni ma 'ongs ba'i chos kyi rgyal srid kyi gtso bor ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas te /
translated: The mention of Maitreya is because the perfect Buddha is the chief of the future Dharma kingdom,

original: ma 'ongs pa la 'das pa bzhin du nye bar gdags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa la 'das pa bzhin du nye bar gdags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the future is designated as if it were the past.

original: chen po ni rgyud thams cad gtan la bdag pa la /
analyzed: chen po ni rgyud thams cad gtan la bdag pa la /
translated: Great means that he is the lord of all the tantras.

original: sems dpa' ni rtogs par 'dod pa gang la yod pa de ni sems dpa' chen po'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' ni rtogs par 'dod pa gang la yod pa de ni sems dpa' chen po'o //
translated: The one who has the desire to realize is a great being.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs kyi gsang ba ni dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i sbas pa ste rdo rje'i tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs kyi gsang ba ni dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i sbas pa ste rdo rje'i tshig go //
translated: The secret of the body, speech, and mind of all the transcendent lords is the hidden meaning of the glorious Guhyasamaja, the vajra words.

original: bshad par bya ba ni dri ba zhus nas dgrol bar bya ba'i phyir don du'o //
analyzed: bshad par bya ba ni dri ba zhus nas dgrol bar bya ba'i phyir don du'o //
translated: The one to be explained is the one who is to be released by asking questions.

original: dngos po kun gyis ni sku la sogs pas so //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyis ni sku la sogs pas so //
translated: By all things means by the body and so forth.🔽Just as it is means without error.

original: thos pa ni le'u bcu bdun mnyan nas so //
analyzed: thos pa ni le'u bcu bdun mnyan nas so //
translated: Having heard means having listened to the seventeen chapters.

original: lta ba dang rtogs pa ni bsam pa dang sgom pas so //
analyzed: lta ba dang rtogs pa ni bsam pa dang sgom pas so //
translated: Seeing and realizing are by means of reflection and meditation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad ni me bskyod pa la sogs pa rdo rje 'chang chen po dang / rgyud tha mi dad pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad ni me bskyod pa la sogs pa rdo rje 'chang chen po dang / rgyud tha mi dad pa /
translated: All those Tathagatas are inseparable from the lineage of Great Vajradhara, such as Akshobhya, etc.

original: mthong ba chos zhas bya ba ni tshe 'di nyid du rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang stsol ba la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mthong ba chos zhas bya ba ni tshe 'di nyid du rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang stsol ba la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The seeing of the Dharma is the attainment of the state of Great Vajradhara in this very life.

original: 'og nas bshad pa'i ched du brjod pa brjod do //
analyzed: 'og nas bshad pa'i ched du brjod pa brjod do //
translated: Having said thus, he uttered the following verse.

original: de ni sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sgrub pa'o //
translated: That is the accomplishment.

original: ae ma ho zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: ae ma ho zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: The word emaho means amazing!

original: kun du bzang po ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: kun du bzang po ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: The Samantabhadra is the Bhagavat Great Vajradhara.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi gtan la dbab pa ni tha mal pa'i lus la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi lha'i sku bskyed pa gang yin pa de ni ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi gtan la dbab pa ni tha mal pa'i lus la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi lha'i sku bskyed pa gang yin pa de ni ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: The determination of body, speech, and mind is the generation of the special deity body, etc. of the ordinary body, etc. That is amazing.

original: de bzhin du sku la sogs pa de rnams kyang rdo rje gsum ste de bzhin gshegs pa gsum gyi rang bzhin gsum ni khams gsum gyi rang bzhin rdo rje 'chang chen po la kun du zhugs zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi bdag nyid du gyur cing zhugs
analyzed: de bzhin du sku la sogs pa de rnams kyang rdo rje gsum ste de bzhin gshegs pa gsum gyi rang bzhin gsum ni khams gsum gyi rang bzhin rdo rje 'chang chen po la kun du zhugs zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi bdag nyid du gyur cing zhugs
translated: Likewise, those bodies, etc. are the three vajras, and the three natures of the three transcendent lords are fully entered into Great Vajradhara, the nature of the three realms.

original: te ro gcig par gyur pa de yang ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: te ro gcig par gyur pa de yang ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: This means that he has become the nature of the three realms and has entered into them, and that is also marvelous.

original: de ni bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag go //
analyzed: de ni bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag go //
translated: That is the creation and completion stages.

original: de 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad de ji srid sems can thams cad ni khams kyi nang na gnas pa sgo nga las skyes pa la sogs rdo rje 'chang ni 'od zer gyis rig pa rdo rje 'chang chen po dang 'dra bar 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad de ji srid sems can thams cad ni khams kyi nang na gnas pa sgo nga las skyes pa la sogs rdo rje 'chang ni 'od zer gyis rig pa rdo rje 'chang chen po dang 'dra bar 'byung ba'o //
translated: Not only that, but as long as all sentient beings abide in the elements, they are born from eggs, etc., and Vajradhara is born from light rays, like Great Vajradhara.

original: de bzhin du dus gsum gyi rdo rje'i ngo bo ni dus gsum la gnas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dus gsum gyi rdo rje'i ngo bo ni dus gsum la gnas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: Likewise, the nature of the vajra of the three times is the arising of the transcendent lords abiding in the three times.

original: de nyid kyi phyir byang chub rdo rje ni rdo rje 'chang chen po ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir byang chub rdo rje ni rdo rje 'chang chen po ste /
translated: Therefore, the great Vajradhara is the enlightenment vajra.

original: de'i gnas ni de dang 'dra bar thob pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnas ni de dang 'dra bar thob pa'o //
translated: His abode is the attainment of that.

original: sangs rgyas rdo rje ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub dang rdzu 'phrul che ni 'jig rten gyi dngos grub ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rdo rje ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub dang rdzu 'phrul che ni 'jig rten gyi dngos grub ste /
translated: The buddha vajra is the supramundane attainment, and the great magic is the mundane attainment.

original: sems can thams cad kyis de thob par gyur pa de ni ngo mtshar to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis de thob par gyur pa de ni ngo mtshar to //
translated: The attainment of all sentient beings of that is amazing.

original: de ni bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag go //
analyzed: de ni bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag go //
translated: That is the generation and perfection stages.

original: de bzhin du ae ma ni ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ae ma ni ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: Similarly, ema is amazing.

original: 'di rab ngo mtshar che ni 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis rdo rje nyid thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rab ngo mtshar che ni 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis rdo rje nyid thob pa'o //
translated: This is the great wonder, the attainment of the vajra through the process of entry, and so forth.

original: de bzhin du zhi ba ni rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin dang / rang bzhin 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid de 'od gsal ba dbang po las 'das pa ni @286b dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa las 'das pa thob pa de yang ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhi ba ni rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin dang / rang bzhin 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid de 'od gsal ba dbang po las 'das pa ni @286b dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa las 'das pa thob pa de yang ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: Likewise, peace is the nature of consciousness, and the characteristic of the cessation of nature is the attainment of the clear light, which is beyond the senses, beyond the concepts of sense objects and consciousness. That is also marvelous.

original: de nas 'khor ba dag gi rgyun ni de bzhin du mchog ni 'od gsal ba las byung ba sgyu ma'i rang bzhin ye shes kyi sku'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de yang sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: de nas 'khor ba dag gi rgyun ni de bzhin du mchog ni 'od gsal ba las byung ba sgyu ma'i rang bzhin ye shes kyi sku'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de yang sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: Then, the continuum of cyclic existence is just so. The supreme is that which arises from the clear light, which has the characteristic of the body of gnosis with the nature of illusion. That also is marvelous, endowed with the ability to act for the benefit of all sentient beings.

original: de bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rim gyis de nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid mya ngan las 'das pa ni thar pa'i ngo bo bzhin pa'i mtshan nyid de kho na nyid thob pa de yang ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rim gyis de nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid mya ngan las 'das pa ni thar pa'i ngo bo bzhin pa'i mtshan nyid de kho na nyid thob pa de yang ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: Likewise, nirvana, which has the characteristic of the pacification of desire and so on, is the nature of liberation, and the attainment of that reality, which has the characteristic of bliss, is also marvelous.

original: yang na 'khor ba dag gi rgyun ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa sprul pa'i sku rgyun gyis rtag pa las 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa'i phyir gnas pa ste /
analyzed: yang na 'khor ba dag gi rgyun ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa sprul pa'i sku rgyun gyis rtag pa las 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa'i phyir gnas pa ste /
translated: Or else, the continuum of the purification of cyclic existence is the eternal abiding of the continuum of the emanation body, the non-abiding nirvana, because it acts for the welfare of living beings.

original: zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de ni ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de ni ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: That meditative stabilization of union is the wonder.

original: de ni rdo rje bzlas pa dang sems la dmigs pa dang / bdag la byin gyis brlab dang / mchod par byang chub pa dang / zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rdo rje bzlas pa dang sems la dmigs pa dang / bdag la byin gyis brlab dang / mchod par byang chub pa dang / zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That is the stage of vajra repetition, the observation of mind, the consecration of oneself, the enlightenment of offering, and the union.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gsan nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gsan nas /
translated: Having heard the words of the bodhisattvas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rdo rje 'chang chen po dang gcig tu gyur pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rdo rje 'chang chen po dang gcig tu gyur pas so //
translated: all the tathagatas become one with Akshobhya and so forth, the great vajra holders.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bka' stsal pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bka' stsal pa ni /
translated: They address the bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byams pa la sogs pa ste bod pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byams pa la sogs pa ste bod pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas are Maitreya and so forth.

original: de de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar khyod kyis bshad pa de de ltar yin gyis gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar khyod kyis bshad pa de de ltar yin gyis gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: “It is just so” means that just as you have explained, it is just so, not otherwise.

original: 'di ltar bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bshad pa yin te /
translated: It is explained like this:

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gi tshig gis don bcu drug bshad pa'i rim gyis rgyud kyi rgyal po bstan pa de bzhin du khyod kyis kyang thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i rim gyis mngon du byas so zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gi tshig gis don bcu drug bshad pa'i rim gyis rgyud kyi rgyal po bstan pa de bzhin du khyod kyis kyang thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i rim gyis mngon du byas so zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to
translated: Just as the Bhagavān Vajradhara explained the sixteen topics in sequence, in the same way, you have actualized them through the stages of hearing, reflection, and meditation.🔽The meaning of the words is that.

original: // de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: // de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni bsam pa la sogs pa sems dpa' chen po ni 'dri ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pas 'dus byas bar gyur pa ni gcig tu gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni bsam pa la sogs pa sems dpa' chen po ni 'dri ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pas 'dus byas bar gyur pa ni gcig tu gyur te /
translated: The bodhisattva, the great being, with the intention to ask, became of one mind with the Bhagavān.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa la /
translated: All tathāgatas are Akṣobhya, etc.

original: gsang ba dang phyi'i mchod pa dang bdud rtsi dang mchod pa lngas mchod cing phyag byas te 'dud cing bstod nas /
analyzed: gsang ba dang phyi'i mchod pa dang bdud rtsi dang mchod pa lngas mchod cing phyag byas te 'dud cing bstod nas /
translated: Having made offerings with the secret, outer, and five nectars, having bowed, having bowed down, having praised,

original: mgrin gcig ni dbyangs gcig gis gsol ba ni 'di skad zhus so //
analyzed: mgrin gcig ni dbyangs gcig gis gsol ba ni 'di skad zhus so //
translated: with one voice, with one melody, they made this request:

original: de ni las kyi rgyal ba mchog go //🔽kye bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs @287a * //
analyzed: de ni las kyi rgyal ba mchog go // kye bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs @287a * //
translated: This is the supreme king of actions.

original: pa thams cad 'di'i gsang ba 'dus pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pa thams cad 'di'i gsang ba 'dus pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: O Bhagavān, all tathāgatas, this is called the Guhyasamāja.

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po shin tu rnyed par dka' ba ni sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa 'od srungs kyi dus su yang ma gsungs pa'i phyir nye bar dka' ba'o //
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po shin tu rnyed par dka' ba ni sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa 'od srungs kyi dus su yang ma gsungs pa'i phyir nye bar dka' ba'o //
translated: The king of tantras, extremely difficult to find, is difficult to approach because it was not taught even in the time of the previous Tathāgata Kāśyapa, as explained before.

original: dam tshig gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dam tshig yin gyi bya ba mang ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dam tshig gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dam tshig yin gyi bya ba mang ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is a pledge because it is the principal pledge, not because of many actions.

original: thabs mang ba yin pa'i phyir thabs te /
analyzed: thabs mang ba yin pa'i phyir thabs te /
translated: It is a method because it has many methods.

original: de bas na byang chub sgrub pa ni rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang thob par byed pa'i rgyud ni bya ba dang rnal 'byor la sogs pa phyi ma'i phyi ma ste rnal 'byor phyi ma'i rgyud kyi yang phyi ma rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud do //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sgrub pa ni rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang thob par byed pa'i rgyud ni bya ba dang rnal 'byor la sogs pa phyi ma'i phyi ma ste rnal 'byor phyi ma'i rgyud kyi yang phyi ma rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud do //
translated: Therefore, the tantra that is the cause for attaining the stage of Vajradhara, which is the accomplishment of enlightenment, is the Great Yoga Tantra, which is the later and later of the Action, Yoga, and so on tantras, that is, the later of the later Yoga Tantra.

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyi drin gyis ni kho bo cag gis re zhig rtogs so //

original: de dag sbyor bas na gsang ba ste /🔽sku gsung thugs ni rakta la sogs pa gsum gyis byin gyis brlabs pa ni rdo rje dang padma ste de dag sbyor ba ni gsang ba ste rgyu'o //
analyzed: de dag sbyor bas na gsang ba ste / sku gsung thugs ni rakta la sogs pa gsum gyis byin gyis brlabs pa ni rdo rje dang padma ste de dag sbyor ba ni gsang ba ste rgyu'o //
translated: Since they are united, it is secret.🔽The body, speech, and mind are the secret cause, since the blessing of the three, such as the red one, and so on, is the vajra and lotus, and their union is secret.

original: h'um dang phat la sogs pa'i yi ge gsum gyis bskyed cing de nyid kyis mtshan pa rdo rje dang padma bskyod pa ni gsang ba ste las so //
analyzed: h'um dang phat la sogs pa'i yi ge gsum gyis bskyed cing de nyid kyis mtshan pa rdo rje dang padma bskyod pa ni gsang ba ste las so //
translated: The secret action is the movement of the vajra and lotus, which are generated by the three syllables, such as hūṃ and phaṭ, and marked by them.

original: sku gsung thugs gsum ni bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin zhi ba rtogs pas na gsang ba ste 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs gsum ni bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin zhi ba rtogs pas na gsang ba ste 'bras bu'o //
translated: The three, body, speech, and mind, are the secret, that is, the result, because of the realization of peace, the nature of great bliss.

original: yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa ni gsum ste /
translated: The three are the object, the sense faculty, and the consciousness.

original: de dag phrad pas yul der nye bar spyod cing sku la sogs pa bde ba bskyed pas na gsang ba ste so sor sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de dag phrad pas yul der nye bar spyod cing sku la sogs pa bde ba bskyed pas na gsang ba ste so sor sdud pa'o //
translated: The secret, that is, the withdrawal, is the enjoyment of that object through the union of those three, and the production of the bliss of the body, etc.

original: de nyid kyi sku la sogs pa gsum gyi rang bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid du rtogs pa ni gsang ba ste bsam gtan no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi sku la sogs pa gsum gyi rang bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid du rtogs pa ni gsang ba ste bsam gtan no //
translated: The secret, that is, the concentration, is the realization of the nature of those three, body, etc., as the identity of the five transcendent lords.🔽The secret, that is, the life-force and exertion, is the emission and re-absorption of the drop, the nature of the three, body, etc., the size of a mustard seed, through the process of going and coming by the process of entry, etc., and through the process of union by the process of emission and re-absorption.

original: 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim pas 'gro ba dang 'od pa'i rim pas sbyor ba sku la sogs pa gsum gyi rang bzhin yungs kar gyi 'bras bu'i tshad tsam gyi thig le spro ba dang / sdud pa ni gsang ba ste srog dang rtsol ba'o //🔽sku la sogs pa @289a * //
analyzed: 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim pas 'gro ba dang 'od pa'i rim pas sbyor ba sku la sogs pa gsum gyi rang bzhin yungs kar gyi 'bras bu'i tshad tsam gyi thig le spro ba dang / sdud pa ni gsang ba ste srog dang rtsol ba'o //🔽sku la sogs pa @289a * //
translated: The three, body, etc., are the secret, that is, the retention, because of the retention of the bliss of the body, etc., through the process of emission and re-absorption of the drop.🔽The three, body, etc., are the secret, that is, the recollection, because of the recollection of the bliss of the body, etc., through the process of emission and re-absorption of the drop.🔽The three, body, etc., are the secret, that is, the contemplation, because of the contemplation of the bliss of the body, etc., through the process of emission and re-absorption of the drop.

original: gsum nye bar sdud par byed pas rdo rje la sogs pa sna rtse gsum la thig le 'dzin pa ni gsang ba ste 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gsum nye bar sdud par byed pas rdo rje la sogs pa sna rtse gsum la thig le 'dzin pa ni gsang ba ste 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The secret is the retention of the drop at the three channel-wheels, the vajra and so forth, by means of the three inhalations.

original: sku la sogs pa gsum gyi ngo bo de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nam mkha'i khams la spro ba ni gsang ba ste rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa gsum gyi ngo bo de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nam mkha'i khams la spro ba ni gsang ba ste rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: The secret is the recollection of all the Tathagatas, the nature of the three, body and so forth, emanating in the realm of space.

original: sku la sogs pa gsum ste de nye bar sdud cing mos pa'i rnal 'byor gyis mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi ngo bo'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku dmigs pa ni gsang ba ste ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa gsum ste de nye bar sdud cing mos pa'i rnal 'byor gyis mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi ngo bo'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku dmigs pa ni gsang ba ste ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: The secret is the observation of the body of Great Vajradhara, the nature of the realm of nirvana without remainder, by means of the yoga of devotion and the gathering and dissolving of the three, body and so forth.

original: sku la sogs pa gsum ni bsrung ba dang bza' ba'i dam tshig nyams su blang ba ni gsang ba ste /
analyzed: sku la sogs pa gsum ni bsrung ba dang bza' ba'i dam tshig nyams su blang ba ni gsang ba ste /
translated: The secret is the practice of the commitments of protection and eating, the three, body and so forth.

original: dam tshig dang sku la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi sdom pa blang bas zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs kyi sgrub pa ni gsang ba ste sdom pa yin no zhes sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig dang sku la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi sdom pa blang bas zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs kyi sgrub pa ni gsang ba ste sdom pa yin no zhes sgrub pa'o //
translated: The practice of the collection of rites of pacification, etc., by taking the vow of the Tathagata's family of body, etc., is the secret, i.e., the vow.

original: de ltar gsang ba'i sgras tshig gi don bcu drug bstan pas rgyud kyi don ma lus pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gsang ba'i sgras tshig gi don bcu drug bstan pas rgyud kyi don ma lus pa bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, by teaching the sixteen topics with the word secret, the entire meaning of the tantra is taught.

original: 'dus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'dus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Assembly and so on.

original: 'dus pa sdud par byed pas na 'dus pa ste mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa sdud par byed pas na 'dus pa ste mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: Assembly is the brief teaching, because it is the gathering of the collection.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad phung po'am de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad phung po'am de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'dus pa ste /
translated: All the Buddhas are the collection of aggregates or the Tathagatas.

original: de ni rgyud kyi rgyal po de'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni rgyud kyi rgyal po de'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That is the definition of that king of tantras.

original: zla ba dang nyi ma dang sa bon dang mtshan ma dang spro ba dang sku bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma dang sa bon dang mtshan ma dang spro ba dang sku bskyed pa ste /
translated: The five manifest enlightenments are moon, sun, seed, sign, and emanation of the body.

original: mngon par byang chub pa lnga dang / de bzhin gshegs pa lnga spro ba dang bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa lnga dang / de bzhin gshegs pa lnga spro ba dang bsdu ba ste /
translated: The five Tathagatas are emanation and gathering.

original: dang po sbyor ba dang / dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog go //
analyzed: dang po sbyor ba dang / dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog go //
translated: The first is the yoga, the supreme victor mandala.

original: sku rdzogs nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bzhugs pa ni 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: sku rdzogs nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bzhugs pa ni 'dus pa ste /
translated: The gathering is the abiding of all the tathagatas after the body is complete.

original: las kyi rgyal pa mchog go //
analyzed: las kyi rgyal pa mchog go //
translated: The supreme victor activity.

original: rtsa rgyus stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis las byang chub kyi sems spro bas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rang bzhin khams gsum pa bskyed pas na 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: rtsa rgyus stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis las byang chub kyi sems spro bas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rang bzhin khams gsum pa bskyed pas na 'dus pa ste /
translated: The gathering is the generation of the three realms, which is the nature of all buddhas, through the emission of bodhicitta from the seventy-two thousand channels.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That is the stage of generation.

original: thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pas rjes su chags pa mchog gi sgras rgyal ba ma lus pa'i tshogs zhugs shing rdo rje nor bu'i rtse mor ro gcig par gyur pa byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le'i ngo bo ni 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pas rjes su chags pa mchog gi sgras rgyal ba ma lus pa'i tshogs zhugs shing rdo rje nor bu'i rtse mor ro gcig par gyur pa byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le'i ngo bo ni 'dus pa ste /
translated: The gathering is the essence of the bindu of bodhicitta, which is the single taste of all the hosts of victors, entering the tip of the vajra jewel through the melting bliss of the union of method and prajña.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That is the stage of completion.

original: yang na rdo rje'i lam nas byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le spro zhing padma'i lte ba'i nang du dkyil 'khor pa'i lha'i gzugs su dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor spro ba ni 'dus pa ste bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rdo rje'i lam nas byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le spro zhing padma'i lte ba'i nang du dkyil 'khor pa'i lha'i gzugs su dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor spro ba ni 'dus pa ste bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: Or else, the “gathering” is the creation of the mandala of deities in the form of the mandala of pledges, in the form of the mandala of deities in the center of the lotus, by the emission of the bindu of bodhicitta through the vajra path.

original: phyir mi @289b ldog pa'i dbang gi dus su slob ma'i tshangs pa'i sgo nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad zhugs pa ni 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: phyir mi @289b ldog pa'i dbang gi dus su slob ma'i tshangs pa'i sgo nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad zhugs pa ni 'dus pa ste /
translated: The “gathering” is the entry of all the tathagatas into the brahma aperture of the disciple at the time of the irreversible initiation.

original: las kyi rgyal ba mchog go //
analyzed: las kyi rgyal ba mchog go //
translated: This is the supreme king of deeds.

original: yi ge phyi mo bzhi bcu rtsa dgu po pho dang ma ning gi rtags kyi rang bzhin yi ge gsum gyis bsdus pas na 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: yi ge phyi mo bzhi bcu rtsa dgu po pho dang ma ning gi rtags kyi rang bzhin yi ge gsum gyis bsdus pas na 'dus pa ste /
translated: The “gathering” is the inclusion of the forty-nine outer vowels and consonants, which are the nature of the male and neuter signs, by the three syllables.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the stage of vajra repetition.

original: rang bzhin brgya drug cu shes rab dang thabs dang ma rig pa gsum gyis bsdus pa na 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin brgya drug cu shes rab dang thabs dang ma rig pa gsum gyis bsdus pa na 'dus pa ste /
translated: The “gathering” is the inclusion of the one hundred and sixty natures by the three: method, wisdom, and ignorance.

original: sems la dmigs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: sems la dmigs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the stage of observing the mind.

original: khams gsum pa'am /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'am /
translated: The “gathering” is the inclusion of the three realms by the three: method, wisdom, and ignorance.🔽This is the stage of the creation process.

original: sku gsum ni sgyu ma lta bu nyid kyi sa bsdus pas na 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: sku gsum ni sgyu ma lta bu nyid kyi sa bsdus pas na 'dus pa ste /
translated: The three bodies are the gathering, since they are included in the stage of the illusion-like.

original: bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the stage of self-consecration.

original: chags pa la sogs pa 'od gsal bas bsdus pas na 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa 'od gsal bas bsdus pas na 'dus pa ste /
translated: The gathering is the gathering of passion, etc. , since it is included in clearlight transparency.

original: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the stage of manifest enlightenment.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa bsdus pa'i 'dus pa ste zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa bsdus pa'i 'dus pa ste zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The gathering is the gathering of the conventional and the ultimate, the stage of union.

original: thabs dang shes rab yang dag par sbyor ba'i 'dus pa ste rgyu'o //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab yang dag par sbyor ba'i 'dus pa ste rgyu'o //
translated: The gathering is the gathering of means and insight, the cause.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad ni aom la sogs pa dgod cing rdo rje dang padma bskyod pa ni 'dus te las so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad ni aom la sogs pa dgod cing rdo rje dang padma bskyod pa ni 'dus te las so //
translated: The gathering is the shaking of the vajra and lotus by the placement of Om, etc. , in all the buddhas, the action.

original: phung po la sogs pa thams cad sdud pa bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa thams cad sdud pa bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The gathering is the nature of great bliss, the gathering of all aggregates, etc.

original: don dam pa ni 'dus pa ste 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: don dam pa ni 'dus pa ste 'bras bu'o //
translated: The gathering is the ultimate, the result.

original: yul dang dbang po 'dus pa ste so sor sdud pa'o //
analyzed: yul dang dbang po 'dus pa ste so sor sdud pa'o //
translated: The gathering is the gathering of the object and the subject, the individual withdrawal.

original: de dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par bsgom pa ni 'dus pa ste bsam gtan no //
analyzed: de dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par bsgom pa ni 'dus pa ste bsam gtan no //
translated: The gathering is the meditation on the Tathagatas, the meditative stabilization.

original: khams thams cad kyi rang bzhin byang chub kyi sems yan lag thams cad las bskul te /
analyzed: khams thams cad kyi rang bzhin byang chub kyi sems yan lag thams cad las bskul te /
translated: The nature of all constituents is the thought of awakening, which is aroused from all the limbs.

original: sna rtse gsum gyi gzhir bsdu zhing 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis spro ba dang / bsdu bar bya ba ni 'dus pa ste srog dang rtsol ba'o //
analyzed: sna rtse gsum gyi gzhir bsdu zhing 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis spro ba dang / bsdu bar bya ba ni 'dus pa ste srog dang rtsol ba'o //
translated: The gathering and entering at the base of the three nose-tips and so forth is the process of emanating and gathering.

original: de nyid 'jug pa la sogs pa dang bral zhing dang ba mar me'i rtse mo dang 'dra bar rgyun gyis bsdus pa ste 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'jug pa la sogs pa dang bral zhing dang ba mar me'i rtse mo dang 'dra bar rgyun gyis bsdus pa ste 'dzin pa'o //
translated: That very [wind] is free from entering and so forth, and is clear like the tip of a flame, and is gathered and held by a continuum.

original: de nyid las sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' spro zhing nam mkha'i dbyings la khams gsum pa dkyil 'khor gyi tshul du bsdus pa ni 'dus pa ste rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid las sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' spro zhing nam mkha'i dbyings la khams gsum pa dkyil 'khor gyi tshul du bsdus pa ni 'dus pa ste rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: From that very [wind], buddhas and bodhisattvas emanate and gather in the realm of space in the manner of a mandala of the three realms. That is the gathering, which is recollection.

original: de dag nye bar bsdu zhing sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rang bzhin rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sngar bsdus pa ni 'dus pa ste ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de dag nye bar bsdu zhing sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rang bzhin rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sngar bsdus pa ni 'dus pa ste ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Gathering those [emanations] and gathering all buddhas into the nature of Great Vajradhara is the gathering, which is meditative concentration.

original: lcags kyu lnga dang rin chen lnga ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rang bzhin sbyang ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis byang chub kyi sems ngo bor bsdus pa ni 'dus pa ste sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: lcags kyu lnga dang rin chen lnga ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rang bzhin sbyang ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis byang chub kyi sems ngo bor bsdus pa ni 'dus pa ste sgrub pa'o //
translated: The five hooks and the five jewels are the gathering, the accomplishment, of the essence of the enlightenment spirit by the process of purification, etc., of the nature of all the Buddhas.

original: de ltar tshig gi don bcu drug gis @290a * //
analyzed: de ltar tshig gi don bcu drug gis @290a * //
translated: Thus, by the sixteen topics,

original: ston par byed pa gsang ba 'dus pa'i tshig 'di dag ni rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba'i bdag nyid ni dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud yin no //
analyzed: ston par byed pa gsang ba 'dus pa'i tshig 'di dag ni rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba'i bdag nyid ni dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud yin no //
translated: these words of the Guhyasamaja, which are the means of teaching, are the glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra, which is the nature of the means of expression and the object of expression.

original: de la rjod par byed pa ni 'dus pa'i tshig yin la gsang ba'i tshig ni de'i khyad par du gyur pa yin na yang brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de la rjod par byed pa ni 'dus pa'i tshig yin la gsang ba'i tshig ni de'i khyad par du gyur pa yin na yang brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therein, the words of the Guhyasamaja are the means of expression, and the words of the secret are its particularities, but they are also the object of expression.

original: da ni 'brel pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni 'brel pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: Now, the connection is to be taught.

original: le'u thams cad rnam par dbye bas gnas shing gsum bor zhing 'bral bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: le'u thams cad rnam par dbye bas gnas shing gsum bor zhing 'bral bar shes par bya'o //
translated: All the chapters should be known as connected by the division of the topics, and as separated by the three.

original: de nyid lnga pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid lnga pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Just that is stated in the five, etc.

original: lnga pa ni spyod pa'i le'u dang / dgu pa ni de las gsungs pa'i rdo rje'i tshig nges par bshad pa'i mtshan nyid 'gal ba'i rnal 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi le'u dang / bcu bdun pa dam tshig dang sdom pa'i le'u dang / bcu gsum pa ni las rab 'byam gyi le'u rnams so //
analyzed: lnga pa ni spyod pa'i le'u dang / dgu pa ni de las gsungs pa'i rdo rje'i tshig nges par bshad pa'i mtshan nyid 'gal ba'i rnal 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi le'u dang / bcu bdun pa dam tshig dang sdom pa'i le'u dang / bcu gsum pa ni las rab 'byam gyi le'u rnams so //
translated: and the thirteenth is the chapter on the various activities.

original: sangs rgyas ni rdzogs pa'i rnal ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni ma rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis bstan pa sgrub pa ni 'dul bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni rdzogs pa'i rnal ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni ma rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis bstan pa sgrub pa ni 'dul bar byed pa ste /
translated: The buddhas are the teachers of the perfect yogas, and the bodhisattvas are the teachers of the imperfect yogas.

original: de bas na gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa gtso bo yin pas chen po ste mchog go //
analyzed: de bas na gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa gtso bo yin pas chen po ste mchog go //
translated: Therefore, since the perfection of the welfare of others is the most important, it is great, or supreme.

original: gang gi phyir spyod pa rnam pa gsum gyis gdug pa la sogs pa pha rol gyi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'gugs pa dang / zhi ba la sogs pa las rab 'byam dang / dam tshig dang sdom pa'i sgo nas kyang rnal 'byor pas sems can gyi don bya'o zhes sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir spyod pa rnam pa gsum gyis gdug pa la sogs pa pha rol gyi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'gugs pa dang / zhi ba la sogs pa las rab 'byam dang / dam tshig dang sdom pa'i sgo nas kyang rnal 'byor pas sems can gyi don bya'o zhes sgrub pa'o //
translated: Since the three kinds of conduct summon the consciousness, etc., of others, such as the wicked, and since the yogin should benefit sentient beings by means of the rites of pacification, etc., and by means of the commitments and vows, this is the proof.

original: de bzhin du bzhi pa ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi le'u dang / bcu drug pa ni sku dang gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi le'u dang / brgyad pa ni gsang ba'i dbang ba bskur gyi le'u dang / bcu gnyis pa ni phyag rgya chen po yongs su gyur pa'i le'u ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bzhi pa ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi le'u dang / bcu drug pa ni sku dang gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi le'u dang / brgyad pa ni gsang ba'i dbang ba bskur gyi le'u dang / bcu gnyis pa ni phyag rgya chen po yongs su gyur pa'i le'u ste /
translated: Similarly, the fourth chapter is the chapter on the mind mandala, the sixteenth chapter is the chapter on the body and speech mandalas, the eighth chapter is the chapter on conferring the secret initiation, and the twelfth chapter is the chapter on the transformation of the great seal.

original: slob dpon gyi lan ni slob dpon gyi bya ba dang / spyi'i las ni slob ma rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir dngos grub bstan pa dang / brtul zhugs ni ji ltar mos pa dkyil 'khor la zhugs pa dang / sdom pa ni lha'i rnam pa bsgom par bya ba ste bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi lan ni slob dpon gyi bya ba dang / spyi'i las ni slob ma rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir dngos grub bstan pa dang / brtul zhugs ni ji ltar mos pa dkyil 'khor la zhugs pa dang / sdom pa ni lha'i rnam pa bsgom par bya ba ste bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The master's reply is the master's duties, the general duties are the teaching of powers for the sake of taking care of the disciples, the observances are entering the mandala according to one's faith, and the vows are the meditation on the deity's form, which is the creation stage.

original: de ni dang po sbyor ba dang las kyi rgyal ba mchog dang sgrub pa rnams so //
analyzed: de ni dang po sbyor ba dang las kyi rgyal ba mchog dang sgrub pa rnams so //
translated: The first is the chapter on the yoga of the rite, the second is the chapter on the supreme victor of the rite, and the third is the chapter on the practice.

original: bdun pa ni spyod pa'i khyad par gyi le'u dang / gsum pa ni lha'i le'u dang / bcu gcig pa ni sngags kyi rgyu dang ye shes sku'i le'u dang / bco lnga pa ni sgyu ma lta bu'i lha'i sku'i le'u ste /
analyzed: bdun pa ni spyod pa'i khyad par gyi le'u dang / gsum pa ni lha'i le'u dang / bcu gcig pa ni sngags kyi rgyu dang ye shes sku'i le'u dang / bco lnga pa ni sgyu ma lta bu'i lha'i sku'i le'u ste /
translated: The seventh is the chapter on the distinctive conduct, the third is the chapter on the deity, the eleventh is the chapter on the cause of mantra and the gnosis body, and the fifteenth is the chapter on the illusory deity body.

original: dngos grub kyi zhing ni rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa lha'i sku'i rtags ni rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dngos grub kyi zhing ni rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa lha'i sku'i rtags ni rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: The field of power is the cause of the signs of the deity body of Vajradhara and so on.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bsnyen pa sgrub pa'i sdom pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku sgrub par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bsnyen pa sgrub pa'i sdom pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku sgrub par byed pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the vow of the approach and accomplishment is the accomplishment of the body of the Tathagata.

original: rang gi don sgrub par byed pa'i gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: rang gi don sgrub par byed pa'i gtso bo yin no //
translated: It is the principal means of accomplishing one's own goal.

original: gang gi phyir spyod pa dang rtogs pa'i lha pa bsgom pa dang / rtog pa dang po yongs su rdzogs pa'i lha bsgom pa dang / sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis tha mal ba'i sku rnam par dag pas khyad par lha'i go 'phang thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir spyod pa dang rtogs pa'i lha pa bsgom pa dang / rtog pa dang po yongs su rdzogs pa'i lha bsgom pa dang / sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis tha mal ba'i sku rnam par dag pas khyad par lha'i go 'phang thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Because of that, the deity of practice and realization is cultivated, the deity of the complete first imagination is cultivated, and the deity of the attainment of the special stage by the purification of the ordinary body through the illusion-like concentration is cultivated.

original: de ni bsgrub pa dang / bskyed pa'i rim pa dang / bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bsgrub pa dang / bskyed pa'i rim pa dang / bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That is the accomplishment, the creation stage, and the stage of self-consecration.

original: de ltar bdun pa la sogs pas rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa dang / drug pa la sogs pas de nyid kyi thabs kyi phun sum tshogs pa dang / lnga pa la sogs pas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang / bzhi pa la sogs pas de nyid kyi thabs kyi phun sum tshogs pa bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdun pa la sogs pas rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa dang / drug pa la sogs pas de nyid kyi thabs kyi phun sum tshogs pa dang / lnga pa la sogs pas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang / bzhi pa la sogs pas de nyid kyi thabs kyi phun sum tshogs pa bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should accomplish the perfection of one's own aim by the seventh stage, etc., the perfection of the means to that by the sixth stage, etc., the perfection of the aim of others by the fifth stage, etc., and the perfection of the means to that by the fourth stage, etc.

original: de ltar rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa dang ; gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang / de gnyis ka'i thabs kyi phun sum tshogs pa gtso bor gyur pa'i le'u bstan pa ni 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa dang ; gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang / de gnyis ka'i thabs kyi phun sum tshogs pa gtso bor gyur pa'i le'u bstan pa ni 'brel pa'o //
translated: Thus, the chapter is related as the perfection of one's own aim, the perfection of the aim of others, and the perfection of the means for both of those.

original: de'i le'u dang po ni 'bras bur 'gyur ba ste /🔽'brel pa'i nang du ma bsdus pa dang / de'i le'u bco brgyad pa ni rdo rje tshig rnam par bshad @291a * //
analyzed: de'i le'u dang po ni 'bras bur 'gyur ba ste / 'brel pa'i nang du ma bsdus pa dang / de'i le'u bco brgyad pa ni rdo rje tshig rnam par bshad @291a * //
translated: The first chapter is the result.

original: pa'i sgo nas rnams par grol ba'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: pa'i sgo nas rnams par grol ba'i bdag nyid de /
translated: The eighteenth chapter is the nature of liberation by way of the explanation of the vajra words.

original: de ni 'brel pa brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'brel pa brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not the expression of the relation.

original: kha cig na re le'u bzhi ni bsnyen pa la sogs pa yan lag bzhi brjod pa zer ba de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: kha cig na re le'u bzhi ni bsnyen pa la sogs pa yan lag bzhi brjod pa zer ba de ni mi rigs te /
translated: Some say that the four chapters are the expression of the four branches of service and so forth. That is not correct.

original: gang gi phyir bsnyen pa la sogs pa spangs pa ni le'u gcig kyang mi dmigs te ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir bsnyen pa la sogs pa spangs pa ni le'u gcig kyang mi dmigs te ;
translated: Because the abandonment of service and so forth is not observed in any chapter,

original: thams cad de nyid gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir dang / khas blangs na yang 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad de nyid gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir dang / khas blangs na yang 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because, if accepted, there would be confusion.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: gal te lnga la sogs pa sgrub pa chen po nyid du 'dod na de'i tshe yi ge dgod pa'i bdag nyid sgrub pa chen po med pa ste /
analyzed: gal te lnga la sogs pa sgrub pa chen po nyid du 'dod na de'i tshe yi ge dgod pa'i bdag nyid sgrub pa chen po med pa ste /
translated: If one asserts that the five and so on are the great accomplishment, then at that time there is no great accomplishment that is the nature of the arrangement of the syllables.

original: spyod pa dang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dgug pa dang las kyi rab tu dbye ba dang / dam tshig dang sdom pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyod pa dang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dgug pa dang las kyi rab tu dbye ba dang / dam tshig dang sdom pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the main thing is the division of the activities of summoning, consciousness, and so on, and the commitments and vows.

original: bzhi pa la sogs pa la dkyil 'khor la zhugs te slob ma rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i don du sku sgrub pa ni med de /
analyzed: bzhi pa la sogs pa la dkyil 'khor la zhugs te slob ma rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i don du sku sgrub pa ni med de /
translated: In the fourth and so on, there is no accomplishment of the body for the purpose of engaging in the maṇḍala and accepting the disciple.

original: stong pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because emptiness does not exist.

original: drug pa la sogs pa sa sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab par bsgrub pas ni sa bon bsdus pa'i bdag nyid ni nye bar sgrub pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: drug pa la sogs pa sa sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab par bsgrub pas ni sa bon bsdus pa'i bdag nyid ni nye bar sgrub pa mi rigs so //
translated: In the sixth and so on, it is not reasonable that the nature of the collected seed syllables is the approach, because the accomplishment of the consecration of the body and so on is accomplished.

original: de nas bdun pa la sogs pas rang gi don sgrub pa'i phyir lha'i sku bsgrubs na stong pa nyid ni bsnyen pa med do //
analyzed: de nas bdun pa la sogs pas rang gi don sgrub pa'i phyir lha'i sku bsgrubs na stong pa nyid ni bsnyen pa med do //
translated: Then, if the accomplishment of the deity’s body is accomplished in the seventh and so on for the sake of accomplishing one’s purpose, there is no approach of emptiness.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa rjod par byed pa la bsnyen pa la sogs pa la thabs dang shes rab snyoms par zhugs pa la sogs pa ni lnga pa la sogs pa'i don ma yin pa /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa rjod par byed pa la bsnyen pa la sogs pa la thabs dang shes rab snyoms par zhugs pa la sogs pa ni lnga pa la sogs pa'i don ma yin pa /
translated: In the stage of completion, the approach and so forth are not the meaning of the fifth stage and so forth, since they are the union of means and insight and so forth.

original: thabs bzhi pa'i rim gyis bsnyen pa la sogs pa mi rigs pa dang / dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga'i rim gyis bsnyen pa la sogs pa ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: thabs bzhi pa'i rim gyis bsnyen pa la sogs pa mi rigs pa dang / dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga'i rim gyis bsnyen pa la sogs pa ni mi rigs te /
translated: The approach and so forth by the process of the four means is not reasonable, and the approach and so forth by the process of the mandala rite is not reasonable.

original: ci'i phyir le'u bzhi pa la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga la sogs pa brjod cing /
analyzed: ci'i phyir le'u bzhi pa la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga la sogs pa brjod cing /
translated: Why is it that the mandala rite and so forth of the fourth chapter and so forth are described,

original: gzhan dag gis ni brjod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis ni brjod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and not by others?

original: gang gi phyir re zhig dang por bskyed pa'i rim pa la rdo rje bzhi pa'i rim pas stong pa nyid dang sa bon bsdus pa dang / gzugs rdzogs pa dang yi ge dgod pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid bsnyen pa la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir re zhig dang por bskyed pa'i rim pa la rdo rje bzhi pa'i rim pas stong pa nyid dang sa bon bsdus pa dang / gzugs rdzogs pa dang yi ge dgod pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid bsnyen pa la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Because the approach and so forth are the nature of the four vajra stages of the creation stage, namely, emptiness, the gathering of the seed, the complete form, and the placement of the letters, and so forth.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la sogs pa yang thabs dang shes rab dang / rdo rje padma dang yang dag par sbyor ba dang / de bskyod pa dang / bde ba chen po nyams su myong ba ni bsnyen pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la sogs pa yang thabs dang shes rab dang / rdo rje padma dang yang dag par sbyor ba dang / de bskyod pa dang / bde ba chen po nyams su myong ba ni bsnyen pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The perfection stage, etc. are also the means and insight, the union of the vajra and lotus, the shaking of that, and the experience of great bliss, which are the approach, etc.

original: de bzhin du rdzogs pa'i rim pa la yang yan lag drug pa'i rnal 'byor bsgom @291b pa ni bsnyen pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdzogs pa'i rim pa la yang yan lag drug pa'i rnal 'byor bsgom @291b pa ni bsnyen pa'o //
translated: Similarly, in the perfection stage, the cultivation of the yoga of the six-branched yoga is the approach.

original: de bzhin du bskyed pa'i rim pa yang bsdum pa dang / sbyin pa dang dbye ba dang / chad pa dang bzhi ni bsnyen pa dang / nye bar sgrub pa dang / sgrub pa dang / sgrub pa chen po yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bskyed pa'i rim pa yang bsdum pa dang / sbyin pa dang dbye ba dang / chad pa dang bzhi ni bsnyen pa dang / nye bar sgrub pa dang / sgrub pa dang / sgrub pa chen po yin no //
translated: Similarly, in the creation stage, the four: union, giving, separation, and cutting, are the approach, near attainment, attainment, and great attainment.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi skabs su yang gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba dang / bdud rtsi 'khyil pa dang / rang gi lhag pa'i lha dang / rdo rje 'chang sgom pa ni bsnyen pa la sogs pa yin no zhes bsdus nas bsnyen pa la sogs pas dbye ba bcu drug ni rim pa gnyis kyi nang du bsdus so //

translated: Having summarized in this way, the sixteen divisions of the approach and so forth are included within the two stages.

original: de dang 'dra ba le'u la sogs pa la med do zhes bsnyen pa la sogs pa rjod par byed pa ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba le'u la sogs pa la med do zhes bsnyen pa la sogs pa rjod par byed pa ni mi rigs so //
translated: But since they are not like that in the chapters and so forth, it is illogical to say that the approach and so forth are absent.

original: de bas na rang bzo nyid kyi 'chad pa pos 'jig rten pa'i 'khrul par byed de /
analyzed: de bas na rang bzo nyid kyi 'chad pa pos 'jig rten pa'i 'khrul par byed de /
translated: Therefore, the expounders of their own fabrications create worldly errors,🔽because they lack scripture and logic.

original: tshar gcod pa ni gcod pa la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa dang / mi bskyod pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du zhugs pa la sogs pa la 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / phan 'dogs pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i phrin las 'jig rten pa dang /
analyzed: tshar gcod pa ni gcod pa la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa dang / mi bskyod pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du zhugs pa la sogs pa la 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / phan 'dogs pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i phrin las 'jig rten pa dang /
translated: The subjugation of those to be subdued is mundane, such as cutting through the afflictions and so on, and supramundane, such as entering the buddhafield of Akshobhya and so on.🔽🔽The benefit of those to be benefited is mundane, such as the activity of pacifying and so on, and supramundane, such as the activity of increasing and so on.

analyzed: lha'i sku sgrub pa la sogs pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
translated: The subjugation is the mundane, such as the subjugation of Rudra, and the supramundane, such as entering the realm of Akshobhya Buddha. The benefit is the mundane, such as the activity of pacification, and the supramundane, such as accomplishing the deity's body.

original: rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang thob par bya ba'i phyir spyod pa ste nus pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang thob par bya ba'i phyir spyod pa ste nus pa'o //
translated: The conduct is the ability to practice for the sake of attaining the stage of Vajradhara.

original: 'dul ba la ni dad pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa gdul dka' ba ni dkon mchog gsum la gnod par byed pa dang ; zhi ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba'i sems can ni sgye bo rnams so //
analyzed: 'dul ba la ni dad pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa gdul dka' ba ni dkon mchog gsum la gnod par byed pa dang ; zhi ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba'i sems can ni sgye bo rnams so //
translated: The discipline is the difficult-to-tame ones who possess qualities such as faith and harm the Three Jewels, and the tame ones are sentient beings free from faults such as attachment.

original: 'jug pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis de kho na nyid la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir nyes par gsungs so zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis de kho na nyid la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir nyes par gsungs so zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The engagement is up to the Bhagavan spoke of faults for the sake of engaging in reality.

original: de bzhin du bskyed pa'i rim pa dang 'brel pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i sgo nas bsnyen pa la sogs pa rdo rje cho ga bzhi ni rdo rje bzhi'i rim gyis so //

translated: Similarly, the four vajra rites of approach, etc., in connection with the creation stage, are by the process of the four vajras, through the creation stage.

original: dngos grub thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i sku thun mong ste /
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i sku thun mong ste /
translated: All powers are the common body of the five transcendent lords.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa dang bsgrub pa'i bsgom pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi don bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir dang @292a * //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa dang bsgrub pa'i bsgom pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi don bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir dang @292a * //
translated: The creation stage and the cultivation of the practice taught by the Lord are for the sake of accomplishing one's own goal.

original: 'brel pa'i gzhung nyid de /
analyzed: 'brel pa'i gzhung nyid de /
translated: This is the text of the connection.

original: le'u'i rim pas dgongs pa de ni bdag gi don to //
analyzed: le'u'i rim pas dgongs pa de ni bdag gi don to //
translated: The intention of the chapter sequence is one's own goal.

original: de ni dang po sbyor ba la sogs pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de ni dang po sbyor ba la sogs pa gsum mo //
translated: That is the three beginning with the first union.

original: dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa dkyil 'khor ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa la zhugs pa'i slob ma la slob dpon gyis /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa dkyil 'khor ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa la zhugs pa'i slob ma la slob dpon gyis /
translated: The master, for the disciples who have entered the mind mandala, etc., should explain the mandala and so forth.

original: brtul zhugs ni sdom pa la sogs pa dang / 'brel pa ni rig pa'i dbang bskur ba sngon du 'gro ba'i thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa'i dbang bskur dang / gzhung ni dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid pa'i tshig dang / slob dpon phun sum tshogs pa ni rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa sgrub par byed pa de bzhin gshegs pa dang /🔽rdo rje 'chang gnyis kyi dbugs dbyung ba ston cing bla mas sngags kyi lam nas te /
analyzed: brtul zhugs ni sdom pa la sogs pa dang / 'brel pa ni rig pa'i dbang bskur ba sngon du 'gro ba'i thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa'i dbang bskur dang / gzhung ni dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid pa'i tshig dang / slob dpon phun sum tshogs pa ni rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa sgrub par byed pa de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rdo rje 'chang gnyis kyi dbugs dbyung ba ston cing bla mas sngags kyi lam nas te /
translated: The conduct is the vows and so on, the connection is the empowerment conferred by the union of method and wisdom preceded by the conferral of the knowledge empowerment, the scripture is the words of the reality of the mandala, and the perfect master is the one who accomplishes the perfect benefit of self and other.🔽The disciples are the ones to be trained.

original: gsang ba 'dus pa'i cho ga slob ma yongs su smin par bya ba ni gdul bar bya ba gang yin pa de ni dgos pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: gsang ba 'dus pa'i cho ga slob ma yongs su smin par bya ba ni gdul bar bya ba gang yin pa de ni dgos pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The disciples who are fully ripened by the Guhyasamaja ritual are the ones to be trained.

original: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bsgrub pa bshad do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bsgrub pa bshad do //
translated: The perfect benefit of others is explained.

original: dgos pa'i dgos pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: dgos pa'i dgos pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: The purpose of the purpose should be explained.

original: brtul zhugs bzang po ni sdom pa dang ldan pa dang / dbang bskur ba ni dbang thob pa dang / bdag nyid che ba ni thos pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang rtogs pas so //
analyzed: brtul zhugs bzang po ni sdom pa dang ldan pa dang / dbang bskur ba ni dbang thob pa dang / bdag nyid che ba ni thos pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang rtogs pas so //
translated: The good conduct is the possession of the vows. The initiation is the attainment of the consecration. The greatness of self is the realization of the state of Vajradhara by the stages of hearing, etc.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i ni dbang po rno ba dang bar pa dang / dman pa rnams la bstan pa'i sgo nas yongs su grol ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa rnam par dag cing 'od gsal ba nyid du bya ba gang yin pa de ni dgos pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i ni dbang po rno ba dang bar pa dang / dman pa rnams la bstan pa'i sgo nas yongs su grol ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa rnam par dag cing 'od gsal ba nyid du bya ba gang yin pa de ni dgos pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The complete liberation of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, who are of sharp, middling, and dull faculties, is the purification of passion, etc., and the making of them into clear light, which is the purpose.

original: bsgrub pa'o // shes rab ces bya ba la sogs pa shes rab ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid de stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: bsgrub pa'o // shes rab ces bya ba la sogs pa shes rab ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid de stong pa nyid do //
translated: The accomplishment is the wisdom, etc. The wisdom is the emptiness which has the characteristic of the selflessness of the person and of things.

original: thabs ni thugs rje chen po'o //
analyzed: thabs ni thugs rje chen po'o //
translated: The means is the great compassion.

original: de dag snyoms par 'jug pa ni rdo rje 'chang gi sa bcu gsum pa la gnas pa bcom ldan 'das kyi sgom pa mthar thug pa yang dag par sbyor ba zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de dag snyoms par 'jug pa ni rdo rje 'chang gi sa bcu gsum pa la gnas pa bcom ldan 'das kyi sgom pa mthar thug pa yang dag par sbyor ba zhes bshad do //
translated: Their union is the ultimate yoga of the Bhagavān abiding on the thirteenth stage of Vajradhara.

original: rgyas par bshad pa ni gang zhig dngos med ni thams cad stong pa shes rab ste /
analyzed: rgyas par bshad pa ni gang zhig dngos med ni thams cad stong pa shes rab ste /
translated: The extensive explanation is as follows: Wisdom is the knowledge of the emptiness of all non-entities.

original: phul du byung ba'i ye shes yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phul du byung ba'i ye shes yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the supreme wisdom because it is the wisdom of the ultimate.

original: de bzhin du thabs nas dngos po'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin du thabs nas dngos po'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Similarly, method is the characteristic of entities.

original: snying rje'i ming gi rang bzhin gyi rnam grangs te /
analyzed: snying rje'i ming gi rang bzhin gyi rnam grangs te /
translated: It is a synonym for the nature of compassion.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: It is the completion stage.

original: yang na shes rab ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum bsgoms pas sprin med nam mkha' dang 'dra bar bdag nyid @292b mthong ba'o //
analyzed: yang na shes rab ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum bsgoms pas sprin med nam mkha' dang 'dra bar bdag nyid @292b mthong ba'o //
translated: Alternatively, wisdom is the vision of oneself as like the cloudless sky through the cultivation of the three doors of liberation, such as emptiness, and so on.

original: thabs ni sa bon la sogs pa 'dus pa'i sgo nas sku bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: thabs ni sa bon la sogs pa 'dus pa'i sgo nas sku bsgrub pa'o //
translated: Method is the accomplishment of the body through the door of the collection of the seed, and so on.

original: de dag snyoms par 'jug pa ni sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa dang / bstod pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de dag snyoms par 'jug pa ni sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa dang / bstod pa yang ngo //
translated: Their union is the consecration of the body, and so on, and the praise.

original: de nyid bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid bshad par bya ste /
translated: That will be explained.

original: gang zhig dngos med ni stong pa nyid bsgom pa ste shes rab bo //
analyzed: gang zhig dngos med ni stong pa nyid bsgom pa ste shes rab bo //
translated: The cultivation of non-entity is wisdom, i.e., emptiness.

original: thabs ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid de 'gro ba'i don bya bar nus pa'i lha'i sku la dmigs la /
analyzed: thabs ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid de 'gro ba'i don bya bar nus pa'i lha'i sku la dmigs la /
translated: The method is the characteristic of entity, i.e., the observation of the body of the deity which is capable of working for the welfare of living beings.

original: des ni 'gro ba'i don grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des ni 'gro ba'i don grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the welfare of living beings will be accomplished by that.

original: de ni dbang po'i sbyor ba dang / dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog dang / las rgyal po mchog go //
analyzed: de ni dbang po'i sbyor ba dang / dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog dang / las rgyal po mchog go //
translated: That is the application of the sense organs, the supreme king of mandalas, and the supreme king of actions.

original: yang na shes rab ni rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi dbus su 'dod pa'i gdugs la sogs pa'i rtsa lnga'o //
analyzed: yang na shes rab ni rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi dbus su 'dod pa'i gdugs la sogs pa'i rtsa lnga'o //
translated: Alternatively, wisdom is the five channels of desire, such as the parasol channel, in the middle of the seventy-two thousand channels.

original: thabs ni de'i nang du rgyu ba byang chub kyi sems te /
analyzed: thabs ni de'i nang du rgyu ba byang chub kyi sems te /
translated: The method is the bodhicitta that moves within them.

original: de dag gi snyoms par 'jug pa ni dbus mar ro gcig par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gi snyoms par 'jug pa ni dbus mar ro gcig par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Their union is the single taste in the middle.

original: gang zhig dngos po ni bde ba chen po'i gzhir gyur pa rtsa rnams te shes rab bo //
analyzed: gang zhig dngos po ni bde ba chen po'i gzhir gyur pa rtsa rnams te shes rab bo //
translated: The entity is the channels that serve as the basis of great bliss, i.e., wisdom.

original: thabs ni 'gro ba ma lus pa skyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: thabs ni 'gro ba ma lus pa skyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The method is the characteristic of entities that serves as the cause for the generation of all beings.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang mtshon pa'i rgyu mtshan te /
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang mtshon pa'i rgyu mtshan te /
translated: It is the reason for the state of Great Vajradhara.

original: byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the meaning of what is called “awakened mind.”

original: de ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That is the stage of development.

original: shes rab ni phul du byung ba'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa bon gsum mo //
analyzed: shes rab ni phul du byung ba'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa bon gsum mo //
translated: Wisdom is the nature of supreme wisdom, the seed of the tathāgatas.

original: thabs ni srog la sogs pa'i rlung gsum mo //
analyzed: thabs ni srog la sogs pa'i rlung gsum mo //
translated: The method is the three vāyus, such as the life-force vāyu.

original: de dag snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis bzlas te /
analyzed: de dag snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis bzlas te /
translated: Those are recited in sequence, such as through the process of union.

original: gang zhig dngos med ni rdo rje 'chang go 'phang 'od gsal ba de'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa yi ge gsum ste shes rab bo //
analyzed: gang zhig dngos med ni rdo rje 'chang go 'phang 'od gsal ba de'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa yi ge gsum ste shes rab bo //
translated: The nonentity is the three syllables, which are the reason for the state of Vajradhara.

original: thabs dngos po'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i de kho na nyid mtshon par gyur pas thabs ni rlung ngo //
analyzed: thabs dngos po'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i de kho na nyid mtshon par gyur pas thabs ni rlung ngo //
translated: The method, the characteristic of entities, is the vāyu, since it is the reason for the state of Vairocana and so on.

original: de ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That is the stage of vajra repetition.

original: shes rab ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin sum cu rtsa gsum mo //
analyzed: shes rab ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin sum cu rtsa gsum mo //
translated: Wisdom is the thirty-three natures of wisdom.

original: thabs ni thabs kyi rang bzhin bzhi bcu'o //
analyzed: thabs ni thabs kyi rang bzhin bzhi bcu'o //
translated: Means is the forty natures of means.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa ni ma rig pa'i rang bzhin bdun no //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa ni ma rig pa'i rang bzhin bdun no //
translated: Union is the seven natures of ignorance.

original: rnal 'byor ni de dag 'od gsal ba la zhugs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ni de dag 'od gsal ba la zhugs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Yoga is the characteristic of their entry into clear light.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: One is as before.

original: sems la dmigs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: sems la dmigs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the stage of observing the mind.

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba las cig car du spros pa de nyid snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnal 'byor zhes bya ste /🔽phyag rgya @293a * //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba las cig car du spros pa de nyid snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnal 'byor zhes bya ste / phyag rgya @293a * //
translated: The yoga of union is the simultaneous emanation from clear light, which is the nature of means and wisdom.

original: chen po'i rnal 'byor zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chen po'i rnal 'byor zhes bya'o //
translated: The yoga of the great seal is the yoga of the great seal.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te /
translated: One is as before.

original: bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the stage of self-consecration.

original: thabs dang shes rab ni ril por 'dzin pa dang rjes su gzhig pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab ni ril por 'dzin pa dang rjes su gzhig pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Means and wisdom are the meditative stabilizations of total retention and subsequent destruction.

original: de dag snyoms par 'jug pa ni mngon du byed pas rnal 'byor zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag snyoms par 'jug pa ni mngon du byed pas rnal 'byor zhes bya'o //
translated: The union of those is yoga, because it is the actualization.

original: gang zhig dngos med ni ril por 'dzin pa'i ting nge 'dzin te shes rab bo //
analyzed: gang zhig dngos med ni ril por 'dzin pa'i ting nge 'dzin te shes rab bo //
translated: The non-existence of that is the concentration of grasping the whole, which is wisdom.

original: dngos po ni khams gsum mi snang bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid rjes su gzhig pa'i ting nge 'dzin te thabs so //
analyzed: dngos po ni khams gsum mi snang bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid rjes su gzhig pa'i ting nge 'dzin te thabs so //
translated: The existence of the three realms is the concentration of subsequent destruction, which has the characteristic of making the three realms invisible, which is the means.

original: de ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That is the stage of manifest enlightenment.

original: shes rab dang thabs ni don dam pa dang kun rdzob ste /
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs ni don dam pa dang kun rdzob ste /
translated: Wisdom and means are the ultimate and the conventional.

original: de dag snyoms par 'jug pa ni dbyer med par gyur pa rnal 'byor te /
analyzed: de dag snyoms par 'jug pa ni dbyer med par gyur pa rnal 'byor te /
translated: The union of those is yoga, which is the state of their inseparability.

original: zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: That is called the concentration of union.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni go sla ste zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni go sla ste zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The one who is easy to understand is the stage of union.

original: thabs dang shes rab ni rig ma dang skyes bu dang / de dag snyoms par 'jug pa na rnal 'byor zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab ni rig ma dang skyes bu dang / de dag snyoms par 'jug pa na rnal 'byor zhes bya'o //
translated: The means and wisdom are the knowledge consort and the person, and the union of those is yoga.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te rang bzhin no //
translated: The one who is is as before, which is the nature.

original: shes rab dang thabs ni padma dang rdo rje'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs ni padma dang rdo rje'o //
translated: Wisdom and means are the lotus and the vajra.

original: de dag snyoms par 'jug pa ni rnal 'byor te rgyu'o //
analyzed: de dag snyoms par 'jug pa ni rnal 'byor te rgyu'o //
translated: Their union is yoga, the cause.🔽The yoga of union is the action, the placement of the hum and phat, etc.,

original: shes rab dang thabs ni h'um dang phat la sogs pa dgod pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnal 'byor te las so //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs ni h'um dang phat la sogs pa dgod pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnal 'byor te las so //
translated: which are wisdom and means.

original: shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin gyi byang chub sems kyi thig le la snyoms par 'jug pa ni rdo rje rtse mor 'dzin pa ni rnal 'byor te 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin gyi byang chub sems kyi thig le la snyoms par 'jug pa ni rdo rje rtse mor 'dzin pa ni rnal 'byor te 'bras bu'o //
translated: The yoga of retention is the result, the retention of the drop of bodhicitta, which is the nature of wisdom and means, at the tip of the vajra.

original: shes rab ni dbang po rnams dang thabs ni yul rnams so //
analyzed: shes rab ni dbang po rnams dang thabs ni yul rnams so //
translated: Wisdom is the sense organs and means is the sense objects.

original: de dag snyoms par 'jug cing longs spyod pa ni rnal 'byor te so sor sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de dag snyoms par 'jug cing longs spyod pa ni rnal 'byor te so sor sdud pa'o //
translated: The yoga of enjoyment is the union and enjoyment of those two, which is the practice of withdrawal.

original: shes rab ni dbang po rnams so ;
analyzed: shes rab ni dbang po rnams so ;
translated: Wisdom is the sense organs.

original: / thabs ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
analyzed: / thabs ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
translated: Means is the tathāgatas.

original: de dag snyoms par 'jug pa ni rnal 'byor te bsam gtan no //
analyzed: de dag snyoms par 'jug pa ni rnal 'byor te bsam gtan no //
translated: The yoga of concentration is the union of those two, which is meditative concentration.

original: shes rab ni don dam pa byang chub kyi sems dang / thabs ni kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems te /
analyzed: shes rab ni don dam pa byang chub kyi sems dang / thabs ni kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems te /
translated: Wisdom is the ultimate mind of enlightenment, and means is the conventional mind of enlightenment.

original: de dag snyoms par 'jug pa ni rnal 'byor te /
analyzed: de dag snyoms par 'jug pa ni rnal 'byor te /
translated: Their union is yoga.

original: de dag de dang 'og gi rim pas spro ba dang sdud pa ni srog dang rtsol ba'o //
analyzed: de dag de dang 'og gi rim pas spro ba dang sdud pa ni srog dang rtsol ba'o //
