translated: Their expansion and contraction in that and the following order is vitality and exertion.

original: snga ma bzhin du shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin yungs kar gyi tshad tsam gyi thig le sna'i rtse mo gsum la 'dzin pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa dang rnal 'byor te 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin yungs kar gyi tshad tsam gyi thig le sna'i rtse mo gsum la 'dzin pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa dang rnal 'byor te 'dzin pa'o //
translated: As before, the yoga and union are the retention of the bindu the size of a mustard seed, which has the nature of wisdom and means, at the tip of the three nostrils.

original: shes rab thabs kyi rang bzhin ni lha mos 'khyud pa de bzhin @293b gshegs pa rnams te /
analyzed: shes rab thabs kyi rang bzhin ni lha mos 'khyud pa de bzhin @293b gshegs pa rnams te /
translated: The tathāgatas are the goddesses embracing with the nature of wisdom and means.

original: de dag snyoms par 'jug pa ni nam mkha'i dbyings su spro ba ni rnal 'byor te rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: de dag snyoms par 'jug pa ni nam mkha'i dbyings su spro ba ni rnal 'byor te rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: Their union is the expansion into the realm of space, which is yoga, or recollection.

original: shes rab dang thabs ni chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs ni chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste /
translated: Wisdom and means are the dharmakāya and the saṃbhogakāya.

original: de dag snyoms par 'jug pa ni sprul pa'i sku dang lhan cig tu 'brel pa ni rnal 'byor te ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: de dag snyoms par 'jug pa ni sprul pa'i sku dang lhan cig tu 'brel pa ni rnal 'byor te ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: The yoga of union is the meditative concentration of union with the emanation body.

original: shes rab ni sa bon lnga dang / thabs ni bdud rtsi lnga ste /
analyzed: shes rab ni sa bon lnga dang / thabs ni bdud rtsi lnga ste /
translated: Wisdom is the five seeds, and means is the five nectars.

original: de dag snyoms par 'jug pa ni de rnams kyis de dag byin gyis brlabs pa'i bza' ba ni rnal 'byor te sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de dag snyoms par 'jug pa ni de rnams kyis de dag byin gyis brlabs pa'i bza' ba ni rnal 'byor te sgrub pa'o //
translated: The yoga of practice is the food consecrated by those.

original: rgyud ces bya ba la sogs pas rgyud kyi don bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyud ces bya ba la sogs pas rgyud kyi don bstan par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of tantra is taught by the verse beginning with “tantra” and so on.

original: khyad par du tshig gi don bcu drug gtso bor gyur pa'i ngag gi tshogs kyi rgyun gyis spras pas na rgyun te /
analyzed: khyad par du tshig gi don bcu drug gtso bor gyur pa'i ngag gi tshogs kyi rgyun gyis spras pas na rgyun te /
translated: The continuum is adorned with a collection of words that are primarily the sixteen topics.

original: de nyid rgyud ces bya ba ste tshig gi don bcu drug rgyas par byed pas na rgyud de sgra'i tshogs kyi bdag nyid kyi bstan bcos zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid rgyud ces bya ba ste tshig gi don bcu drug rgyas par byed pas na rgyud de sgra'i tshogs kyi bdag nyid kyi bstan bcos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That itself is called a tantra because it elaborates the sixteen topics. It is called a treatise that has the nature of a collection of words.

original: de'i tshig ni don bcu drug go //
analyzed: de'i tshig ni don bcu drug go //
translated: Its words are the sixteen topics.

original: rgyud de rnam pa gsum du 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyud de rnam pa gsum du 'gyur //
translated: That tantra becomes threefold.

original: zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the brief explanation.

original: gzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rgyas par bshad pa'o //
translated: The basis and so forth are explained extensively.

original: gzhi zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu 'dzin pas na thabs kyi rgyud de /
analyzed: gzhi zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu 'dzin pas na thabs kyi rgyud de /
translated: The basis is the method continuum, because it holds the cause and effect.

original: sngags dang phyag rgyal sogs pa rjod par byed pa'i tshig rnams so //
analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgyal sogs pa rjod par byed pa'i tshig rnams so //
translated: It is the words that express the mantras, seals, and so forth.

original: rang bzhin ni rgyu'i rgyud de gang du byang chub kyi sems rang bzhin med pa /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni rgyu'i rgyud de gang du byang chub kyi sems rang bzhin med pa /
translated: The nature is the cause continuum, in which the bodhicitta is essenceless,

original: rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: and becomes the cause for attaining the stage of Vajradhara.

original: mi 'phrogs pa ni 'jigs bar mi 'gyur ba 'bras bu'i rgyud yin te /
analyzed: mi 'phrogs pa ni 'jigs bar mi 'gyur ba 'bras bu'i rgyud yin te /
translated: The unassailable is the result continuum, because it is not subject to fear.

original: gang du bskyed pa'i rim pa'am /
analyzed: gang du bskyed pa'i rim pa'am /
translated: In that, the creation stage or

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i phra mo'i rnal 'byor la sogs pa'am /🔽rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i phra mo'i rnal 'byor la sogs pa'am / rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'am /
translated: the subtle yoga of the completion stage and so forth

original: yan lag drug pa'i rnal 'byor gyis rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'i skur bstan to //
analyzed: yan lag drug pa'i rnal 'byor gyis rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'i skur bstan to //
translated: are taught as the body of Vajradhara and so forth by the yoga of the six branches and vajra repetition.

original: rgyud kyi dbye ba gsum ni de dag yin no //
analyzed: rgyud kyi dbye ba gsum ni de dag yin no //
translated: Those are the three divisions of the tantra.

original: dpal rdo rje 'chang yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dpal rdo rje 'chang yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Glorious Vajradhara is also threefold.

original: rgyu'i rdo rje 'chang dang / 'bras bu'i rdo rje 'chang dang / thabs kyi rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: rgyu'i rdo rje 'chang dang / 'bras bu'i rdo rje 'chang dang / thabs kyi rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: The causal Vajradhara, the resultant Vajradhara, and the method Vajradhara.

original: de la rgyu rdo rje 'chang ni rdo rje 'chang chen po ste /
analyzed: de la rgyu rdo rje 'chang ni rdo rje 'chang chen po ste /
translated: Therein, the causal Vajradhara is the Great Vajradhara.

original: dang po'i mgon po'o //
analyzed: dang po'i mgon po'o //
translated: He is the Primordial Lord.

original: 'bras bu rdo rje 'chang ni de las byung zhing de la rjes su zhugs pa las byung ba ma bskyed pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'bras bu rdo rje 'chang ni de las byung zhing de la rjes su zhugs pa las byung ba ma bskyed pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
translated: The resultant Vajradhara is the Tathagatas, who are uncreated and so forth, arisen from him and arisen from entering into him.

original: thabs kyi rdo rje 'chang ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: thabs kyi rdo rje 'chang ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The method Vajradhara is threefold:

original: gnas bsrung ba dang / bdag bsrung ba dang / rnal 'byor bsrung ba'o //🔽de la gnas bsrung ba ni khro bo bcu @294a * //
analyzed: gnas bsrung ba dang / bdag bsrung ba dang / rnal 'byor bsrung ba'o // de la gnas bsrung ba ni khro bo bcu @294a * //
translated: the protection of the site, the protection of the self, and the protection of the yoga.

original: spros nas bgegs bskrad pa'o //
analyzed: spros nas bgegs bskrad pa'o //
translated: Therein, the protection of the site is the expulsion of obstructors by emanating the ten wrathful ones.

original: bdag bsrung ba ni don dam pa'i bden pa 'ba' zhig sgom pa ste /
analyzed: bdag bsrung ba ni don dam pa'i bden pa 'ba' zhig sgom pa ste /
translated: The protection of the self is the meditation on the ultimate truth alone,

original: aom sh'u n+ya t'a zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags rjes su dran pas stong pa nyid la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: aom sh'u n+ya t'a zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags rjes su dran pas stong pa nyid la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: which has the characteristic of entering emptiness through recollection of the mantra “Oṃ śūnyatā jñānavajrasvabhāvātmako ’haṃ” .

original: rnal 'byor bsrung ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor bsrung ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The protection of the yogi is twofold:

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi mtshan nyid dang / ye shes kyi tshogs kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi mtshan nyid dang / ye shes kyi tshogs kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of the accumulation of merit and the characteristic of the accumulation of wisdom.

original: de la bsod rnams kyi tshogs kyi mtshan nyid ni snying rje chen po'i sems bskyed nas tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi stong pa'o //
analyzed: de la bsod rnams kyi tshogs kyi mtshan nyid ni snying rje chen po'i sems bskyed nas tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi stong pa'o //
translated: Therein, the characteristic of the accumulation of merit is the four Brahma abodes of emptiness, having generated the mind of great compassion.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs kyi mtshan nyid ni rnam par thar pa'i sgom pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs kyi mtshan nyid ni rnam par thar pa'i sgom pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of the accumulation of wisdom is the meditation on the doors of liberation.

original: de ni thabs kyi rdo rje 'chang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni thabs kyi rdo rje 'chang zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called the method Vajradhara.

original: rgyas par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyas par bshad par bya ste /
translated: It should be explained extensively.

original: gzhi ni stong pa dang de'i sngags te de ni rgyu yin te /
analyzed: gzhi ni stong pa dang de'i sngags te de ni rgyu yin te /
translated: The basis is emptiness and its mantra. That is the cause,

original: rang bzhin dang ngo bo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang ngo bo zhes bya'o //
translated: called the nature and essence.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bu ram mngar nyid me yi ni //
analyzed: bu ram mngar nyid me yi ni //
translated: The sweetness of molasses and

original: tsha ba ji ltar rang bzhin te //🔽stong pa nyid ni chos kun gyi //
analyzed: tsha ba ji ltar rang bzhin te // stong pa nyid ni chos kun gyi //
translated: the heat of fire are just like their nature.🔽Emptiness is

original: de bzhin rang bzhin nyid du 'dod //
analyzed: de bzhin rang bzhin nyid du 'dod //
translated: likewise asserted as the nature of all phenomena.

original: ces 'byung ngo// bcom ldan 'das byams pas kyang /
analyzed: ces 'byung ngo// bcom ldan 'das byams pas kyang /
translated: The Bhagavat Maitreya also says:

original: chos dbyings tha mi dad pa'i phyir //
analyzed: chos dbyings tha mi dad pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the dharmadhatu is undifferentiated.

original: rigs kyi dbye ba mi rigs te //🔽rten pa'i chos kyi dbye ba yis //
analyzed: rigs kyi dbye ba mi rigs te // rten pa'i chos kyi dbye ba yis //
translated: The differentiation of the gotra is not reasonable,🔽but its differentiation is well known

original: de yi dbye ba rab tu grags //
analyzed: de yi dbye ba rab tu grags //
translated: through the differentiation of the supported dharmas.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de bzhin du mi 'phrogs pa ni mi 'jigs pa ste /🔽rang bzhin gyis rtag pa chos kyi sku dang / mi 'jigs pa'i rtag pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / rgyun gyi rtag pa ni sprul pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi 'phrogs pa ni mi 'jigs pa ste / rang bzhin gyis rtag pa chos kyi sku dang / mi 'jigs pa'i rtag pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / rgyun gyi rtag pa ni sprul pa'i sku ste /
translated: Likewise, the undiminished is fearlessness.

original: sku gsum gyi bdag nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bdag nyid phyag rgya chen po'i ngo bo mi 'phrogs pa ste /
analyzed: sku gsum gyi bdag nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bdag nyid phyag rgya chen po'i ngo bo mi 'phrogs pa ste /
translated: The undiminished of the natural, permanent dharmakaya, the undiminished of the permanent enjoyment body sambhogakaya, and the undiminished of the permanent continuum of the emanation body nirmanakaya are the essence of the great Vajradhara, the nature of the great seal mahamudra.

original: 'jigs pa'i dang tshul ma yin pa 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i dang tshul ma yin pa 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
translated: The undiminished is called the result.

original: gzhi ni rgyu dang 'bras bu thabs kyi ngo bos 'dzin cing 'jog par byed pas na gzhi'o //
analyzed: gzhi ni rgyu dang 'bras bu thabs kyi ngo bos 'dzin cing 'jog par byed pas na gzhi'o //
translated: The basis is the basis because it holds and establishes the essence of the cause, result, and method.

original: sngags dang phyag rgyal sogs pa sgom pa'i rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du phyag rgya chen po thob par bya ba'i phyir gang sgom pa de ni thabs so //
analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgyal sogs pa sgom pa'i rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du phyag rgya chen po thob par bya ba'i phyir gang sgom pa de ni thabs so //
translated: The method is that which is cultivated in order to attain the Great Seal, in accordance with the stages of cultivation of mantra, seal, etc.

original: gsum pa de dag gi rgyud don gyis bsdus la /
analyzed: gsum pa de dag gi rgyud don gyis bsdus la /
translated: The third, the meaning of the tantra, is included in the meaning.

original: rgyud ni sgra'i tshogs kyi bdag nyid dang don des brjod par bya ba'i rdo rje 'chang bsdus te /
analyzed: rgyud ni sgra'i tshogs kyi bdag nyid dang don des brjod par bya ba'i rdo rje 'chang bsdus te /
translated: The tantra is included in the nature of the collection of sounds and the meaning expressed by that, Vajradhara.

original: rnam pa gsum gyis don bsdus par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum gyis don bsdus par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the meaning is included in three aspects.

original: de ni dang po sbyor ba la sogs pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de ni dang po sbyor ba la sogs pa gsum mo //
translated: That is the three, beginning with the initial union.

original: rigs lnga zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: rigs lnga zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: With “the five families,” etc.,

original: de kho na nyid la sogs pa mdor bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid la sogs pa mdor bstan par bya'o //
translated: the reality, etc. should be taught in brief.

original: rang bzhin ni gsang ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni gsang ba'o //
translated: The nature is the secret.

original: byang chub rdo rje ni bcom ldan @294b 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub rdo rje ni bcom ldan @294b 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos gsungs so //
translated: Enlightenment Vajra was spoken by the Bhagavān Great Vajradhara.

original: rgyas par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par bshad par bya'o //
translated: It should be explained in detail.

original: de nyid rnam pa lnga ru ni phung po lnga'i bdag nyid khams gsum pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid rnam pa lnga ru ni phung po lnga'i bdag nyid khams gsum pa ste /
translated: That itself is fivefold: the triple world, which is the nature of the five aggregates.

original: de ni rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That is the nature, thus it is the creation stage.

original: de'i rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: de'i rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid de /
translated: Its pure nature is the identity of the five transcendent ones,

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa kho na'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa kho na'o //
translated: thus it is the creation stage.

original: rnam par shes pa lnga'i bdag nyid dag pa'i ngo bo me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid de kho na nyid de rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lnga'i bdag nyid dag pa'i ngo bo me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid de kho na nyid de rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The identity of the five pristine awarenesses, such as mirror-like, whose nature is the purity of the five sense consciousnesses, is reality, thus it is the completion stage.

original: mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa lnga la sogs pa de kho na nyid de dang po sbyor ba dang / dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog dang / las kyi rgyal po mchog go //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa lnga la sogs pa de kho na nyid de dang po sbyor ba dang / dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog dang / las kyi rgyal po mchog go //
translated: The fivefold manifest enlightenment and so forth are reality, which is the first yoga, the supreme king of mandalas, and the supreme king of activities.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis ngag dang sems dang lus dang kun rdzob dang gnyi ga dag pa ni de kho na nyid lnga ste /
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis ngag dang sems dang lus dang kun rdzob dang gnyi ga dag pa ni de kho na nyid lnga ste /
translated: The five realities are the purity of speech, mind, body, relative, and both, by the stages of vajra repetition and so forth.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa dang sems la dmigs pa dang / bdag la byin gyis brlab pa dang / mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa dang / zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa dang sems la dmigs pa dang / bdag la byin gyis brlab pa dang / mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa dang / zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The five realities are the stage of vajra repetition, the stage of observing the mind, the stage of self-consecration, the stage of manifest enlightenment, and the stage of union.

original: yul dang dbang po gcig tu byas na de kho na nyid lnga ste /
analyzed: yul dang dbang po gcig tu byas na de kho na nyid lnga ste /
translated: The five realities are the five objects and the five sense powers, when they are made into one.

original: so sor sdud pa'o //
analyzed: so sor sdud pa'o //
translated: The five realities are the five branches of withdrawal.🔽The five realities are the five branches of meditative concentration: faith in the five transcendent lords, thought, investigation, joy, bliss, and one-pointed mind.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lngar mos pa dang / rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid de yan lag lnga'i bsam gtan ni de kho na nyid lnga ste /🔽bsam gtan no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lngar mos pa dang / rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid de yan lag lnga'i bsam gtan ni de kho na nyid lnga ste / bsam gtan no //
translated: The five realities are the five meditative concentrations.

original: srog la sogs pa rlung lnga thig le'i gzugs su spro ba ni de kho na nyid lnga ste /🔽srog dang rtsol ba'o //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa rlung lnga thig le'i gzugs su spro ba ni de kho na nyid lnga ste / srog dang rtsol ba'o //
translated: The five realities are the five winds, life-force, etc., in the form of drops, when they are emitted.🔽The five realities are the five winds, life-force, etc., when they are held.

original: phung po lnga'i snying por gyur pa'i thig le padma'i lte bar 'dzin pa ni de kho na nyid lnga ste 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga'i snying por gyur pa'i thig le padma'i lte bar 'dzin pa ni de kho na nyid lnga ste 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The five realities are the five drops, which are the essence of the five aggregates, when they are held in the center of the lotus.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' spro ba ni de kho na nyid lnga ste rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' spro ba ni de kho na nyid lnga ste rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: The emanation of the nature of the five Tathagatas as Buddhas and Bodhisattvas is the five realities, which are the recollections.

original: sku lnga dang spyan lnga dang mngon par shes pa lnga dang ye shes lnga dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la longs spyod par mdzad pa dang / 'gro ba lnga rnam par sbyong bar mdzad pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid 'byung ba chen po lnga'i ngo bo 'od zer lnga spro ba dang /
analyzed: sku lnga dang spyan lnga dang mngon par shes pa lnga dang ye shes lnga dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la longs spyod par mdzad pa dang / 'gro ba lnga rnam par sbyong bar mdzad pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid 'byung ba chen po lnga'i ngo bo 'od zer lnga spro ba dang /
translated: The enjoyment of the five bodies, the five eyes, the five superknowledges, the five wisdoms, and the five sense objects, the purification of the five destinies, and the emanation and withdrawal of the five lights, which are the nature of the five great elements, which are the nature of the five Tathagatas,

original: sdud par mdzad pa rdo rje 'chang gi phyag rgya chen po'i sku de kho na nyid lnga ste ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: sdud par mdzad pa rdo rje 'chang gi phyag rgya chen po'i sku de kho na nyid lnga ste ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: are the five realities, which are the samadhis of Vajradhara, the body of the great seal.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin lcags kyu lnga dang bdud rtsi lnga dang sa bon lngas byin gyis brlab pa de kho na nyid lnga ste dam tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin lcags kyu lnga dang bdud rtsi lnga dang sa bon lngas byin gyis brlab pa de kho na nyid lnga ste dam tshig go //
translated: The consecration with the five hooks, the five nectars, and the five seed syllables, which are the nature of the five Tathagatas, are the five realities, which are the commitments.

original: rigs lnga'i 'brel pa dang @295a * //
analyzed: rigs lnga'i 'brel pa dang @295a * //
translated: The connection with the five families,

original: ldan pa'i slob pa blang ba ni de kho na nyid lnga ste sdom pa'o //
analyzed: ldan pa'i slob pa blang ba ni de kho na nyid lnga ste sdom pa'o //
translated: The vow of the learner endowed with it is the five realities, i.e. the vow.

original: de ni sdom pa ste don bcu drug go //
analyzed: de ni sdom pa ste don bcu drug go //
translated: That is the vow, with sixteen meanings.

original: gsang ba gsum ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: gsang ba gsum ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The three secrets have been explained above.

original: gsang ba zhes bya ba ni gsang ba yin pas na lhag pa'i lha ni rdo rje 'chang chen po ste bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: gsang ba zhes bya ba ni gsang ba yin pas na lhag pa'i lha ni rdo rje 'chang chen po ste bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The “secret” is the supreme deity, Great Vajradhara, i.e. the creation stage,

original: ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir lhag pa yang yin la /
analyzed: ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir lhag pa yang yin la /
translated: because it is the nature of the five intuitions.

original: gsang ba'i rang bzhin yin pas na lhag pa yang yin te /
analyzed: gsang ba'i rang bzhin yin pas na lhag pa yang yin te /
translated: And it is the supreme because it is the nature of the secret.

original: lhag pa'i lha ni yungs kar gyi 'bru'i tshad tsam mam /
analyzed: lhag pa'i lha ni yungs kar gyi 'bru'i tshad tsam mam /
translated: The supreme deity is a drop the size of a mustard seed or

original: skra'i rtse mo'i brgya stong gi tshang tsam gyi thig le ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: skra'i rtse mo'i brgya stong gi tshang tsam gyi thig le ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: the size of a hundredth or a thousandth of the tip of a hair, i.e. the completion stage.

original: dam tshig ni phul du byung ba ste /
analyzed: dam tshig ni phul du byung ba ste /
translated: The commitment is the best,🔽because it liberates the realm of sentient beings to be trained according to their thoughts.

original: bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du gdul bya'i sems can gyi khams grol bar byed pas na rdo rje 'chang gi rigs gcig yin na yang rnam pa brgyar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du gdul bya'i sems can gyi khams grol bar byed pas na rdo rje 'chang gi rigs gcig yin na yang rnam pa brgyar 'gyur te /
translated: Even though it is the one family of Vajradhara, it becomes a hundred kinds.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa re re la lnga lnga la sogs par phye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa re re la lnga lnga la sogs par phye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: because each of the Tathagatas is divided into five, etc.

original: de ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: de ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
translated: This is just an illustration,

original: sems can rnams kyi sems dang sems las byung ba rags pa dang phra ba'i bag chags kyi ngo bo ji srid yod pa de srid rnam par dag pa'i thabs su gyur pa bcom ldan 'das kyis rigs bstan to //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sems dang sems las byung ba rags pa dang phra ba'i bag chags kyi ngo bo ji srid yod pa de srid rnam par dag pa'i thabs su gyur pa bcom ldan 'das kyis rigs bstan to //
translated: for as long as there are the gross and subtle habitual propensities of the mind and mental factors of sentient beings, for that long the Lord has taught the families as the means of purification.

original: de bas na gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mtshungs pa'i rigs yin te /
analyzed: de bas na gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mtshungs pa'i rigs yin te /
translated: Therefore, the families are equal to the sands of the Ganges River.

original: ji srid grangs med pa'i rigs yin pas rgya che ste /
analyzed: ji srid grangs med pa'i rigs yin pas rgya che ste /
translated: Since the families are innumerable, they are vast.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the creation stage.

original: byang chub kyi sems bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems bshad par bya ste /
translated: The Thought of Enlightenment should be explained.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa rang bzhin gyis rtag pa chos kyi sku'i ngo bo skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral ba de nyid kyi phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i bag chags kyi rtog pa dang dri ma zhi bas na zhi🔽ba'o// dngos po ni khams gsum gyi rang bzhin phung po lnga la sogs pa dang / dngos med ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa ste /🔽de dag zad pa ni de'i so sor snang ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa rang bzhin gyis rtag pa chos kyi sku'i ngo bo skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral ba de nyid kyi phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i bag chags kyi rtog pa dang dri ma zhi bas na zhi ba'o// dngos po ni khams gsum gyi rang bzhin phung po lnga la sogs pa dang / dngos med ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa ste / de dag zad pa ni de'i so sor snang ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is peace because the latent tendencies of defilement and purification are pacified, since it is free from the concepts and stains of the two obscurations.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'gro ba ma lus pa'i gzhir gyur pa sku gnyis po'i rgyur gyur pa yin pas gtso bo ste bdag po'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'gro ba ma lus pa'i gzhir gyur pa sku gnyis po'i rgyur gyur pa yin pas gtso bo ste bdag po'o //
translated: It is the supreme reality, the ultimate reality, because it is the cause of the two kāyas, the basis of the entire world.

original: stong pa nyid ni thams cad stong pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni thams cad stong pa'o //
translated: It is emptiness, the emptiness of everything.

original: snying rje ni thugs rje chen po'o //
analyzed: snying rje ni thugs rje chen po'o //
translated: It is compassion, great compassion.

original: de dag dbyer med pa gcig tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de dag dbyer med pa gcig tu gyur pa ste /
translated: They are inseparable, one.

original: byang chub kyi rang bzhin sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo /
analyzed: byang chub kyi rang bzhin sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo /
translated: It is the nature of enlightenment, the essence of unobstructed wisdom.

original: sems ni mchog tu gyur pa'i de kho na nyid rnam 'byor gyis mngon sum gyis myong ba byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba @295b ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: sems ni mchog tu gyur pa'i de kho na nyid rnam 'byor gyis mngon sum gyis myong ba byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba @295b ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The mind is the supreme reality, experienced by the yoga of direct intuition, called the Thought of Enlightenment, which is the perfection stage.

original: yang na thog ma ni snang ba dang snang mched pa'o //
analyzed: yang na thog ma ni snang ba dang snang mched pa'o //
translated: Or else, the beginning is the light and the increase of light.

original: tha ma ni snang ba nye bar thob pa'o //
analyzed: tha ma ni snang ba nye bar thob pa'o //
translated: The end is the attainment of light.

original: de med pa ni zhib ste 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: de med pa ni zhib ste 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: The absence of that is the subtle, which is clear light.

original: dngos po ni shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po ni shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The entity is the nature of wisdom and means.

original: dngos med ni ma rig pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos med ni ma rig pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The non-entity is the nature of ignorance.

original: 'od gsal bas rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'od gsal bas rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because of the non-conceptuality of clear light.

original: / dngos dang dngos med kyi rang bzhin de zad bas na zad pa ste thams cad stong pa'o //
analyzed: / dngos dang dngos med kyi rang bzhin de zad bas na zad pa ste thams cad stong pa'o //
translated: The exhaustion of the entity and non-entity natures is the exhaustion, which is the emptiness of everything.

original: byang chub kyi sems ni byang chub ste 'od gsal ba la zhugs pa'i sems ni rnam par shes pa gsum ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ni byang chub ste 'od gsal ba la zhugs pa'i sems ni rnam par shes pa gsum ste /
translated: The Thought of Enlightenment is the enlightenment, which is the mind that has entered the clear light, which is the three consciousnesses.

original: byang chub kyi sems ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: The Thought of Enlightenment is taught by the Lord.

original: de ni sems la dmigs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sems la dmigs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That is the stage of the mind-basis.

original: yang na thog ma ni chags pa dang chags pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: yang na thog ma ni chags pa dang chags pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Or else, the beginning is attachment and the absence of attachment.

original: tha ma ni chags pa bar pa'o //
analyzed: tha ma ni chags pa bar pa'o //
translated: The end is the middle attachment.

original: de dang bral bas ni thog ma tha ma med pa'o //
analyzed: de dang bral bas ni thog ma tha ma med pa'o //
translated: The absence of beginning and end is the absence of attachment.

original: zhi ba ni rang rig pa ste chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni rang rig pa ste chos kyi sku'o //
translated: Peace is self-awareness, the Dharma Body.

original: dngos po ni mtshams dang mtshan mo dang nyin mo'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni mtshams dang mtshan mo dang nyin mo'o //
translated: The existent is the divisions of day and night.

original: dngos med ni smig rgyu la sogs pa mtshan ma lnga ste /
analyzed: dngos med ni smig rgyu la sogs pa mtshan ma lnga ste /
translated: The nonexistent is the five signs such as mirage,

original: de dag zad cing thob pas na dngos dang dngos med zad pa'o //
analyzed: de dag zad cing thob pas na dngos dang dngos med zad pa'o //
translated: and the exhaustion of both the existent and the nonexistent is the exhaustion of both existence and nonexistence.

original: 'bras bur gyur pas na gtso bo'o //
analyzed: 'bras bur gyur pas na gtso bo'o //
translated: The principal is the result.

original: stong nyid ni shes rab dang / snying rje ni thabs te dag mi phyed pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i dbang gis thob pa'i byang chub ni mngon par byang chub pa ste /
analyzed: stong nyid ni shes rab dang / snying rje ni thabs te dag mi phyed pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i dbang gis thob pa'i byang chub ni mngon par byang chub pa ste /
translated: Emptiness is wisdom, and compassion is method. The indivisibility of those two is the enlightenment attained through the power of meditative union.

original: de'i rang bzhin gyi sems ni byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gyi sems ni byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ste /
translated: The mind that has that nature is called the mind of enlightenment.

original: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the stage of manifest enlightenment.

original: yang na rgyun gyis zhugs pas na thog ma tha ma med pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rgyun gyis zhugs pas na thog ma tha ma med pa'o //
translated: Or else, the absence of beginning and end is the continuous engagement.

original: sems rtse gcig pa nyid du skyed par byed pas na zhi ba'o //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa nyid du skyed par byed pas na zhi ba'o //
translated: It is peace because it generates the mind's one-pointedness.

original: dngos dang dngos med ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten te /
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten te /
translated: The real and the unreal are the world of sentient beings and the world of their physical environment.

original: de'i rang bzhin yin yang sgom par gyur pas na /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin yin yang sgom par gyur pas na /
translated: Although it is their nature, it is meditation.

original: de'i rnam par rtog pa zad pas na dngos dang dngos med zad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam par rtog pa zad pas na dngos dang dngos med zad pa'o //
translated: It is the exhaustion of the real and the unreal because it exhausts the conceptualization of those two.

original: khams gsum bskyed pas na gtso bo'o //
analyzed: khams gsum bskyed pas na gtso bo'o //
translated: It is the chief because it generates the three worlds.

original: stong pa nyid ni don dam pa stong pa nyid dang snying rje ni kun rdzob kyi gzugs te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni don dam pa stong pa nyid dang snying rje ni kun rdzob kyi gzugs te /
translated: Emptiness is the emptiness of the ultimate, and compassion is the form of the relative.

original: mi phyed pa ni de dag dbyer med pa'i kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba ste 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: mi phyed pa ni de dag dbyer med pa'i kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba ste 'bras bu'o //
translated: Their inseparability is the inseparability of the ultimate and the relative, which is called the mind of enlightenment, the result.

original: yang na byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don bya ba'i phyir yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa'o //🔽ji skad du sems bskyed pa ni gzhan gyi don bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don bya ba'i phyir yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa'o // ji skad du sems bskyed pa ni gzhan gyi don bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Alternatively, the mind of enlightenment is the desire for perfect complete enlightenment in order to act for the benefit of others.🔽As it is said:

original: yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod //
analyzed: yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod //
translated: The generation of the mind is the desire for perfect complete enlightenment in order to act for the benefit of others.

original: @296a * // ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: @296a * // ces 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said.🔽🔽

original: de'i dbye ba gnyis te /
analyzed: de'i dbye ba gnyis te /
translated: The two kinds of enlightenment mind are

original: smon pa byang chub kyi sems dang / 'jug pa byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: smon pa byang chub kyi sems dang / 'jug pa byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: the aspiration and the venturing enlightenment mind.

original: de la sangs rgyas su gyur nas sems can gyi don bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i blo dang snying rje dag gis zab pa dang / rgya che ba don du gnyer ba gang yin pa de ni smon ba byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas su gyur nas sems can gyi don bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i blo dang snying rje dag gis zab pa dang / rgya che ba don du gnyer ba gang yin pa de ni smon ba byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The aspiration enlightenment mind is the desire to attain enlightenment for the sake of others, which is the wish to attain the profound and vast states of a buddha through the power of compassion and the desire to help others.

original: byang chub kyi spyod pa yang dag par len pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa ni 'jug pa byang chub kyi sems te gnyis so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi spyod pa yang dag par len pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa ni 'jug pa byang chub kyi sems te gnyis so //
translated: The venturing enlightenment mind is the engagement in the practice of the bodhisattva deeds.

original: ji skad du sangs rgyas phal po che'i mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du sangs rgyas phal po che'i mdo las /
translated: The Buddha states in the Flower Ornament Sutra:

original: rigs kyi bu sems can de rnyed par dka' ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu sems can de rnyed par dka' ste /
translated: Child of good family, it is difficult to find a being🔽who has the aspiration enlightenment mind.

original: gang zhig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyed par byed pa dang / gang zhig yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'jug par bgyid pa de dag de rnams las kyang shin tu rnyed par dka' ba'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang zhig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyed par byed pa dang / gang zhig yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'jug par bgyid pa de dag de rnams las kyang shin tu rnyed par dka' ba'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Those who generate the Thought of highest enlightenment and those who enter into the perfection of enlightenment are even more difficult to find than that.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbye bas rnam pa mang por 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbye bas rnam pa mang por 'gyur te /
translated: Then, by the divisions of the stages and perfections taught by the Lord, there are many kinds.

original: 'dir ni re zhig rnam pa bcu yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni re zhig rnam pa bcu yin te /
translated: Here, however, there are ten kinds:

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi phan yon dang / sdig pa bshags ba la sogs rnam pa bdun gyi mchod pa dang / byang chub kyi sems blang ba dang / bag med pa dang bcas pa dang / de shes bzhin du bsrung ba dang / bzod pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi phan yon dang / sdig pa bshags ba la sogs rnam pa bdun gyi mchod pa dang / byang chub kyi sems blang ba dang / bag med pa dang bcas pa dang / de shes bzhin du bsrung ba dang / bzod pa dang /
translated: the benefits of the Thought of Enlightenment, the worship of seven kinds including confession of sins, the taking of the Thought of Enlightenment, the possession of heedlessness, the protection of it with awareness, the patience,

original: brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / yongs su bsngo ba ste bcu'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / yongs su bsngo ba ste bcu'o //
translated: the effort, the meditation, the wisdom, and the dedication.

original: de ni rgya che ba ste bslab pa kun las btus pa las blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rgya che ba ste bslab pa kun las btus pa las blta bar bya'o //
translated: It is extensive and should be understood from the Compendium of Trainings.

original: de bzhin du de yang rnam pa nyi shu gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du de yang rnam pa nyi shu gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: Similarly, it is also twenty-two-fold.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it has been said:

original: 'phags ba byams pas ;
analyzed: 'phags ba byams pas ;
translated: The noble Maitreya

original: de yang sa gser bla ba me //
analyzed: de yang sa gser bla ba me //
translated: says that it is like gold, a treasure,

original: gter dang rin chen 'byung gnas mtsho //
analyzed: gter dang rin chen 'byung gnas mtsho //
translated: a mine, a jewel, a source of jewels, an ocean,🔽a diamond, a mountain, a medicine, a friend,

original: rdo rje ri sman bshes gnyen dang // yid bzhin nor bu nyi ma glu //
analyzed: rdo rje ri sman bshes gnyen dang // yid bzhin nor bu nyi ma glu //
translated: a wish-fulfilling gem, the sun, a song,

original: rgyal po mdzod dang lam po che //
analyzed: rgyal po mdzod dang lam po che //
translated: a king, a storehouse, a highway,

original: bzhon pa bkod ma'i chu dang ni //
analyzed: bzhon pa bkod ma'i chu dang ni //
translated: a vehicle, a reservoir,

original: sgra snyan chu bo'i sprin rnams kyi //
analyzed: sgra snyan chu bo'i sprin rnams kyi //
translated: a musical instrument, a river, and a cloud.

original: rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis so //
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis so //
translated: These are the twenty-two similes.

original: de la 'di ltar blta bar bya ste /🔽'dum pa'i skabs la dbye ba yis //
analyzed: de la 'di ltar blta bar bya ste / 'dum pa'i skabs la dbye ba yis //
translated: Here is how they should be understood:

original: smon pa'i sems ni rnam pa gsum //
analyzed: smon pa'i sems ni rnam pa gsum //
translated: The aspiration mind is threefold🔽in terms of its categories.

original: 'jug pa zhes bya'i sems rnams ni //
analyzed: 'jug pa zhes bya'i sems rnams ni //
translated: The so-called engaged mind

original: de yis sems la bcu dgu yin //
analyzed: de yis sems la bcu dgu yin //
translated: is nineteen-fold.

original: de la smon pa'i sems ni dbye ba rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la smon pa'i sems ni dbye ba rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The aspiration mind is threefold in terms of its categories.

original: 'dun pa dang bcas pa ni chos thams cad @296b mngon par rtogs par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid de sa dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang bcas pa ni chos thams cad @296b mngon par rtogs par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid de sa dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The characteristic of the will is the desire to understand all things, and it is like the earth.

original: bsam pa dang bcas pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: bsam pa dang bcas pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The characteristic of the intention is the desire to practice the six perfections.

original: ma 'ongs pa dang 'di nyid du 'gyur ba la mi ba rten pas gser bzang po lta bu'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang 'di nyid du 'gyur ba la mi ba rten pas gser bzang po lta bu'o //
translated: It is like good gold, since it is not dependent on the future or on this life.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa dang bcas pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun gyi chos sgom par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa dang bcas pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun gyi chos sgom par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The characteristic of the superior intention is the desire to cultivate the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment.

original: dkar po'i phyogs thams cad 'phel bas 'gro bas na zla ba sar pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dkar po'i phyogs thams cad 'phel bas 'gro bas na zla ba sar pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the waxing moon, since all the bright factors increase.

original: 'jug pa'i sems ni rnam pa bcu dgu ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sems ni rnam pa bcu dgu ste /
translated: The engaged will is of nineteen kinds.

original: sbyor ba dang bcas pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa dang bcas pa pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dang / mngon par shes pa dang bcas pa dang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang bcas pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: sbyor ba dang bcas pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa dang bcas pa pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dang / mngon par shes pa dang bcas pa dang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang bcas pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos dang bcas pa dang /
translated: It is endowed with application, with the ten perfections such as giving, with the superknowledges, with the stores of merit and knowledge, with the elements that lead to enlightenment.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang bcas pa dang / gzungs dang spobs pa dang bcas pa dang / chos ston pa dang bcas pa dang / theg pa gcig gi lam dang bcas pa dang / chos kyi sku dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang bcas pa dang / gzungs dang spobs pa dang bcas pa dang / chos ston pa dang bcas pa dang / theg pa gcig gi lam dang bcas pa dang / chos kyi sku dang bcas pa'o //
translated: It is endowed with serenity and insight, with retention and eloquence, with the teaching of the Dharma, with the path of the One Vehicle, and with the Dharma body.

original: de nas skabs ni bzhi po yis //
analyzed: de nas skabs ni bzhi po yis //
translated: Then, by four sections,

original: de dag thams cad khyab par byed //
analyzed: de dag thams cad khyab par byed //
translated: it pervades all of those.

original: 'bras bu rgyu dang sbyor sogs dang // las kyi dang po'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu dang sbyor sogs dang // las kyi dang po'i dbye bas so //
translated: By the result, by the cause, by application, and by the division of the first action.

original: de la gsum gyis ni las dang po'i skabs dang / bzhi pas de dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha'i skabs so//
analyzed: de la gsum gyis ni las dang po'i skabs dang / bzhi pas de dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha'i skabs so//
translated: Among them, the first three are the section on the first action, and the fourth is the section on the stage of penetration.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i sems kyis rgyu'i skabs so //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i sems kyis rgyu'i skabs so //
translated: The stage of cause is the thought of the transcendences such as generosity.

original: mngon par shes pa la sogs pa dang bcas pa'i sems brgyad kyis 'bras bu'i skabs so //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa la sogs pa dang bcas pa'i sems brgyad kyis 'bras bu'i skabs so //
translated: The stage of result is the thought endowed with the superknowledges.

original: smon pa'i rnam pa dang por ni //
analyzed: smon pa'i rnam pa dang por ni //
translated: The first aspect is the aspiration;

original: de la mgon pos yang dag gsungs //🔽sbyin sogs 'jug pa'i rnam pa ni //
analyzed: de la mgon pos yang dag gsungs // sbyin sogs 'jug pa'i rnam pa ni //
translated: the Lord has declared it to be the armoring.🔽The second aspect is the engagement

original: gnyis par yongs su grags pa yin //
analyzed: gnyis par yongs su grags pa yin //
translated: in generosity and so on, which is well known.

original: 'dun pa'i rnam pa smon pa'i sems ni rnam pa gsum du bshad do //
analyzed: 'dun pa'i rnam pa smon pa'i sems ni rnam pa gsum du bshad do //
translated: The thought of aspiration is explained to have three aspects.

original: gang nas brtsams te sdom pa blangs pa sngon du 'gro bas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i tshogs la 'jug pa'i sems so //
analyzed: gang nas brtsams te sdom pa blangs pa sngon du 'gro bas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i tshogs la 'jug pa'i sems so //
translated: The thought of engagement in the collection of generosity and so on is preceded by the vow to begin with.

original: sdom pa yang sdom pa dang mkhas pa dang stobs dang ldan pa'i slob dpon las blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: sdom pa yang sdom pa dang mkhas pa dang stobs dang ldan pa'i slob dpon las blang bar bya'o //
translated: The vow should be taken from a master who is vowed, wise, and powerful.

original: de mi bzhugs na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' mdun du gnas par yid kyis dmigs pa las blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de mi bzhugs na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' mdun du gnas par yid kyis dmigs pa las blang bar bya'o //
translated: If he is not available, it should be taken from the presence of the Buddhas and bodhisattvas, visualized in the mind.

original: de yang / thabs med par ni shes rab med //
analyzed: de yang / thabs med par ni shes rab med //
translated: Without method, there is no wisdom.

original: sbyin sogs shes rab med pas min //
analyzed: sbyin sogs shes rab med pas min //
translated: Without wisdom, there is no generosity and so forth.

original: gzhan yang zhi gnas bskyed byas nas //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhi gnas bskyed byas nas //
translated: Moreover, having generated śamatha,

original: de phyir @297a * //
analyzed: de phyir @297a * //
translated: then

original: shes rab bskyed par bya //
analyzed: shes rab bskyed par bya //
translated: wisdom should be generated.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes rab med pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: shes rab med pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pas ni /
translated: Generosity and so forth without wisdom

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob par mi 'gyur ba dang / thabs su yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob par mi 'gyur ba dang / thabs su yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: do not obtain the name of a perfection and are not method.

original: de bas na shes rab bskyed par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na shes rab bskyed par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to generate wisdom,

original: zhi gnas bskyed pa la 'bad rtsol bya'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas bskyed pa la 'bad rtsol bya'o //
translated: strive to generate śamatha.🔽Whoever has ethics, endures suffering,

original: gang zhig tshul khrims dang ldan sdug bsngal bzod pa dang // gang zhig brtson 'grus dang ldan brtan pa bag dang bcas //
analyzed: gang zhig tshul khrims dang ldan sdug bsngal bzod pa dang // gang zhig brtson 'grus dang ldan brtan pa bag dang bcas //
translated: and whoever has effort, is steadfast, and is conscientious,

original: yang dag rab tu sbyor zhing gang tshe de dang ni //
analyzed: yang dag rab tu sbyor zhing gang tshe de dang ni //
translated: when they are correctly applied,

original: de yi ting nge 'dzin du myur du 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi ting nge 'dzin du myur du 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: they will quickly accomplish samādhi.

original: tshul khrims la sogs pa gsum dang zhi gnas kyi tshogs la gnas shing /
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pa gsum dang zhi gnas kyi tshogs la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in the three—ethics and so forth—and the prerequisites of śamatha,

original: yid dang rjes su mthun pa'i sa phyogs su lus po drang por byas la stan 'jam pa la 'dug ste /
analyzed: yid dang rjes su mthun pa'i sa phyogs su lus po drang por byas la stan 'jam pa la 'dug ste /
translated: In a place that is agreeable to the mind, he should sit on a soft seat, with his body erect.

original: snying rje chen po sngon du byas nas sems can thams cad gdon pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pas sems rtse gcig pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: snying rje chen po sngon du byas nas sems can thams cad gdon pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pas sems rtse gcig pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Having first generated great compassion, and having the intention to liberate all sentient beings, he should generate the concentration which has the characteristic of one-pointedness of mind.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi mdor bsdus pa'i dbye ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi mdor bsdus pa'i dbye ba'o //
translated: The summary of the thought of enlightenment is the division into two,

original: stong pa nyid ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Emptiness is the nature of the perfection of wisdom.

original: snying rje ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: snying rje ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa lnga'o //
translated: Compassion is the five perfections beginning with generosity.

original: de dag mi phyed pa ni byang chub kyi sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag mi phyed pa ni byang chub kyi sems zhes bya'o //
translated: The inseparability of those two is called the thought of enlightenment.

original: gang gi phyir shes rab med pas byang chub sems dpa' la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob par mi 'gyur ba dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba'i shes rab ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes rab med pas byang chub sems dpa' la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob par mi 'gyur ba dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba'i shes rab ni ma yin te /
translated: Because without wisdom, the bodhisattva would not obtain the name of perfection of generosity, and wisdom is not separate from the perfections of generosity and so on.

original: chad pa'i lta bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chad pa'i lta bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be a nihilistic view.

original: de bas na stong pa nyid dang snying rje tha mi dad pa'i byang chub kyi sems la dmigs te /
analyzed: de bas na stong pa nyid dang snying rje tha mi dad pa'i byang chub kyi sems la dmigs te /
translated: Therefore, one should focus on the thought of awakening, which is the inseparability of emptiness and compassion,🔽and one will attain buddhahood, the dharmakāya, which is free from beginning and end, and from existence and nonexistence.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa dang dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang bral ba chos kyi sku sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes pa ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa dang dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang bral ba chos kyi sku sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes pa ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the completion stage.

original: rig pa'i skyes bu'i 'dri ba'i lan gdab par bya ba'i phyir sku zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rig pa'i skyes bu'i 'dri ba'i lan gdab par bya ba'i phyir sku zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to respond to the questions of the person of knowledge, he says “body” and so on.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: The vajra of body, speech, and mind is Mahāvajradhara.

original: mi phyed pa'i ngo bo ni de la rjes su zhugs shing gcig tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i ngo bo ni de la rjes su zhugs shing gcig tu gyur pa'o //
translated: The nature of nonduality is to enter into that and become one.

original: phyed pa'i ngo bo ni tha dad par snang pa'o //
analyzed: phyed pa'i ngo bo ni tha dad par snang pa'o //
translated: The nature of duality is the appearance of difference.

original: rig pa ni ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang lhan cig tu ldan pa ni 'khyud pa /
analyzed: rig pa ni ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang lhan cig tu ldan pa ni 'khyud pa /
translated: Knowledge is the union with the gnosis consort, the embrace.

original: skyes bu ni sngags kyi sku dang ye shes kyi sku ste /
analyzed: skyes bu ni sngags kyi sku dang ye shes kyi sku ste /
translated: The person is the mantra body and the gnosis body.

original: de ni rig pa'i skyes bu zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de ni rig pa'i skyes bu zhes brjod do //
translated: That is called the person of knowledge.

original: 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po yongs gyur nas /
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po yongs gyur nas /
translated: Having transformed into Great Vajradhara,

original: @297b thugs rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa rim pa gnyis kyis bsgom par bya ba ni rig pa'i skyes bu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: @297b thugs rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa rim pa gnyis kyis bsgom par bya ba ni rig pa'i skyes bu zhes bya ste /
translated: the cultivation of the two stages of Mind Vajradhara and so forth is called the person of knowledge.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa dang / bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa dag go //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa dang / bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa dag go //
translated: [It is] the stage of generation and the stage of self-consecration.

original: phyung ba'i sngags bcu gsum gyi don bshad de /
analyzed: phyung ba'i sngags bcu gsum gyi don bshad de /
translated: The meaning of the thirteen extracted mantras is explained.

original: lnga 'dzom pa zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa lnga 'og gi rtse mo lnga'i rang bzhin dang de bzhin du steng gi rtse mo lnga ni me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: lnga 'dzom pa zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa lnga 'og gi rtse mo lnga'i rang bzhin dang de bzhin du steng gi rtse mo lnga ni me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The union of the five is the nature of the five lower tips of the five consciousnesses endowed with afflictions, and likewise the five upper tips are the nature of the five pristine awarenesses such as mirror-like pristine awareness.

original: mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i tshul du gnas pa de ni rdo rje zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i tshul du gnas pa de ni rdo rje zhes bya'o //
translated: The state of being in the manner of discordant factors and antidotes is called vajra.

original: gang gi phyir lnga 'dzom pa ni spong ba dang lnga rig pa ni shes pa dang / ba dang dzra yi ge gnyis kyi don gyis rdo rje ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lnga 'dzom pa ni spong ba dang lnga rig pa ni shes pa dang / ba dang dzra yi ge gnyis kyi don gyis rdo rje ste /
translated: Since the five are gathered, the five are abandoned, and the five are known, and since the meaning of the two syllables “va” and “jra” is vajra,

original: de 'dzin pas na rdo rje 'chang ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dzin pas na rdo rje 'chang ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: he is Vajradhara, the stage of completion.

original: yang na rtsa lnga bha ga'i nang du chud pa de rnams tha dad par spong pa dang / rig pa ni bde ba chen po rtogs pas na rdo rje rgyal mtshan no //
analyzed: yang na rtsa lnga bha ga'i nang du chud pa de rnams tha dad par spong pa dang / rig pa ni bde ba chen po rtogs pas na rdo rje rgyal mtshan no //
translated: Alternatively, the five channels that enter the bhaga are abandoned as separate, and since they are known as the realization of great bliss, he is Vajraketu.

original: de 'dzin pa'i las su rung ba nyid kyi 'chang ba /
analyzed: de 'dzin pa'i las su rung ba nyid kyi 'chang ba /
translated: He is Vajradhara, who is fit for the function of holding that.

original: rnam shes yid ni byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de ni rdo rje 'dzin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam shes yid ni byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de ni rdo rje 'dzin zhes bya ste /
translated: The mind consciousness, which is the mind of enlightenment, is called Vajradhara.

original: rang bzhin dang rgyu dang las dang 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang rgyu dang las dang 'bras bu'o //
translated: [There are] the nature, cause, function, and result.

original: yod ces bya ba la sogs pa la dbang phyug dam pas sprul pa dngos po rnams yod do zhes dbang phyug tu smra ba pa'o //
analyzed: yod ces bya ba la sogs pa la dbang phyug dam pas sprul pa dngos po rnams yod do zhes dbang phyug tu smra ba pa'o //
translated: With respect to “existence,” and so on, the proponents of Īśvara say that things exist, since they are emanated by the supreme Īśvara.

original: dus gsum yongs su 'gyur ba dngos po yod do zhes grangs can pa'o //
analyzed: dus gsum yongs su 'gyur ba dngos po yod do zhes grangs can pa'o //
translated: The Sāṃkhyas say that the three times are fully transformed, and things exist.

original: bdag gis byin gyis brlabs pa yod do zhes rigs pa pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis byin gyis brlabs pa yod do zhes rigs pa pa'o //
translated: The Ājīvikas say, “There is a self that is blessed.”

original: tshangs pa'i rang bzhin dngos po yod do zhes dpyod pa pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i rang bzhin dngos po yod do zhes dpyod pa pa'o //
translated: The Brahmins say, “There is a thing that is Brahman.”

original: zho yang snga mor 'gyur ro zhes 'gyur bar smra ba ni gcer bu pa'o //
analyzed: zho yang snga mor 'gyur ro zhes 'gyur bar smra ba ni gcer bu pa'o //
translated: The Nirgranthas say, “Milk becomes curd.”

original: dus kyi sems can smin par 'gyur ro zhes dus su smra ba pa'o //
analyzed: dus kyi sems can smin par 'gyur ro zhes dus su smra ba pa'o //
translated: The Kāṇādas say, “Sentient beings are ripened by time.”

original: yang dang yang du skye zhing yang dang yang du zag pas na gang zag ste /
analyzed: yang dang yang du skye zhing yang dang yang du zag pas na gang zag ste /
translated: The Vātsīputrīyas say, “Since one is born again and again and is defiled again and again, there is a person.

original: de'i rang bzhin dngos po yod do zhes gang zag tu smra ba pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin dngos po yod do zhes gang zag tu smra ba pa'o //
translated: There is a thing that is the nature of that person.”🔽The Grammarians say, “Sound is Brahman.

original: sgra ni tshangs pa dam pa de'i rang bzhin dngos po thams cad yod do zhes pa ste /🔽brda sprod pa pa'o //
analyzed: sgra ni tshangs pa dam pa de'i rang bzhin dngos po thams cad yod do zhes pa ste / brda sprod pa pa'o //
translated: There is a thing that is the nature of that.”

original: nus pa gcig pus 'di dag thams cad spro zhing sdud pas na /
analyzed: nus pa gcig pus 'di dag thams cad spro zhing sdud pas na /
translated: The Saṃkhyas say, “Since all of these are expanded and contracted by a single power,

original: de'i rang bzhin dngos po thams cad yod ces nus pa pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin dngos po thams cad yod ces nus pa pa'o //
translated: there is a thing that is the nature of that power.”

original: 'dus byas pa thams cad ni rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas pa thams cad ni rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa ste /
translated: The Mīmāṃsakas say, “All conditioned things are permanent, painful, empty, and without self.”

original: bye brag tu smra ba pa'o //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba pa'o //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas.🔽The Pratyekabuddhas.🔽The Vijñānavādins.🔽The Mādhyamikas.

original: rnam par rig pa yod kyi dngos po ni med do zhes rang sangs rgyas pa'i'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa yod kyi dngos po ni med do zhes rang sangs rgyas pa'i'o //
translated: The Sautrāntikas.🔽The Vātsīputrīyas.🔽The Lokāyatas.🔽The Nirgranthas.🔽The Lokāyatas.

original: phyi rol gyi rnam pa dang bral ba sprin med pa'i nam mkha' dang mtshungs @298a * //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rnam pa dang bral ba sprin med pa'i nam mkha' dang mtshungs @298a * //
translated: The Nirgranthas.

original: pa rnam par rig pa nyid sna tshogs yin no zhes rnam par dpyod pa pa'o //
analyzed: pa rnam par rig pa nyid sna tshogs yin no zhes rnam par dpyod pa pa'o //
translated: The Lokāyatas.🔽The Nirgranthas.🔽The Lokāyatas.

original: gzung ba ni 'dzin pa dang gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i phyir stong pa yin no zhes dbu ma pa ste /
analyzed: gzung ba ni 'dzin pa dang gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i phyir stong pa yin no zhes dbu ma pa ste /
translated: The Nirgranthas.

original: de dag thams cad yod pa nyid du smra ba pa'o //🔽med par smra ba ni ji ltar 'tsho bas bde ba 'tsho //
analyzed: de dag thams cad yod pa nyid du smra ba pa'o // med par smra ba ni ji ltar 'tsho bas bde ba 'tsho //
translated: The Lokāyatas.

original: 'chi 'pho ba ni khyod la med //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba ni khyod la med //
translated: The Nirgranthas.🔽The Lokāyatas.🔽The Nirgranthas.🔽The Lokāyatas.

original: thal bar gyur pa shi ba ni //
analyzed: thal bar gyur pa shi ba ni //
translated: The Nirgranthas.

original: slar 'od ba ni ga la yod //
analyzed: slar 'od ba ni ga la yod //
translated: The Lokāyatas.

original: ces bya ste /
analyzed: ces bya ste /
translated: The Nirgranthas.🔽The Lokāyatas.🔽The Nirgranthas.🔽The Lokāyatas.🔽The Nirgranthas.

original: 'byung ba shes par bya ba ni 'jig rten rgyang pa na ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba shes par bya ba ni 'jig rten rgyang pa na ba'o //
translated: The Lokāyatas.🔽The Nirgranthas.🔽The Lokāyatas.🔽The Nirgranthas.🔽The Lokāyatas.🔽The Nirgranthas.🔽The Lokāyatas.🔽The Nirgranthas.🔽The Lokāyatas.🔽The Nirgranthas.🔽The Lokāyatas.🔽The Nirgranthas.🔽The Lokāyatas.🔽The Nirgranthas.🔽The Lokāyatas.🔽The Nirgranthas.🔽The Lokāyatas.🔽The Nirgranthas.🔽The Lokāyatas.🔽The Nirgranthas.🔽The Lokāyatas.🔽The Nirgranthas.🔽The Lokāyatas.🔽The Nirgranthas.🔽The Lokāyatas.🔽The Nirgranthas.🔽The Lokāyatas.🔽The Nirgranthas.🔽The Lokāyatas.🔽The Nirgranthas.🔽The Lokāyatas.🔽The Nirgranthas.🔽The Lokāyatas.🔽The Nirgranthas.🔽The Lokāyatas.🔽The Nirgranthas.🔽The Lokāyatas.🔽The Nirgranthas.🔽The Lokāyatas.🔽The Nirgranthas.🔽The Lokāyatas.🔽The Nirgranthas.🔽The Lokāyatas.🔽The Nirgranthas.🔽The Lokāyatas.🔽The Nirgranthas.🔽The Lokāyatas.🔽The Nirgranthas.🔽The Lokāyatas.🔽The Nirgranthas.🔽The Lokāyatas

original: yod pa dang med pa de dag dbus ni gnyis ka'i tsha'i rang bzhin las 'das pa ni bral ba ste me long lta bu'i ye shes so //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa de dag dbus ni gnyis ka'i tsha'i rang bzhin las 'das pa ni bral ba ste me long lta bu'i ye shes so //
translated: The middle of those existences and non-existences is beyond the nature of both, i.e., free, which is mirror-like intuition.

original: 'byung ba ni khams phra ba sa la sogs pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni khams phra ba sa la sogs pa bzhi'o //
translated: The elements are the four subtle ones, earth, etc.

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa ni de rnams kyi byas par rigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa ni de rnams kyi byas par rigs pa'o //
translated: The derivative elements are the gross ones, which are the products of those.

original: de las byung ba ni skyes pa ste de'i rang bzhin rnam par dag pa ni rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de las byung ba ni skyes pa ste de'i rang bzhin rnam par dag pa ni rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The one arisen from that is born, and the nature of that is purity, which is the nature of purity.

original: sems can kun gyi lus yin te //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi lus yin te //
translated: The body of all sentient beings🔽is the body of the Buddha,🔽the body of the Bodhisattva,🔽and the body of the Tathagata.

original: zhes bya ba ni khyad par du 'dzin cing 'ching bas na lus ni gti mug ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khyad par du 'dzin cing 'ching bas na lus ni gti mug ste /
translated: The body is ignorance, because it is bound by the grasping of distinctions.

original: de kho na nyid kyis mi mthun par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyis mi mthun par gyur pa ste /
translated: It is the opposite of reality.

original: sems can las rgyal bas rgyal te /
analyzed: sems can las rgyal bas rgyal te /
translated: It is the conqueror of sentient beings, because it is victorious over them.

original: de las kyang rgyal zhing zil gyis gnon pas na dzi na dzi ka ste /
analyzed: de las kyang rgyal zhing zil gyis gnon pas na dzi na dzi ka ste /
translated: And it is the conqueror of that, because it is victorious over and dominates that.

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin rnam par snang mdzad de rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin rnam par snang mdzad de rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: It is Vairocana, the nature of mirror-like intuition, which is the completion stage.

original: re zhig sems ni mnyam pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pas na rin chen dang 'dra bas na rin chen te /
analyzed: re zhig sems ni mnyam pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pas na rin chen dang 'dra bas na rin chen te /
translated: The mind is like a jewel, since it is the nature of equality.

original: de nyid nam mkha'i khams rnam par dag pas nam mkha'i mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis /
analyzed: de nyid nam mkha'i khams rnam par dag pas nam mkha'i mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis /
translated: That very [mind] is the sky treasury meditative stabilization, since the space element is pure.

original: don kun ni mngon par 'dod pa'i rim pas 'byung ba ste skyed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: don kun ni mngon par 'dod pa'i rim pas 'byung ba ste skyed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: All objects are the cause of arising, i.e., production, in the order of what is desired.

original: de bas na tshor bya dang tshor byed dang tshor ba'i bdag nyid kyis rnam par shes pa dag par byed pas na de nyid rin chen te /
analyzed: de bas na tshor bya dang tshor byed dang tshor ba'i bdag nyid kyis rnam par shes pa dag par byed pas na de nyid rin chen te /
translated: Therefore, since it purifies consciousness, which is the nature of the experiencer, the experienced, and the experience itself, it is a jewel.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i rin chen 'dzin pas na /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i rin chen 'dzin pas na /
translated: Since it holds a jewel like that,

original: ratna dhri ka ste /
analyzed: ratna dhri ka ste /
translated: it is ratnadhṛk.

original: de ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That is the completion stage.

original: thun mong ma yin pa de kho na nyid la rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i chos ni mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa de kho na nyid la rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i chos ni mtshan nyid de /
translated: The characteristic is the phenomenon that establishes the uncommon reality.

original: dper na lto ba che ba'i bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na lto ba che ba'i bum pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like a pot with a large belly.

original: de 'dzin par byed pa'i bdag nyid ni 'du shes so //
analyzed: de 'dzin par byed pa'i bdag nyid ni 'du shes so //
translated: The nature of holding that is discrimination.

original: de'i yul ni bum pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de'i yul ni bum pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Its object is the characteristic of a pot, etc.

original: gang gi mtshon pa de ni bya ba'i mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: gang gi mtshon pa de ni bya ba'i mtshan nyid de //
translated: That which is indicated is the characteristic of activity.

original: gsum po'i bdag nyid 'du shes kyi phung po de rnam par dag par byed pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: gsum po'i bdag nyid 'du shes kyi phung po de rnam par dag par byed pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: The aggregate of perception, which is the nature of the three, is the entity that purifies.

original: de bzhin du kun ni me'i khams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun ni me'i khams so //
translated: Similarly, all is the fire element.

original: kun gyis ni khyab par byed @298b pa so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dag par byed pas na dngos po'o //
analyzed: kun gyis ni khyab par byed @298b pa so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dag par byed pas na dngos po'o //
translated: All pervades, and the wisdom of discernment is purified, so it is the entity.

original: dga' ba'i mtshan nyid ni bud med kyi mtshan pa /
analyzed: dga' ba'i mtshan nyid ni bud med kyi mtshan pa /
translated: The characteristic of joy is the sign of a woman.

original: mtshan gzhi ni dmigs shing skye ba ste /
analyzed: mtshan gzhi ni dmigs shing skye ba ste /
translated: The basis of the sign is the object that arises.

original: 'dod chags so //
analyzed: 'dod chags so //
translated: It is desire.

original: ye shes de nyid kyis de la rgyal par byed pas na a'a ro li ka ste /
analyzed: ye shes de nyid kyis de la rgyal par byed pas na a'a ro li ka ste /
translated: Since that wisdom itself is victorious over that, it is Ārolikā.

original: 'od dpag tu med pa'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes kyi ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med pa'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes kyi ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: It is the wisdom that has the nature of Amitābha.

original: rnam par shes rab mthar phyin ni bya ba nan tan sgrub pa'i rang bzhin 'gro ba'i don byed pa de nyid phrag dog gi nyon mongs pa 'joms par byed pas na shes rab ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes rab mthar phyin ni bya ba nan tan sgrub pa'i rang bzhin 'gro ba'i don byed pa de nyid phrag dog gi nyon mongs pa 'joms par byed pas na shes rab ces bya'o //
translated: The wisdom that has perfected insight is the activity of accomplishing the welfare of migrating beings. Since that itself conquers the affliction of jealousy, it is called “insight.”

original: de bas na 'du byed sems pa ni 'du byed kyi phung po rnam par dag pa dang / 'dzin pa ni rlung gi khams rnam par dag par byed pas ye shes de nyid pradzny'a dhri ka ste /
analyzed: de bas na 'du byed sems pa ni 'du byed kyi phung po rnam par dag pa dang / 'dzin pa ni rlung gi khams rnam par dag par byed pas ye shes de nyid pradzny'a dhri ka ste /
translated: Thus, the formation volition is the purification of the aggregate of formation, and the grasping is the purification of the wind element.

original: don yod grub pa'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes te rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: don yod grub pa'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes te rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That very gnosis is Prajñādhṛk, the nature of Amoghasiddhi, the stage of completion.

original: don 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: don 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bshad par bya ste /
translated: In order to clarify this very meaning, it is explained:

original: rigs ni rgyud de de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs lnga'i rgyud do //
analyzed: rigs ni rgyud de de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs lnga'i rgyud do //
translated: The lineage is the continuum, the continuum of the five lineages of the tathāgatas.

original: rgyud ni thog ma ste rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: rgyud ni thog ma ste rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: The continuum is the beginning, Mahāvajradhara.

original: mi 'jigs skye ba med pa ni mgon po de nyid de /
analyzed: mi 'jigs skye ba med pa ni mgon po de nyid de /
translated: The fearless, unborn, is that very lord.

original: de nyid kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi khyad par ro //
translated: That very one is the distinction.

original: spong ba'i rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa rnam par shes pa dang ye shes kyi zhe sdang rnam par dag pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes dang mi bskyod par bshad do //
analyzed: spong ba'i rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa rnam par shes pa dang ye shes kyi zhe sdang rnam par dag pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes dang mi bskyod par bshad do //
translated: By “the knowledge of abandonment,” and so on, the purification of the consciousness and gnosis that are the discordant classes and the antidotes, respectively, is explained as the gnosis of the dharmadhātu and Akṣobhya.

original: de bzhin du gzugs dang nyon mongs pa gti mug dang bems po bcings pa'i rang bzhin ni sa'i khams te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dang nyon mongs pa gti mug dang bems po bcings pa'i rang bzhin ni sa'i khams te /
translated: Likewise, the nature of form, the afflictions, delusion, and the inert is the earth element.

original: de rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: The nature of its complete purification is Vairocana.

original: tshor ba'i phung po dang nga rgyal dang dregs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po dang nga rgyal dang dregs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: The nature of the aggregate of feeling, pride, and the afflictive emotions is Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: 'du shes kyi phung po dang dngos po la chags pa ni nyon mongs pa'i 'dod chags dang / me'i khams rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po dang dngos po la chags pa ni nyon mongs pa'i 'dod chags dang / me'i khams rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: The nature of the aggregate of perception, attachment to things, and the afflictive passion, as well as the fire element, is Amitābha.

original: 'du byed dang phrag dog dang rkyen gyis drangs pa'i rang bzhin ni rlung gi khams rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: 'du byed dang phrag dog dang rkyen gyis drangs pa'i rang bzhin ni rlung gi khams rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The nature of the aggregate of formations, envy, and the conditions that give rise to things is the wind element.

original: don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: don yod grub pa'o //
translated: The nature of its complete purification is Amoghasiddhi.

original: de dang 'dra ba byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo nyid ni srid pa kun 'byung thams cad de /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo nyid ni srid pa kun 'byung thams cad de /
translated: The nature of the mind, which is like that, is the origin of all existence.

original: skye ba po de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba po de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the person is the nature of the five Tathagatas.

original: rigs bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'dod chags zhe sdang nyon mongs ldan pa ni de'i lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu @299a * //
analyzed: rigs bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'dod chags zhe sdang nyon mongs ldan pa ni de'i lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu @299a * //
translated: In order to teach the families, [the Bhagavān] declares, “Passion, aggression, and delusion,” which are the co-emergent causes of the families.

original: las skyes pang rgyal lam dregs pa gzhom par bya ba'i phyir dang / nor gyi dregs pa dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams kyi nga rgyal gzhom par bya ba'i phyir nor bu'i rigs te /
analyzed: las skyes pang rgyal lam dregs pa gzhom par bya ba'i phyir dang / nor gyi dregs pa dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams kyi nga rgyal gzhom par bya ba'i phyir nor bu'i rigs te /
translated: The family of the jewel is for the sake of conquering the pride and haughtiness that arise from karma, and for the sake of conquering the pride of sentient beings who are endowed with the haughtiness of wealth.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rin po che'i char gyis bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rigs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rin po che'i char gyis bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rigs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the family of Ratnasaṃbhava is that it fulfills all wishes with a rain of various jewels.

original: dam tshig gi rigs zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba sna tshogs kyi las las skyes pa'i 'bras bu 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: dam tshig gi rigs zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba sna tshogs kyi las las skyes pa'i 'bras bu 'dra ba ste /
translated: The family of commitment is the result born from the karma of various beings, which is similar.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i mtshan nyid dam tshig dang sdom pa sbyin pas 'joms pas na dam tshig gi rigs ni don yod grub pa'i rigs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i mtshan nyid dam tshig dang sdom pa sbyin pas 'joms pas na dam tshig gi rigs ni don yod grub pa'i rigs zhes bya'o //
