translated: The family of the commitment is called the family of Amoghasiddhi, because it destroys the characteristics of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience by the gift of the commitments and vows.

original: de bzhin du gnyis med ye shes ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi chos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis med ye shes ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi chos te /
translated: Similarly, nondual intuition is the reality of mirror-intuition.

original: de'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po'i nga rgyal byed pa ni khyab par byed pa rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po'i nga rgyal byed pa ni khyab par byed pa rmongs pa ste /
translated: The pride in the nature of that reality is the pervader.

original: de la chags pa'i rang bzhin ni gti mug gi rigs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la chags pa'i rang bzhin ni gti mug gi rigs zhes bya'o //
translated: The nature of attachment to that is called the family of delusion.

original: de la gnyis su med pa'i ye shes de la nyon mongs pa rnam par dag pas phan tshun 'byer ba ni zhe sdang dang chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i tshul gyis bzhag pa gang yin pa de ni zhe sdang ste /
analyzed: de la gnyis su med pa'i ye shes de la nyon mongs pa rnam par dag pas phan tshun 'byer ba ni zhe sdang dang chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i tshul gyis bzhag pa gang yin pa de ni zhe sdang ste /
translated: In that nondual intuition, the mutual separation of the afflictions through purification is the anger that is posited as the antidote and the discordant side of the intuition of the realm of reality.

original: zhe sdang gi rigs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi rigs zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called the family of anger.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chags pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'dod chags gang yin pa de ni ye shes kyi thabs kyis sbyor bar mdzad pas na 'dod chags kyi rigs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chags pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'dod chags gang yin pa de ni ye shes kyi thabs kyis sbyor bar mdzad pas na 'dod chags kyi rigs so //
translated: The characteristic of mundane passion is that any passion is employed as the means of intuition, and so is the family of passion.

original: gti mug la sogs pa'i rigs de rnams nyon mongs pa rnam par dag pa ye shes kyi rang bzhin la dga' ba gang la yod pa de ni gti mug dga' ma la sogs pa ste don dam pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: gti mug la sogs pa'i rigs de rnams nyon mongs pa rnam par dag pa ye shes kyi rang bzhin la dga' ba gang la yod pa de ni gti mug dga' ma la sogs pa ste don dam pa'i phyogs so //
translated: Those families of delusion, etc., are the families of Delusion's Delight, etc., in which there is delight in the intuition that is the purification of the addictions.

original: kun rdzob ni bud med ni rang bzhin gyis gzugs la dmigs shing 'dod chags kyi rigs can gyi sems can gdon pa'i thabs kyis gti mug la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa dang / yang dag par sbyor zhing bde ba nyams su myong bar byed ba spyan la sogs pa'i lha mo ni gti mug dga' ma la sogs par bshad do //
analyzed: kun rdzob ni bud med ni rang bzhin gyis gzugs la dmigs shing 'dod chags kyi rigs can gyi sems can gdon pa'i thabs kyis gti mug la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa dang / yang dag par sbyor zhing bde ba nyams su myong bar byed ba spyan la sogs pa'i lha mo ni gti mug dga' ma la sogs par bshad do //
translated: Conventionally, a woman is one who observes form by nature, and is the means of liberating the sentient beings who are of the family of passion. By the method of uniting with Vairochana, etc., who are the nature of the purification of delusion, etc., the goddesses Locana, etc., experience the bliss of the ultimate.

original: de ltar na nyon mongs pa gsum dang / de bzhin du rdo rje ste phrag dog dang de dag rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na nyon mongs pa gsum dang / de bzhin du rdo rje ste phrag dog dang de dag rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, the three afflictions, and likewise, the vajra, i.e., envy, are the consorts Locana, etc.

original: dga' ma ni spyan la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: dga' ma ni spyan la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: for the sake of purifying them.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas ni sems can thams cad de @299b sems can thams cad gdul bar bya ba'i phyir thabs ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas ni sems can thams cad de @299b sems can thams cad gdul bar bya ba'i phyir thabs ni rgyu'o //
translated: Therefore, the Buddha is all sentient beings, and the method is the cause for the sake of training all sentient beings.

original: de nyid rdo rje theg pa ste rgyun ma chad pa'i sems can gyi don rdzogs par byed pa la ma yin no zhes rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje theg pa ste rgyun ma chad pa'i sems can gyi don rdzogs par byed pa la ma yin no zhes rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That itself is the Vajra Vehicle, which accomplishes the uninterrupted benefit of sentient beings, not the stage of completion.

original: sgo srung rnam par dag par bya ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: sgo srung rnam par dag par bya ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: The purification of the gatekeepers should be explained.

original: mi 'jig pa'i bdag nyid stong pa nyid rnam par thar pa'i sgo'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mi 'jig pa'i bdag nyid stong pa nyid rnam par thar pa'i sgo'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the gate of liberation of emptiness, which has the nature of indestructibility,

original: ma skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid ni thog ma nas ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid ni thog ma nas ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: is the nature of non-arising, which is the nature of non-arising from the beginning.

original: chos thams cad ni phung po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni phung po la sogs pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are the aggregates, etc.

original: de'i rang bzhin yongs su ma shes pa ni gshin rje ste /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin yongs su ma shes pa ni gshin rje ste /
translated: The complete non-understanding of their nature is Yama.

original: de'i dngos po kun gyi dam tshig ni de dag mthar byed pa stong pa nyid rnam par thar pa'i sgo'i rang bzhin ni gshin rje mthar byed do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po kun gyi dam tshig ni de dag mthar byed pa stong pa nyid rnam par thar pa'i sgo'i rang bzhin ni gshin rje mthar byed do //
translated: The commitment of all things is the nature of the gate of liberation that is emptiness, which is the terminator of those.

original: de bzhin du rnam shes min bdag chos rnams ni dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan dang bral ba /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam shes min bdag chos rnams ni dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan dang bral ba /
translated: Similarly, the phenomena that are not the self of consciousness are free from the signs of a cause such as a divine creator.

original: don dam mi 'gyur dag 'gyur nyid ni mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par dag pa'i sgo'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: don dam mi 'gyur dag 'gyur nyid ni mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par dag pa'i sgo'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The ultimate, unchanging, and pure nature is the nature of the gate of liberation that is signlessness.

original: sems kun gyi ni dam tshig sti //
analyzed: sems kun gyi ni dam tshig sti //
translated: The commitment of all minds is the nature of the gate of liberation that is wishlessness.

original: de mi shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni shes rab ste /
analyzed: de mi shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni shes rab ste /
translated: The characteristic of not knowing that is wisdom.

original: de mthar byed pas na shes rab mthar byed do //
analyzed: de mthar byed pas na shes rab mthar byed do //
translated: The terminator of that is Prajñānta.

original: smon pa med pa'i phyir bstan du med pas na brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid ngo //
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i phyir bstan du med pas na brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid ngo //
translated: Since it is taught to be wishless, it is inexpressible because it is not visible.🔽Therefore, the entity of the mind that is free from the aggregates of formation and so on is the nature of the gate of liberation that is wishlessness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sngar bshad pa'i rig pas ming dang gzugs blo dngos po med pa ni 'du byed kyi phung po la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sngar bshad pa'i rig pas ming dang gzugs blo dngos po med pa ni 'du byed kyi phung po la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Since the name and form of the previously explained vidyā are nonexistent, they are free from the aggregates of formation and so on.

original: de rnams kyi rang bzhin mi shes pas na bems po yin pas na padma'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang bzhin mi shes pas na bems po yin pas na padma'o //
translated: Since their nature is not known, they are “dull” and hence “lotuses.”

original: chos rnams kun gyi dam tshig ni smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo'i rang bzhin ni padma mthar byed do //
analyzed: chos rnams kun gyi dam tshig ni smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo'i rang bzhin ni padma mthar byed do //
translated: The pledge of all phenomena is the nature of the emptiness gate of liberation, and so is Padma-Udbhava.

original: mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i bdag nyid dang / rang bzhin yongs su dag pa'i chos thams cad ngo //
analyzed: mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i bdag nyid dang / rang bzhin yongs su dag pa'i chos thams cad ngo //
translated: The nature of the signless gate of liberation is the nonconceptual self, and the nature of the wishless gate of liberation is the purity of all phenomena.

original: de'i rang bzhin yongs su mi shes pa ni bgegs so //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin yongs su mi shes pa ni bgegs so //
translated: Since their nature is not known, they are “obstructions.”

original: de dag mthar byed pas na mngon par 'du sam byas pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo'i rang bzhin ni bgegs mthar byed do //
analyzed: de dag mthar byed pas na mngon par 'du sam byas pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo'i rang bzhin ni bgegs mthar byed do //
translated: Since he destroys them, the nature of the non-fabricated gate of liberation is Vajra-Vighnāntaka.

original: mi 'jig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sog bzhi'i nye bar bsdus pa ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'jig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sog bzhi'i nye bar bsdus pa ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The line “the indestructible and so on” includes the four gates of liberation, such as emptiness and so on, which is the completion stage.

original: gti mug ni ma dad pa'o //
analyzed: gti mug ni ma dad pa'o //
translated: “ Delusion” is non-faith.

original: de'i longs spyod ni spong bar byed pa ma dad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i longs spyod ni spong bar byed pa ma dad pa'o //
translated: Its enjoyment is the non-faith that causes abandonment.

original: gti mug ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba'o //
analyzed: gti mug ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba'o //
translated: Delusion is the view of the transitory composite.

original: de zad par byed pa ste de bzhin @300a * //
analyzed: de zad par byed pa ste de bzhin @300a * //
translated: He destroys them, and so he is called “Destroyer of Death.”

original: du lus ni phung po'i bdud do //
analyzed: du lus ni phung po'i bdud do //
translated: The body is the demon of the aggregates.

original: shes bya ni shes bya'i sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya ni shes bya'i sgrib pa'o //
translated: The knowable is the obscuration of the knowable.

original: de dag 'khor ba rnams gsod par byed pas na gshin rje'o //
analyzed: de dag 'khor ba rnams gsod par byed pas na gshin rje'o //
translated: He kills those in cyclic existence, and so he is called “Yama.”

original: de dag dang pas mthar byed pas na gshin rje mthar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag dang pas mthar byed pas na gshin rje mthar byed pa'o //
translated: He destroys them with the first, and so he is called “Destroyer of Yama.”

original: nyes pa ni mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: Evil is the extreme view.

original: nyes pa longs spyod ni de rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa longs spyod ni de rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The enjoyment of evil is its purification.

original: nyes pa ni dge ba'i las le lo ste /
analyzed: nyes pa ni dge ba'i las le lo ste /
translated: Evil is laziness in virtuous action.

original: de la shes rab ni brtson 'grus kyi mthar byed pas na shes rab mthar byed do //
analyzed: de la shes rab ni brtson 'grus kyi mthar byed pas na shes rab mthar byed do //
translated: Wisdom is the destroyer of laziness, and so he is called “Destroyer of Wisdom.”

original: de bas na mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba rnam par dag pas zhe sdang mthar byed kyang yin la /
analyzed: de bas na mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba rnam par dag pas zhe sdang mthar byed kyang yin la /
translated: Therefore, he is the destroyer of hatred through the purification of the extreme view,

original: le lo rnam par dag pas shes rab mthar byed yin no //
analyzed: le lo rnam par dag pas shes rab mthar byed yin no //
translated: and he is the destroyer of wisdom through the purification of laziness.

original: sems ni nyon mongs pa'i bdud de /
analyzed: sems ni nyon mongs pa'i bdud de /
translated: The mind is the demon of the afflictions.

original: de rnam par dag pas na sems mthar byed do //
analyzed: de rnam par dag pas na sems mthar byed do //
translated: He destroys it through its purification, and so he is called “Destroyer of Mind.”

original: nyon mongs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'o //
translated: Afflictions are the afflictive obstructions.

original: de rnam par dag pas nyon mongs pa mthar byed do //
analyzed: de rnam par dag pas nyon mongs pa mthar byed do //
translated: Since they are purified, the afflictions are terminated.

original: de bas na brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin ni shes rab mthar byed do //
analyzed: de bas na brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin ni shes rab mthar byed do //
translated: Therefore, the nature of effort is the termination of wisdom.

original: 'dod chags ni brjod ngas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni brjod ngas pa'o //
translated: Attachment is the expression.

original: yang 'dod chags ni 'chi bdag gi bdud do //
analyzed: yang 'dod chags ni 'chi bdag gi bdud do //
translated: Moreover, attachment is the demon of the Lord of Death.

original: de dag zad pa ni padma mthar byed do //
analyzed: de dag zad pa ni padma mthar byed do //
translated: Since they are exhausted, the termination of the lotus is the termination of attachment.

original: yang 'dod chags ni log pa'i lta ba ste /
analyzed: yang 'dod chags ni log pa'i lta ba ste /
translated: Moreover, attachment is a false view.

original: de mthar byed pas ni chags pa mthar byed do //
analyzed: de mthar byed pas ni chags pa mthar byed do //
translated: Since it is terminated, the termination of attachment is the termination of passion.

original: snyoms 'jug ni srid pa gzhan la 'pho ba ste /
analyzed: snyoms 'jug ni srid pa gzhan la 'pho ba ste /
translated: Absorption is the transference to another existence.

original: skye ba'i sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i sgrib pa'o //
translated: It is the obstruction of birth.

original: de rnam par dag pas na snyoms 'jug mthar byed ni dran pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de rnam par dag pas na snyoms 'jug mthar byed ni dran pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Since it is purified, the termination of absorption is the nature of mindfulness.

original: padma mthar byed do //
analyzed: padma mthar byed do //
translated: It is the termination of the lotus.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pas na rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pas na rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
translated: All afflictions are distractions because they become the cause of all afflictions.

original: sems can thams cad rlag par byed pas na rdo rje ste rdo rje dang 'dra bas lha'i bu'i bdud do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad rlag par byed pas na rdo rje ste rdo rje dang 'dra bas lha'i bu'i bdud do //
translated: Since it destroys all sentient beings, it is a vajra, like a vajra, and is the devaputra māra.

original: sgrib pa ni las kyi sgrib pa dang kun ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa ni las kyi sgrib pa dang kun ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Obscuration is karmic obscuration, and all is the overestimation of discipline and ritual.

original: de rnam par dag par byed pas na bgegs mthar byed do //
analyzed: de rnam par dag par byed pas na bgegs mthar byed do //
translated: Since it purifies those, it is Vighnāntakṛt.

original: rnam par dag pa'i 'bras bu bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i 'bras bu bshad par bya ste /
translated: The result of purification should be explained.

original: nyon mongs pa ni ma dag pa la sogs pa de rnams brtan pas na rje'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni ma dag pa la sogs pa de rnams brtan pas na rje'o //
translated: Afflictions are the lords of those impurities, etc., since they are stable.

original: de rnams kyi sgrib pa'i sems gang yin pa de rnam par dag par gyur na las thams cad ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sgrib pa'i sems gang yin pa de rnam par dag par gyur na las thams cad ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the mind that is the obscuration of those is purified, all karma, both virtuous and nonvirtuous karma, is purified.

original: las rnam par dag par gyur na rnal 'byor ba'i 'bras bu ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob pa'i mtshan nyid dag pa chos kyi sku rnal 'byor pas thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: las rnam par dag par gyur na rnal 'byor ba'i 'bras bu ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob pa'i mtshan nyid dag pa chos kyi sku rnal 'byor pas thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: When karma is purified, the result of the yogi is the attainment of the state of Mahāvajradhara, which is the attainment of the pure dharmakāya by the yogi.

original: de bas na don bsdus pa @300b ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de bas na don bsdus pa @300b ni 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, the summary of the meaning is this:

original: ma dad pa phung po'i bdud dang 'jig tshogs kyi lta ba dang shes bya'i sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: ma dad pa phung po'i bdud dang 'jig tshogs kyi lta ba dang shes bya'i sgrib pa ste /
translated: Lack of faith is the demon of the aggregates, the view of the transitory collection, and the obscuration of knowables.

original: 'di dag 'joms pa dad pa'i rang bzhin ni gshin rje mthar byed do //
analyzed: 'di dag 'joms pa dad pa'i rang bzhin ni gshin rje mthar byed do //
translated: The one who conquers these, having the nature of faith, is Yamântaka.

original: le lo dang nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ste 'di dag 'joms pas brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin shes rab mthar byed do //
analyzed: le lo dang nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ste 'di dag 'joms pas brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin shes rab mthar byed do //
translated: Laziness is the demon of afflictions, the view of grasping, and the obscuration of afflictions. The one who conquers these, having the nature of effort, is Prajñânta.

original: brjed ngas pa dang 'chi bdag gi bdud dang log par lta ba dang skye ba'i sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: brjed ngas pa dang 'chi bdag gi bdud dang log par lta ba dang skye ba'i sgrib pa ste /
translated: Forgetfulness is the demon of the lord of death, the view of nihilism, and the obscuration of birth.

original: 'di dag spong bas na dran pa'i gzhi ste padma mthar byed do //
analyzed: 'di dag spong bas na dran pa'i gzhi ste padma mthar byed do //
translated: The one who abandons these, having the nature of mindfulness, is Padmaântaka.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba dang lha'i bu'i bdud dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang las kyi sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba dang lha'i bu'i bdud dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang las kyi sgrib pa ste /
translated: Distraction is the demon of the sons of the gods, the view of holding to an extreme, and the obscuration of karma.

original: 'di dag rnam par dag pas ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin ni bgegs mthar byed do //
analyzed: 'di dag rnam par dag pas ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin ni bgegs mthar byed do //
translated: The one who purifies these, having the nature of samâdhi, is Vighnântaka.

original: de ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection stage.

original: gtsug tor la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa bshad par bya ste /🔽'dis gzung bas na gzung ba'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: gtsug tor la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa bshad par bya ste / 'dis gzung bas na gzung ba'i dbang po'o //
translated: The purities of the uṣṇīṣa and so forth should be explained.🔽The sense faculty of the object is that by which objects are apprehended.

original: chags ba ni chags ba bskyed pa ste yul lo //
analyzed: chags ba ni chags ba bskyed pa ste yul lo //
translated: The object is that which generates attachment.

original: rnam pa ni yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa ni yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The aspect is the mental activity.

original: mi g-yo ba ni gang gi dbang gis rnam par shes pa gnod pa med pas don 'dzin pa de ni snang ba'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba ni gang gi dbang gis rnam par shes pa gnod pa med pas don 'dzin pa de ni snang ba'o //
translated: The illumination is that by which consciousness is unimpaired and apprehends objects.

original: mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa bzhi po de dag ni nye bar len pa dang lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu'i dbye bas gnas so //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa bzhi po de dag ni nye bar len pa dang lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu'i dbye bas gnas so //
translated: These four—the eye, form, illumination, and mental activity—are the basis, divided into the substantial cause and cooperative conditions.

original: gang zhig 'das ma thag tu byung ba mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skad cig ma de snga ma'i skad cig ma ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: gang zhig 'das ma thag tu byung ba mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skad cig ma de snga ma'i skad cig ma ni rgyu'o //
translated: The cause is the previous moment of the eye consciousness and so forth that has just ceased.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni 'bras bu ste /
translated: The eye consciousness is the result.

original: rgyu drug las sems yang dag par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu drug las sems yang dag par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The mind arises from the six causes.

original: yang na mig la sogs pa nas yid kyi skye mched kyi bar du dbang po rnams las sems yang dag par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: yang na mig la sogs pa nas yid kyi skye mched kyi bar du dbang po rnams las sems yang dag par 'byung ba'o //
translated: Or else, the mind arises from the sense faculties, from the eye faculty up to the mind faculty.🔽Cause, co-emergence,

original: rgyu dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang // rnam par smin dang yang dag ldan //
analyzed: rgyu dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang // rnam par smin dang yang dag ldan //
translated: maturation, and right possession,

original: kun 'gro skal mnyam dang bcas pa //
analyzed: kun 'gro skal mnyam dang bcas pa //
translated: pervasiveness, and homogeneity,

original: rgyu ni rnam pa drug tu bshad //
analyzed: rgyu ni rnam pa drug tu bshad //
translated: these are explained as the six causes.

original: ces bya ba drug po de dag las sems yang dag par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba drug po de dag las sems yang dag par 'byung ba'o //
translated: From among these six, the mind arises.

original: de'i rnam par dag pa ni 'dod pa'i rgyal po nas gtsug tor gyi bar du khro bo drug bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam par dag pa ni 'dod pa'i rgyal po nas gtsug tor gyi bar du khro bo drug bshad pa'o //
translated: Its purification is explained as the six wrathful ones from Desire King up to Uṣṇīṣa.

original: de ni rnam par shes pa'i rnam par dag pa ste /🔽khro bo zhe sdang rigs las byung //
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa'i rnam par dag pa ste / khro bo zhe sdang rigs las byung //
translated: That is the purification of consciousness.

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //🔽dam tshig rdo rje la sogs pa drug ni le'u dang po las bshad pa'i rigs pas sgrib pa thams cad sel ba la sogs pa byang chub sems @301a * //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro // dam tshig rdo rje la sogs pa drug ni le'u dang po las bshad pa'i rigs pas sgrib pa thams cad sel ba la sogs pa byang chub sems @301a * //
translated: Because it is said, “Wrath arises from the family of hatred.”

original: dpa' drug ste /
analyzed: dpa' drug ste /
translated: The six, such as Samaya Vajra, are the six bodhisattvas, such as Sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin, explained in the first chapter by the reasoning.

original: sa la sogs pa 'byung ba lnga dang / sa 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i rang bzhin gyis rnam par shes pa'i khams la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa 'byung ba lnga dang / sa 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i rang bzhin gyis rnam par shes pa'i khams la gnas pa ste /
translated: The five elements such as earth, and the element of consciousness, which is the nature of the elements and the derivative elements, are located in the earth.

original: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: This is the purification of the elements and the derivative elements.

original: byams pa dang kun du bzang po ni rtsa rgyus thams cad dang tshigs thams cad rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: byams pa dang kun du bzang po ni rtsa rgyus thams cad dang tshigs thams cad rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Maitreya and Samantabhadra are the nature of the purification of all the veins and all the joints.

original: gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa ni lha mo drug ste /
analyzed: gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa ni lha mo drug ste /
translated: The six goddesses such as Rupavajra are the six sense objects.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: They are the purification of the sense objects such as form.

original: de bas na rig pa ni gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i rgyal po ni rig pa'i rgyal po ste /
analyzed: de bas na rig pa ni gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i rgyal po ni rig pa'i rgyal po ste /
translated: Therefore, the knowledge is Rupavajra and so forth, and the king is the knowledge king.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: The bodhisattvas.

original: rdo rje ni byang chub sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: rdo rje ni byang chub sems dpa' ste /
translated: The vajra is the bodhisattva.

original: de dag gi bdag po gang gi gtso bor gyur pa de ni rdo rje'i bdag po ste /
analyzed: de dag gi bdag po gang gi gtso bor gyur pa de ni rdo rje'i bdag po ste /
translated: The lord of those is the vajra lord,

original: gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa bshad do //
analyzed: gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa bshad do //
translated: who is explained as Rupavajra and so forth.

original: de ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the completion stage.

original: kun du spyod pa bshad par bya ste /🔽sku la sogs pa dang phung po la sogs pa thabs dang shes rab kyi sbyor ba ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang gnyis su med par snyoms par 'jug pa la dmigs te /
analyzed: kun du spyod pa bshad par bya ste / sku la sogs pa dang phung po la sogs pa thabs dang shes rab kyi sbyor ba ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang gnyis su med par snyoms par 'jug pa la dmigs te /
translated: The conduct should be explained.

original: cig car du rdo rje 'chang chen po'i gzugs dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pas 'gro ba 'di dag thams cad rang bzhin gyis dag pa'o zhes mos par byas la /
analyzed: cig car du rdo rje 'chang chen po'i gzugs dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pas 'gro ba 'di dag thams cad rang bzhin gyis dag pa'o zhes mos par byas la /
translated: The yogi/nī, endowed with the form of Great Vajradhara, having focused on the union of the body, etc. and the aggregates, etc. with the gnosis consort, non-dual union, should imagine that all of these migrating beings are naturally pure.

original: 'jigs pa thams cad ni skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba ni spangs pa ste //
analyzed: 'jigs pa thams cad ni skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba ni spangs pa ste //
translated: All fears are abandoned, i.e., free from the concepts of arising, ceasing, etc.

original: seng ge bzhin du dogs pa med bar bza' ba dang bza' ba ma yin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba ci snyed pa za ba'am bsam gtan gyis zas za ba can mnyam par ma bzhag pa ni spyod lam rnam pa bzhi por rang
analyzed: seng ge bzhin du dogs pa med bar bza' ba dang bza' ba ma yin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba ci snyed pa za ba'am bsam gtan gyis zas za ba can mnyam par ma bzhag pa ni spyod lam rnam pa bzhi por rang
translated: Like a lion, without hesitation, free from the concepts of edible and inedible, etc., one eats whatever is available, or one eats the food of concentration.

original: gi lha'i rnal 'byor gyis thams cad kyi rang bzhin du mthong bas rtag tu ni dus thams cad du mnyam par 'jog cing sems kun ni zag pa thams cad dang bral ba'i sems kyis spyod pa gang yin pa de ni kun du spyod pa zhes bya ste /🔽shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa ste sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: gi lha'i rnal 'byor gyis thams cad kyi rang bzhin du mthong bas rtag tu ni dus thams cad du mnyam par 'jog cing sems kun ni zag pa thams cad dang bral ba'i sems kyis spyod pa gang yin pa de ni kun du spyod pa zhes bya ste / shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa ste sgrub pa'o //
translated: Since one sees everything as the nature of the deity through the yoga of the deity, one is always in meditative equipoise at all times.🔽Any conduct with a mind free from all defilements is called “universal conduct.”🔽🔽This is the practice of the extremely unelaborate mode.🔽

original: sngags kyi spyod pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: sngags kyi spyod pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: The conduct of the mantra vehicle is explained as follows:

original: dbang po yul rnams ni shes rab dang thabs snyoms par 'jug pas rten cing blangs na /
analyzed: dbang po yul rnams ni shes rab dang thabs snyoms par 'jug pas rten cing blangs na /
translated: When the sense faculties and their objects are engaged in union through the union of wisdom and means,

original: yid ni bde ba'i rang bzhin ye shes skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid ni bde ba'i rang bzhin ye shes skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the mind, which is by nature bliss, gives rise to gnosis.

original: de mi mthun pa'i yid la byed pa nus par byed @301b ba dang / de kho na nyid srung bar byed pas skyob pas na sngags te /
analyzed: de mi mthun pa'i yid la byed pa nus par byed @301b ba dang / de kho na nyid srung bar byed pas skyob pas na sngags te /
translated: Since that [gnosis] protects the mind from engaging in discordant mental states and protects it from the afflictions, it is a mantra.

original: shes rab dang thabs snyoms par 'jug pa las byung ba bde ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs snyoms par 'jug pa las byung ba bde ba'o //
translated: It is bliss that arises from the union of wisdom and means.

original: de la dmigs nas 'jig rten spyod pa ni tha mal pa'i lus rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: de la dmigs nas 'jig rten spyod pa ni tha mal pa'i lus rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba /
translated: The conduct of the world in that regard is the conduct of the ordinary body free from discursive thought,

original: lha'i skur bsgoms ba blangs nas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga nye bar spyod pa'am /
analyzed: lha'i skur bsgoms ba blangs nas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga nye bar spyod pa'am /
translated: taking up the meditation on the deity's body, and enjoying the five sense objects.

original: gnas 'tshal du slong mo slong bas kun du bzang po'i go 'phang thob par bya ba'i phyir spyod pa gang yin pa de ni sngags kyi spyod pa zhes bya ba ste sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: gnas 'tshal du slong mo slong bas kun du bzang po'i go 'phang thob par bya ba'i phyir spyod pa gang yin pa de ni sngags kyi spyod pa zhes bya ba ste sgrub pa'o //
translated: Or, the conduct that is for the sake of attaining the state of Samantabhadra by begging for alms in the abode of the gods is called the conduct of mantra.

original: de ni spros pa med pa'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de ni spros pa med pa'i spyod pa'o //
translated: That is the unelaborate conduct.

original: bzlas pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bzlas pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: The recitation should be explained.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid ni 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldang ba'i rim gyis yin na tshig spangs pa'i rdo rje'i tshig gi snying po rnam par bsam pa ni don rtogs pa'i rnam par bsams nas so //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid ni 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldang ba'i rim gyis yin na tshig spangs pa'i rdo rje'i tshig gi snying po rnam par bsam pa ni don rtogs pa'i rnam par bsams nas so //
translated: The essence is by the process of entering, abiding, and rising. The vajra words free from words are contemplated as the essence. The meaning is contemplated as the realization.

original: spro dang bsdu ba ni 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldang bas so //
analyzed: spro dang bsdu ba ni 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldang bas so //
translated: Emanation and gathering are by entering, abiding, and rising.

original: sngags ni yi ge gsum ste /
analyzed: sngags ni yi ge gsum ste /
translated: The mantra is the three syllables.

original: de'i zlos pa ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de'i zlos pa ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: Its repetition is the application of going and coming.

original: de'i dbye bas ni steng dang logs dang dad po dang 'og gi dbye bas so //
analyzed: de'i dbye bas ni steng dang logs dang dad po dang 'og gi dbye bas so //
translated: Its division is the division of above, below, and in between.

original: zlos pas byed pa ni zo chun gyi 'khrul 'khor gyi rigs pas slob pa'o //
analyzed: zlos pas byed pa ni zo chun gyi 'khrul 'khor gyi rigs pas slob pa'o //
translated: Its performance is by repetition, like the principle of a waterwheel.

original: de ltar yi ge gsum gyis rim gyis bzlas pa bshad do //
analyzed: de ltar yi ge gsum gyis rim gyis bzlas pa bshad do //
translated: Thus the repetition of the three syllables is explained in sequence.

original: sangs rgyas sna tshogs rdo rje'i bdag ni me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes rang bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sna tshogs rdo rje'i bdag ni me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes rang bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
translated: The various buddhas, the nature of Vajra, are the Tathagatas, the nature of the mirrorlike intuition, etc.

original: de dag ye shes sa bon dag gis bsdu //
analyzed: de dag ye shes sa bon dag gis bsdu //
translated: They are gathered by the seed syllables of the intuitions.

original: zhes pa ni yi ge aom gyi nang du bzhugs par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni yi ge aom gyi nang du bzhugs par bya'o //
translated: The meaning is that they should be placed within the syllable Om.

original: byang chub bdag med ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin 'od dpag tu med pa'i sa bon te yi ge aa'o //
analyzed: byang chub bdag med ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin 'od dpag tu med pa'i sa bon te yi ge aa'o //
translated: Enlightenment, which is the nature of the discriminating intuition, is the seed of Amitabha, the syllable Ah.

original: bdag med ni de'i rigs can de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bsgoms nas de'i snying gar gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag med ni de'i rigs can de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bsgoms nas de'i snying gar gzhug par bya'o //
translated: The bodiless, which is of its family, is the Tathagatas. Having meditated on them, they should be placed in the heart.

original: de bzhin du sna tshogs bzhin du sna tshogs spros te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sna tshogs bzhin du sna tshogs spros te /
translated: Likewise, having emanated the various [syllables] in the same way as the various [seed syllables],

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin du gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa mi bskyod pa'i rigs can gyi yi ge h'um gis spro ba bya ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin du gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa mi bskyod pa'i rigs can gyi yi ge h'um gis spro ba bya ste /
translated: one should emanate the syllable hūṃ, which is the nature of the gnosis of the dharmadhātu, with the nature of the Akṣobhya family of the three secrets.

original: de ni rdo rje bzlas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rdo rje bzlas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That is called vajra recitation.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the stage of vajra recitation.

original: ngag gi bzlas pa bshad par bya ste /🔽bzlas pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i khams thams cad la bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la gson cig ces bya bar mos pas ngag kun bzlas pa ni sbrul la sogs pa'i sngags khro bo'i tshig gis @302a * //
analyzed: ngag gi bzlas pa bshad par bya ste / bzlas pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i khams thams cad la bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la gson cig ces bya bar mos pas ngag kun bzlas pa ni sbrul la sogs pa'i sngags khro bo'i tshig gis @302a * //
translated: Now, the recitation of speech will be explained.🔽Recitation is the recitation of all [mantras] with the thought Listen! to all tathāgatas residing in the entire realm of space.

original: bzlas pa gang yin pa de ni bzlas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bzlas pa gang yin pa de ni bzlas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is recited with wrathful words such as nāga and so on is called recitation.

original: las kyi rgyal po mchog gi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: las kyi rgyal po mchog gi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: This is the supreme king of actions samādhi.

original: sngags ni 'bod pa ste /
analyzed: sngags ni 'bod pa ste /
translated: Mantra is calling.

original: gsang nas brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gsang nas brjod pa'o //
translated: It is secret speech.

original: de bzhin du de nyid ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du de nyid ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Likewise, that is the nature of the Tathagatas, Vairochana, etc.

original: de'i bskul ba ni de'i dbye ba la brten cing aom la sogs pa smra ba rdo rje bzlas pa smra ba bzlas pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bskul ba ni de'i dbye ba la brten cing aom la sogs pa smra ba rdo rje bzlas pa smra ba bzlas pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: Its invocation is based on its differentiation, and the recitation of the vajra speech, beginning with Om, is the process of the recitation of speech.

original: de nas rgyas gdab pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rgyas gdab pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Then the seal should be explained.

original: de ni rgyas gdab pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de ni rgyas gdab pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: That is the fourfold seal:

original: ye shes sems dpa' gzhug pa'i rgyas gdab pa dang / ting nge 'dzin sems dpa'i rgyas gdab pa dang / dbang thob nas cod pan gyis rgyas gdab pa dang / mchod pa'i rgyas gdab pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' gzhug pa'i rgyas gdab pa dang / ting nge 'dzin sems dpa'i rgyas gdab pa dang / dbang thob nas cod pan gyis rgyas gdab pa dang / mchod pa'i rgyas gdab pa'o //
translated: the seal of the entry of the knowledge being, the seal of the concentration being, the seal of the diadem upon receiving initiation, and the seal of worship.

original: de nyid bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid bshad par bya ste /
translated: That should be explained.

original: ji ltar rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i dam tshig sems dpa' bsgom pa de bzhin du thugs byin gyis brlab pa ni ye shes sems dpa'i rgyas gdab par bya ba dang / de'i thugs kar yang de dang 'dra ba'i sa bon ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' bsgom pa'i rgyas gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i dam tshig sems dpa' bsgom pa de bzhin du thugs byin gyis brlab pa ni ye shes sems dpa'i rgyas gdab par bya ba dang / de'i thugs kar yang de dang 'dra ba'i sa bon ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' bsgom pa'i rgyas gdab par bya'o //
translated: And at their hearts, one should cultivate the concentration beings, the seed syllables similar to those.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dbang thob nas spyi bor sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid dang 'dra ba'i cod pan du de bzhin gshegs pas rgyas gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dbang thob nas spyi bor sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid dang 'dra ba'i cod pan du de bzhin gshegs pas rgyas gdab par bya'o //
translated: Having attained the empowerment of all the transcendent ones, one should be sealed by the transcendent ones as a crown, similar to the three beings, on one’s head.

original: de nas mchod pa'i dus su yang sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid dang 'dra bar mchod pa'i lha mo spro zhing mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mchod pa'i dus su yang sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid dang 'dra bar mchod pa'i lha mo spro zhing mchod par bya'o //
translated: Then, at the time of offering, one should emanate offering goddesses, similar to the three beings, and make offerings.

original: dkyil 'khor rgyal po dang las kyi rgyal po mchog go //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor rgyal po dang las kyi rgyal po mchog go //
translated: This is the supreme king of maṇḍalas and the supreme king of activities.

original: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bshad par bya ste /
translated: In order to clarify that, it should be explained.

original: rdo rje 'chang ba gang yin pa'i //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang ba gang yin pa'i //
translated: The one who holds the vajra

original: zhes pa snang mdzad la sogs pa gang yang rung ba rig ma'i shes rab dang ldan pa rnal 'byor pa ni sgrub pa pos bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa snang mdzad la sogs pa gang yang rung ba rig ma'i shes rab dang ldan pa rnal 'byor pa ni sgrub pa pos bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The practitioner, the yogin endowed with the knowledge of the consort, should meditate on any of the Buddhas, Vairochana and so on.

original: de'i longs spyod bzhi ni ye shes sems dpa' dang / ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' dang / bstod pa dang mchod pa rgyas gdab pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de'i longs spyod bzhi ni ye shes sems dpa' dang / ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' dang / bstod pa dang mchod pa rgyas gdab pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: His four enjoyments are the gnosis being, the concentration being, and the characteristics of the seal of praise and offering.

original: bdag byin rlabs la sogs pa ni rang dang 'dra bar ye shes sems dpa' la sogs pa shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag byin rlabs la sogs pa ni rang dang 'dra bar ye shes sems dpa' la sogs pa shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand the gnosis being and so on as being like oneself in the case of self-consecration and so on.

original: de ni dkyil 'khor dang las kyi rgyal po mchog go //
analyzed: de ni dkyil 'khor dang las kyi rgyal po mchog go //
translated: This is the supreme mandala and the king of rites.

original: spyir bshad cing khyad par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: spyir bshad cing khyad par bshad par bya ste /
translated: The general explanation and the specific explanation should be done.

original: dbang po ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams te /
analyzed: dbang po ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams te /
translated: The sense faculties are the Tathagatas.

original: rdo rje gcig pu ni rdo rje 'chang chen pos /
analyzed: rdo rje gcig pu ni rdo rje 'chang chen pos /
translated: The one vajra is the Great Vajradhara.

original: re re'i spyi bor dbang bskur ba @302b ni cod pan du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: re re'i spyi bor dbang bskur ba @302b ni cod pan du shes par bya'o //
translated: The consecration on the crown of each one should be understood as the diadem.

original: sngags rnams thams cad rnams kyi ni //
analyzed: sngags rnams thams cad rnams kyi ni //
translated: Of all the mantras,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' yang dag bsgom //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' yang dag bsgom //
translated: one should meditate on Vajrasattva.

original: zhes le'u bco lnga pa las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes le'u bco lnga pa las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is said in the fifteenth chapter.

original: snying po ni ye shes sems dpa' dang phyag rgya ni ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' dang / sngags tsam ni mchod pa'i lha mo ste ;
analyzed: snying po ni ye shes sems dpa' dang phyag rgya ni ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' dang / sngags tsam ni mchod pa'i lha mo ste ;
translated: The essence is the wisdom being, the seal is the concentration being, and the mere mantra is the offering goddesses.

original: de dag rang rig rim gyis rgyas gdab par bya ste khyad par ro //
analyzed: de dag rang rig rim gyis rgyas gdab par bya ste khyad par ro //
translated: One should seal them with one's own awareness in sequence.

original: dkyil 'khor rgyal po dang las kyi rgyal po mchog go //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor rgyal po dang las kyi rgyal po mchog go //
translated: The supreme king of mandalas and the supreme king of actions.

original: rgyas gdab pa'i rnam par bshad pa bya ste /
analyzed: rgyas gdab pa'i rnam par bshad pa bya ste /
translated: The explanation of the seal is as follows.

original: 'bras bu ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rdo rje 'chang gi sku'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rdo rje 'chang gi sku'o //
translated: The result is the body of Vajradhara, Vairochana, and so forth.

original: rgyu ni rdo rje 'chang chen po //
analyzed: rgyu ni rdo rje 'chang chen po //
translated: The cause is Great Vajradhara.

original: de la rjes su zhugs pas rgyas gdab par bya ste /
analyzed: de la rjes su zhugs pas rgyas gdab par bya ste /
translated: One should seal by entering into that.

original: 'bras bu ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sku ste /
translated: The result is the body of Vairochana, and so forth.

original: rgyu ni rdo rje sems dpa' sngar gyis bshad pa'i rigs kyi sa rgyas gdab par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu ni rdo rje sems dpa' sngar gyis bshad pa'i rigs kyi sa rgyas gdab par bya ste /
translated: The cause is Vajrasattva. One should seal the stage of the family explained previously.

original: de ltar bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate in that way.

original: gzhan du ni rgyu dang 'bras bu tha dad pa bsgoms na bskal pa bye ba brgyas kyang dngos grub thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ni rgyu dang 'bras bu tha dad pa bsgoms na bskal pa bye ba brgyas kyang dngos grub thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if one meditates on the cause and effect as different, one will not attain power even in a hundred million eons.

original: de bzhin du zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa bskyed pa la yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa bskyed pa la yang shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand in the same way the generation of the moon, vajra, and so on.

original: de ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That is the creation stage.

original: chos 'byung nges pa'i tshig bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: chos 'byung nges pa'i tshig bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now the term “source of phenomena” will be explained.

original: longs spyod bzhi ni spyan la sogs pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: longs spyod bzhi ni spyan la sogs pa bzhi ste /
translated: The four enjoyments are the four beginning with Locanā.

original: de dang yang dag par ldan pa ni yongs su bskor ba rig pa'i skyes bu reg bya rdo rje ma dang bcas pa'i skye sa bu ste rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: de dang yang dag par ldan pa ni yongs su bskor ba rig pa'i skyes bu reg bya rdo rje ma dang bcas pa'i skye sa bu ste rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: The one endowed with them is the one who is surrounded, the knowledge being Vajradhara, together with the tactile-vajra woman.🔽That Vajradhara, having transformed, meditates on the center of the source of phenomena as the body vajra, and so on, of the transcendent lords, meditating on the three corners.

original: rdo rje 'chang de yongs su gyur nas zhe sdang rdo rje dbus su bsgoms nas gru gsum du sku rdo rje la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa bsgom zhing chos 'byung de'i dbus su bhr'um las skyes pa'i 'khor lo rtsibs bcu pa ser po bsgoms te ;
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang de yongs su gyur nas zhe sdang rdo rje dbus su bsgoms nas gru gsum du sku rdo rje la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa bsgom zhing chos 'byung de'i dbus su bhr'um las skyes pa'i 'khor lo rtsibs bcu pa ser po bsgoms te ;
translated: In the center of that source of phenomena, one meditates on a yellow wheel with ten spokes, born from bhrūṃ.

original: / rtsibs bcu la 'phags pa gshin rje gshed la sogs pa khro bo bcu dgod cing 'gog pa rdo rje ste pha rol gnod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: / rtsibs bcu la 'phags pa gshin rje gshed la sogs pa khro bo bcu dgod cing 'gog pa rdo rje ste pha rol gnod par byed pa'o //
translated: The ten spokes are the ten wrathful ones, beginning with Ārya-Yamāntaka. The “stopping vajra” is the one who stops the enemy.

original: bsgrub pa ni bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub pa ni bskyed pa'o //
translated: “Accomplishment” is creation.

original: mchog tu mdzes pa ni m'a ma k'i mtsho skyes kyi nang du gnas pa dang / rdo rje 'chang gis byin gyis brlabs pa'i rdo rje 'bar ba ni me stag 'phro ba'o //
analyzed: mchog tu mdzes pa ni m'a ma k'i mtsho skyes kyi nang du gnas pa dang / rdo rje 'chang gis byin gyis brlabs pa'i rdo rje 'bar ba ni me stag 'phro ba'o //
translated: “Extremely beautiful” is Māmakī, who abides in the lake of the vajra, which is the blazing vajra blessed by Vajradhara, which is the shooting sparks.

original: 'khor ba ni kun du 'khor zhing mi g-yo ba ni nam mkha' ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba ni kun du 'khor zhing mi g-yo ba ni nam mkha' ste /
translated: “Samsara” is the wheel, and “immovable” is space.

original: de dang mtshungs pa ni de la gnas pa'i 'ja' tshon dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs pa ni de la gnas pa'i 'ja' tshon dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: “Similar to that” is the rainbow that abides in that.

original: de lta bu'i chos 'byung ni chos 'byung ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos 'byung ni chos 'byung ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: Such a source of phenomena is the cause of the source of phenomena.

original: rang bzhin dri med pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin @303a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin dri med pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin @303a * //
translated: “Naturally stainless” is the nature of the gnosis of the completely pure dharmadhātu.

original: bsgom par bya zhing mngon spyod la sogs ba'i phrin las bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom par bya zhing mngon spyod la sogs ba'i phrin las bya'o //

original: bya ba ste tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: bya ba ste tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: “One should do” is the remainder of the verse.

original: de ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That is the creation stage.

original: gang gi tshe chos 'byung ba da nyid ston ka'i zla ba ltar dkar ba 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo de'i lte ba la gnas pa de'i bdud rtsi thig le yungs kar gyi 'bru'i tshad tsam phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgoms na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos 'byung ba da nyid ston ka'i zla ba ltar dkar ba 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo de'i lte ba la gnas pa de'i bdud rtsi thig le yungs kar gyi 'bru'i tshad tsam phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgoms na /
translated: When one meditates on the essence of clear light, which is white like the autumn moon, located in the center of the very source of phenomena, the subtle yoga of the drop of nectar, the size of a mustard seed,

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That is the completion stage.

original: de la don bsdus pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la don bsdus pa 'di yin te /

analyzed: sngar ni gang rnyed pa'i ye shes bdud rtsi yan lag drug pa'i rnal 'byor gyi mtshan nyid sngar bshad pa rgyas par le'u bcu gnyis pa la sogs par gsungs pa de yang rdzogs pa'i rim pa yin te /
translated: The nectar of pristine awareness, which was previously found, is the nature of the six-branched yoga, as explained above. It is taught extensively in the twelfth chapter and so forth. It is also the stage of completion.

original: rim pa'i dbye ba'o//
analyzed: rim pa'i dbye ba'o//
translated: The two stages are as follows.

original: tshig gi don bcu drug bshad pa'i skabs su ji ltar rim pa gnyis yin no zhe na /
analyzed: tshig gi don bcu drug bshad pa'i skabs su ji ltar rim pa gnyis yin no zhe na /
translated: In the context of the explanation of the sixteen topics, how are they the two stages?

original: de ni skyon ma yin te rtsa ba'i rgyud las rim pa gnyis bshad pa dang / bshad pa'i rgyud las de las gzhan du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni skyon ma yin te rtsa ba'i rgyud las rim pa gnyis bshad pa dang / bshad pa'i rgyud las de las gzhan du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not a fault, because the two stages are explained in the Root Tantra and are taught elsewhere in the explanatory tantras.

original: de la dang po sbyor ba la sogs pa gsum dang bsgrub pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la dang po sbyor ba la sogs pa gsum dang bsgrub pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: In that regard, the first three, the preparatory stage and so forth, and the fourth, the accomplishment,

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i yan lag go //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i yan lag go //
translated: are the branches of the creation stage.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa dang / rang bzhin la sogs pa ni bcu ste /
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa dang / rang bzhin la sogs pa ni bcu ste /
translated: The ten, vajra repetition and so forth, and the nature and so forth,

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i yan lag go //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i yan lag go //
translated: are the branches of the stage of completion.

original: de ni bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That is the creation stage and the completion stage.

original: dam tshig brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: dam tshig brjod par bya ste /
translated: The commitments will now be explained.

original: gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa yul lnga po gang yin pa de dag ni dman pa dang par ba dang mchog ste /
analyzed: gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa yul lnga po gang yin pa de dag ni dman pa dang par ba dang mchog ste /
translated: Those five objects, such as the form vajra, are inferior, middling, and superior,

original: yid du 'ong pa dang yid du mi 'ong ba dang / gnyis ka'i dbye bas /
analyzed: yid du 'ong pa dang yid du mi 'ong ba dang / gnyis ka'i dbye bas /
translated: distinguished by being attractive, unattractive, and both.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang gnyis ka ste bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba yin pa'i ngo bo de dag la dmigs nas 'od gsal ba rtogs te /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang gnyis ka ste bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba yin pa'i ngo bo de dag la dmigs nas 'od gsal ba rtogs te /
translated: Having observed those objects, which are the nature of pleasure, pain, and both pleasure and pain, one realizes clear light.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dag cing ldog pa ni khyad par dang ldan pa bde ba chen po thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dag cing ldog pa ni khyad par dang ldan pa bde ba chen po thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The reversal of attachment, aversion, and delusion, which are pure, is the attainment of special great bliss.

original: de ni 'jig rten las 'das ba'i rnal 'byor pa'i dam tshig go //🔽de bzhin du 'dod chags kyi sgo nas 'dod chags kyi dam tshig ni 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten las 'das ba'i rnal 'byor pa'i dam tshig go // de bzhin du 'dod chags kyi sgo nas 'dod chags kyi dam tshig ni 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: That is the pledge of the supramundane yogin.🔽Similarly, the pledge of attachment is the nature of attachment, through the door of attachment.

original: 'dod chags rnam par dag pa dang / de bzhin du rdo rje ni zhe sdang gi dmigs pa'i dngos po mthong nas /
analyzed: 'dod chags rnam par dag pa dang / de bzhin du rdo rje ni zhe sdang gi dmigs pa'i dngos po mthong nas /
translated: The pledge of aversion is the nature of aversion, through the door of aversion, having seen a thing that is the object of aversion.

original: rdo rje ni zhe sdang rnam par dag cing rin chen ni 'od gsal ba'i ye shes rnal 'byor pa las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje ni zhe sdang rnam par dag cing rin chen ni 'od gsal ba'i ye shes rnal 'byor pa las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The vajra is the purification of hatred, and the jewel is the clear light intuition that arises for the yogi.

original: de bzhin du gti mug tu dmigs pa'i ma rig pa'i rang bzhin dngos po mthong nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du gti mug tu dmigs pa'i ma rig pa'i rang bzhin dngos po mthong nas /
translated: Similarly, having seen the entity that is the nature of ignorance which is the misapprehension of delusion,

original: de sbyangs shing rin chen dang 'dra ba mngon par 'dod pa'i don ster ba 'od gsal ba rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de sbyangs shing rin chen dang 'dra ba mngon par 'dod pa'i don ster ba 'od gsal ba rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: purifying that, one realizes the clear light which is like a jewel, bestowing the desired aim.

original: de bas na 'dod pa'i yul ni lnga ste /
analyzed: de bas na 'dod pa'i yul ni lnga ste /
translated: Thus, the five objects of desire

original: dam tshig mtshungs par tha mal bar gnas na yang rnal 'byor pa la dam tshig nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dam tshig mtshungs par tha mal bar gnas na yang rnal 'byor pa la dam tshig nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: are the pledge, and even if one remains in the ordinary state, they are the pledge for the yogi.

original: de ni sems rnam par dag pa dang sgrub ba'o //
analyzed: de ni sems rnam par dag pa dang sgrub ba'o //
translated: This is the purification of mind and practice.

original: tshar bcad pa dang phan 'dogs pa @304a * //
analyzed: tshar bcad pa dang phan 'dogs pa @304a * //
translated: The subjugation and assistance

original: sngar bshad pa de ni zhe sdang la sogs pa bsgom pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa de ni zhe sdang la sogs pa bsgom pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: of the five poisons should be explained as the cultivation of hatred and so on.

original: re zhig dang por rnam bcas ni dbyibs dang kha dog dang ldan pa'i yi ge gsum spro ba dang bsdu ba'i gnas pa'i rim pa ni 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis bzlas pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: re zhig dang por rnam bcas ni dbyibs dang kha dog dang ldan pa'i yi ge gsum spro ba dang bsdu ba'i gnas pa'i rim pa ni 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis bzlas pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: First, the one with aspects is the repetition of the three syllables with shape and color, emanating and gathering, abiding in stages, entering and so on, which is vajra repetition.

original: de dag rnam med ni rim gyis yi ge bsdu zhing kun 'gro ba ni phyogs dang yul dang dus dang dbyibs dang kha dog dang bral ba rnam par mi rtog pa rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bo ma ning gi bzlas pa bya ste /
analyzed: de dag rnam med ni rim gyis yi ge bsdu zhing kun 'gro ba ni phyogs dang yul dang dus dang dbyibs dang kha dog dang bral ba rnam par mi rtog pa rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bo ma ning gi bzlas pa bya ste /
translated: The one without aspects is the repetition of the neutral state, which is the gradual gathering of the syllables, the omnipresent, free from direction, place, time, shape, and color, the nonconceptual nature of Mahāvajradhara.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That is the stage of vajra repetition.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa sems rtse gcig pa nyid thob nas yang bskyed pa'i rim pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa sems rtse gcig pa nyid thob nas yang bskyed pa'i rim pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Having attained one-pointedness of mind through vajra repetition, one should explain the stage of creation.

original: zhe sdang rdo rje la sogs pa'i gzugs gsum ni khams gsum skyed cing gsang ba dag pa ni sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlabs pas rgyas gdab cing /
analyzed: zhe sdang rdo rje la sogs pa'i gzugs gsum ni khams gsum skyed cing gsang ba dag pa ni sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlabs pas rgyas gdab cing /
translated: The three forms of Hatred Vajra and so on create the three realms, and the secret purities are sealed by the consecration of the body and so on.

original: rdo rje can gyi don byed pa ni gdug pa la sogs pa tshar gcod pa'i bya ba byed do //
analyzed: rdo rje can gyi don byed pa ni gdug pa la sogs pa tshar gcod pa'i bya ba byed do //
translated: The one who performs the purpose of the vajra is the one who performs the function of annihilating the wicked and so forth.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: sngar bshad pa'i rim gyis m'a ma k'i'i padmar /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i rim gyis m'a ma k'i'i padmar /
translated: As previously explained, in the lotus of Māmakī,

original: zhe sdang 'khor lo ni mi bskyod pas byin gyis brlabs pa'i khro bo'i 'khor lo bskyed la /
analyzed: zhe sdang 'khor lo ni mi bskyod pas byin gyis brlabs pa'i khro bo'i 'khor lo bskyed la /
translated: the wheel of hatred is the generation of the wheel of wrath empowered by Akṣobhya.

original: de'i 'od zer spros pas khro bo rnams phyung zhing de rnams kyis rang gi phyag na gnas pa'i phyag mtshan gyis gdul dka' ba gsod cing de'i rnam par shes pa'i yi ge gsum bdag nyid yi ge ho: gnyis kyis spel ba 'od zer de nyid kyis dgug cing
analyzed: de'i 'od zer spros pas khro bo rnams phyung zhing de rnams kyis rang gi phyag na gnas pa'i phyag mtshan gyis gdul dka' ba gsod cing de'i rnam par shes pa'i yi ge gsum bdag nyid yi ge ho: gnyis kyis spel ba 'od zer de nyid kyis dgug cing
translated: Through the emanation of its light rays, the wrathful ones emerge. With those, the difficult to tame are killed with the hand implement held in their hands. The consciousness of those is the three syllables, which are increased by the two syllables hoḥ.

original: rang gi snying ga'i ye shes sems dpa'i sa bon bsdu bar bya ste /
analyzed: rang gi snying ga'i ye shes sems dpa'i sa bon bsdu bar bya ste /
translated: Through the light rays, they are summoned and absorbed into the seed of the gnosis being at one’s heart.

original: de'i tshe 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, they will die.

original: gzhan yang yi ge gsum gyi bdag nyid gdul dka' ba'i rnam par snga ma'i rim gyis spro zhing /
analyzed: gzhan yang yi ge gsum gyi bdag nyid gdul dka' ba'i rnam par snga ma'i rim gyis spro zhing /
translated: Moreover, the difficult to tame, who are the nature of the three syllables, are emanated in the previous order.

original: gdul dka' ba'i lus la zhugs shing /
analyzed: gdul dka' ba'i lus la zhugs shing /
translated: They enter the body of the difficult to tame.

original: rtogs pa ni sad par byas na de'i tshe 'tsho bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni sad par byas na de'i tshe 'tsho bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that if one awakens realization, then one will live.

original: de ltar sbyor ba ni ting nge 'dzin slob pa'i rnal 'byor pa zhe sdang dang rdo rje 'dra bar bdag nyid 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar sbyor ba ni ting nge 'dzin slob pa'i rnal 'byor pa zhe sdang dang rdo rje 'dra bar bdag nyid 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Thus, the practitioner who is training in meditative concentration, by uniting with the vajra of anger, becomes the same as Vajraheruka.

original: tshar gcod pa dang phan 'dogs par nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshar gcod pa dang phan 'dogs par nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: One becomes able to destroy and to benefit.

original: khams gsum pa la yang skad cig tsam gyis te /
analyzed: khams gsum pa la yang skad cig tsam gyis te /
translated: In the three worlds, in an instant,🔽one kills by merely meditating on that meditative concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin de bsgoms ba tsam gyis bsad pa ni gsod pa dang / slong ba ni slar yang ldang bar byed do zhes the tshom byed do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de bsgoms ba tsam gyis bsad pa ni gsod pa dang / slong ba ni slar yang ldang bar byed do zhes the tshom byed do //
translated: One raises up, that is, revives, by merely meditating on that meditative concentration.

original: nus pa ni bsam gtan gsal zhing brtan par gyur na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nus pa ni bsam gtan gsal zhing brtan par gyur na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: One is able to do this if one has clear and stable meditative concentration.

original: de ltar rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas sangs rgyas spyan gyi padmar gti @304b mug 'khor lo ni rnam par snang mdzad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i khro bo'i 'khor lo bskyed la /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas sangs rgyas spyan gyi padmar gti @304b mug 'khor lo ni rnam par snang mdzad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i khro bo'i 'khor lo bskyed la /
translated: Thus, the practitioner of Vairocana generates the wheel of delusion in the lotus of Buddhalocanā, the wheel of anger that is blessed by Vairocana.

original: lcags kyu dang zhags pa thogs pa'i khro bo rnams spros te /
analyzed: lcags kyu dang zhags pa thogs pa'i khro bo rnams spros te /
translated: Having emanated wrathful ones holding hooks and lassos,

original: ser sna can gyi mdzod kyi nang du zhugs par bsams la /🔽de dang mthun pa'i kha dog dang ldan pa'i khro bo rnams kyis rin po che la sogs pa blangs nas rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi sbyor bas 'dren cing gti mug sems ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pa ste /
analyzed: ser sna can gyi mdzod kyi nang du zhugs par bsams la / de dang mthun pa'i kha dog dang ldan pa'i khro bo rnams kyis rin po che la sogs pa blangs nas rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi sbyor bas 'dren cing gti mug sems ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pa ste /
translated: one should imagine that they enter the interior of the treasury of the miser.

original: de'i rgya mtsho ni de'i rang gi mdzod de /
analyzed: de'i rgya mtsho ni de'i rang gi mdzod de /
translated: Wrathful ones having a color corresponding to that of the miser take the jewels and so forth, and having drawn them with the yoga of the wind mandala, one should imagine that the ocean of the miser, that is, his own treasury,

original: rin chen thams cad ni ser sna can gyi gang zag las 'khrugs pa'i aindra n'i la la sogs pas rab tu gang ba ni khengs par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rin chen thams cad ni ser sna can gyi gang zag las 'khrugs pa'i aindra n'i la la sogs pas rab tu gang ba ni khengs par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: is filled with all jewels, that is, with sapphires and so forth, which are disturbed by the miserly person.

original: rgyun de dag blang zhing bka' 'khor lo bskul te /
analyzed: rgyun de dag blang zhing bka' 'khor lo bskul te /
translated: Having taken those streams, one should summon the wheel of speech.

original: nor la sogs pa dang bral ba yon tan dang ldan pa'i gang zag gi khyim du gti mug 'khor lo can kun ni khro bo bskul zhing sbyin pa'i char ni rin po che'i tshogs kyi char 'bebs par bya'o //
analyzed: nor la sogs pa dang bral ba yon tan dang ldan pa'i gang zag gi khyim du gti mug 'khor lo can kun ni khro bo bskul zhing sbyin pa'i char ni rin po che'i tshogs kyi char 'bebs par bya'o //
translated: In the home of a person who is endowed with good qualities but is destitute of wealth and so forth, the wheel of delusion is aroused, and the rain of gifts is the rain of a collection of jewels.

original: sbyin pa de dang 'phrog pa de nyid gang gi tshe sems rdo rje bzhin du ting nge 'dzin la brtan par gyur na de'i rdzas thams cad 'phrog pa dang sbyin pa ni skad cig tsam gyis bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa de dang 'phrog pa de nyid gang gi tshe sems rdo rje bzhin du ting nge 'dzin la brtan par gyur na de'i rdzas thams cad 'phrog pa dang sbyin pa ni skad cig tsam gyis bya'o //
translated: When that gift and that taking away are firm in concentration like a vajra of the mind, then all of one's substances are to be taken away and given in an instant.

original: 'od dpag tu med pa'i rnal 'byor pas gos dkar mo padma rta mgrin la sogs pa'i 'khor lo bsams la /
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med pa'i rnal 'byor pas gos dkar mo padma rta mgrin la sogs pa'i 'khor lo bsams la /
translated: The practitioner of Amitābha should imagine the wheel of Pāṇḍaravāsinī, Padmanarteśvara, Hayagrīva, and so on.

original: de rnams spro zhing lha dang lham yin la sogs pa'i bu mo bkug cing gos dkar mo bcug ste /
analyzed: de rnams spro zhing lha dang lham yin la sogs pa'i bu mo bkug cing gos dkar mo bcug ste /
translated: They emanate and summon the girls of the gods and goddesses, and so on, and Pāṇḍaravāsinī enters.

original: de dang gnyis su med pa'i sbyor bas mnyes par bya'o //
analyzed: de dang gnyis su med pa'i sbyor bas mnyes par bya'o //
translated: One should please her with the yoga of nonduality with her.

original: de nyid bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid bshad par bya ste /
translated: That should be explained.

original: dga' ba ni snang ba dang sdug pa ni snang ba mched pa dang / bde ba ni snang ba nye bar thob pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni snang ba dang sdug pa ni snang ba mched pa dang / bde ba ni snang ba nye bar thob pa'o //
translated: Joy is the appearance, beauty is the increase of the appearance, and bliss is the attainment of the appearance.

original: rangs pa ni 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: rangs pa ni 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: Delight is the clear light.

original: 'dod pa'i rtsed mos rnam par 'phrul ni 'khyud pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba rnams kyis nyams su myang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rtsed mos rnam par 'phrul ni 'khyud pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba rnams kyis nyams su myang bar bya'o //
translated: Having emanated with the play of desire, one should experience with the divisions of embrace and so forth.

original: de ni lha mo dgug pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni lha mo dgug pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the summoning of the goddesses and so forth.

original: de nas 'od zer gyi sbyor bas gos dkar mo'i thugs ka nas de dag spro zhing 'khor lo can kun ni 'dod chags 'dod pas sems can rnams la gdul bar bya ba'i phyir lha mo la sogs pa de dag sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas 'od zer gyi sbyor bas gos dkar mo'i thugs ka nas de dag spro zhing 'khor lo can kun ni 'dod chags 'dod pas sems can rnams la gdul bar bya ba'i phyir lha mo la sogs pa de dag sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Then, by the yoga of light rays, one should emanate them from the heart of Pāṇḍaravāsinī.

original: ting nge 'dzin de nyid kyis khams dag tu byung ba'i bud med ces bya ba ni phul du byung ba'i tshig ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de nyid kyis khams dag tu byung ba'i bud med ces bya ba ni phul du byung ba'i tshig ste /
translated: By that very samādhi, the women who arise from the elements are the supreme words.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams la bud med mi srid de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams la bud med mi srid de /
translated: Because women are not possible in the form and formless realms,

original: chags pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are free from attachment.

original: lha dang lha @305a * //
analyzed: lha dang lha @305a * //
translated: The one who is connected with the gods, demigods, and so on, by means of desire,

original: ma yin la sogs pa'i sgo nas 'brel ba dang ldan pa de dag skad cig ni ting nge 'dzin brtan pas skad cig gis 'dod spyod pa ni 'gugs shing spyod la gzhan rnams la yang sbyin na /
analyzed: ma yin la sogs pa'i sgo nas 'brel ba dang ldan pa de dag skad cig ni ting nge 'dzin brtan pas skad cig gis 'dod spyod pa ni 'gugs shing spyod la gzhan rnams la yang sbyin na /
translated: attracts and enjoys the desired conduct in an instant by means of stable concentration, and gives it to others.

original: mi'i bud med smos ci dgos te ting nge 'dzin che ba bstan to //
analyzed: mi'i bud med smos ci dgos te ting nge 'dzin che ba bstan to //
translated: What need is there to mention human women?

original: de ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'o ;
analyzed: de ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'o ;
translated: This is the stage of generation.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sgo nas 'gro ba 'dul bar bsten cing dkyil 'khor bri ba'i lan bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sgo nas 'gro ba 'dul bar bsten cing dkyil 'khor bri ba'i lan bstan par bya ste /
translated: The reply to the question of drawing the maṇḍala is taught in order to tame migrating beings by means of desire and so on.

original: dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba de de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad gzhir gyur ba bri ba ni ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba de de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad gzhir gyur ba bri ba ni ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: “The maṇḍala” is the basis of all tathāgatas.

original: dbang bskur ba ni 'og nas bshad par 'gyur ba rnam pa bzhi ste ;
analyzed: dbang bskur ba ni 'og nas bshad par 'gyur ba rnam pa bzhi ste ;
translated: The empowerment is the four explained below.

original: de thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / de bzhin du las kyi tshogs kyang bya ba'i phyir dang / nyams su len pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i lha'i sku bskyed par bya ba'i phyir dang / byin gyis brlab pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pas rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang thob par bya ba'i phyir dkyil 'khor bri ba ste /
analyzed: de thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / de bzhin du las kyi tshogs kyang bya ba'i phyir dang / nyams su len pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i lha'i sku bskyed par bya ba'i phyir dang / byin gyis brlab pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pas rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang thob par bya ba'i phyir dkyil 'khor bri ba ste /
translated: In order to attain that, and likewise in order to perform the collection of deeds, and in order to practice, in order to generate the deity body of the creation stage, and in order to bless, in order to attain the stage of Vajradhara by means of the completion stage, one should draw the mandala.

original: rtog pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rtog pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis so //
translated: By yogis with conceptual thoughts.

original: grub pa'i bgrod pa gzhan yin no //
analyzed: grub pa'i bgrod pa gzhan yin no //
translated: The other is the path of accomplishment.

original: de ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa der gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa der gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is the completion stage, because one abides in that.

original: mthar phyin pa'i bgrod pa ni dkyil 'khor tshul te /
analyzed: mthar phyin pa'i bgrod pa ni dkyil 'khor tshul te /
translated: The path of culmination is the mandala mode.

original: gzhan ni rnam pa gzhan gyi yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni rnam pa gzhan gyi yin no //
translated: The other is the other mode.

original: de nyid bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid bshad par bya ste /
translated: That should be explained.

original: bha ga ni chos 'byung gi phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: bha ga ni chos 'byung gi phyag rgya ste /
translated: The bhaga is the mudra of the source of phenomena.

original: de ni snying por gyur pa na dkyil 'khor zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ni snying por gyur pa na dkyil 'khor zhes bya ste /
translated: That is the essence, and it is called the mandala,

original: byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa'i lha'i 'khor lo /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa'i lha'i 'khor lo /
translated: because it is the circle of deities such as bodhicitta.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyang dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyang dkyil 'khor te /
translated: The thought of awakening is also a maṇḍala,

original: kun rdzob kyi tshul du de la de bzhin gshegs pa lnga gnas pa'i phyir dang / bde ba chen po'i tshul du rdo rje 'chang gi rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi tshul du de la de bzhin gshegs pa lnga gnas pa'i phyir dang / bde ba chen po'i tshul du rdo rje 'chang gi rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the five tathāgatas abide in it in the manner of the relative, and because it is the basis of Vajradhara in the manner of great bliss.

original: lus ni lus te de yang dkyil 'khor yin la /
analyzed: lus ni lus te de yang dkyil 'khor yin la /
translated: The body is a body and that is also a maṇḍala,

original: lha thams cad kyi rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha thams cad kyi rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis of all the deities.

original: phung po lnga ni mdor bsdus pa //
analyzed: phung po lnga ni mdor bsdus pa //
translated: The five aggregates are in brief

original: sangs rgyas lngar ni rab tu grags //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lngar ni rab tu grags //
translated: renowned as the five buddhas.

original: zhes le'u bcu bdun pa las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes le'u bcu bdun pa las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is stated in the seventeenth chapter.

original: de ni bskyed pa'i rim pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag go //
analyzed: de ni bskyed pa'i rim pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag go //
translated: Those are the creation stage and the completion stage.

original: phyag rgya dri pa'i lan bstan pa ni tham cad ni phung po la sogs pa dang nyon mongs pa la sogs pa yang phyag rgyas rgyas gdab pa ni bde ba chen pos phyag rgyas gdab pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya dri pa'i lan bstan pa ni tham cad ni phung po la sogs pa dang nyon mongs pa la sogs pa yang phyag rgyas rgyas gdab pa ni bde ba chen pos phyag rgyas gdab pa'o //
translated: The reply to the question about the seal is that all the aggregates and so on and the afflictions and so on are sealed by the seal of the great bliss.

original: de nyid dkyil 'khor ni 'gro ba'i dkyil 'khor rgyas btab pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid dkyil 'khor ni 'gro ba'i dkyil 'khor rgyas btab pa ste /
translated: That itself is the maṇḍala, which is the sealing of the maṇḍala of migrating beings.

original: des na phyag rgya zhes bya'o//
analyzed: des na phyag rgya zhes bya'o//
translated: Therefore, it is called a “seal. ”

original: @305b de ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: @305b de ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the completion stage.

original: yang na phyag rgya zhes bya ba ni btsun mo'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: yang na phyag rgya zhes bya ba ni btsun mo'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: Or else, “seal” means the sign of the queen.

original: des thams cad ni phung po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'gro ba rgyas btab pas na phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: des thams cad ni phung po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'gro ba rgyas btab pas na phyag rgya'o //
translated: Since all beings, whose nature is the aggregates and so forth, are sealed by that, it is a seal.

original: de yang rdo rje dang padma'i mtshan nyid de /🔽gang gi phyir rdo rje dang padma'i phyag rgya dag gis /
