analyzed: de yang rdo rje dang padma'i mtshan nyid de / gang gi phyir rdo rje dang padma'i phyag rgya dag gis /
translated: And that is the nature of the vajra and lotus.

original: sems can gyi skye gnas bzhi pa'i 'brel pa dang ldan pa'i 'gro ba thams cad rgyas btab pa ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi skye gnas bzhi pa'i 'brel pa dang ldan pa'i 'gro ba thams cad rgyas btab pa ste /
translated: Because all beings, who are related to the four modes of birth, are sealed by the vajra and lotus seals.

original: de bas na rdo rje'i phyag rgya dang padma'i phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: de bas na rdo rje'i phyag rgya dang padma'i phyag rgya ste /
translated: Therefore, the vajra seal and the lotus seal

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: should be known as the nature of method and wisdom.

original: de ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the completion stage.

original: yang na phyag rgya ni phung po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin skyed par byed pa ;
analyzed: yang na phyag rgya ni phung po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin skyed par byed pa ;
translated: Or else, “seal” means the producer of the nature of the aggregates and so forth.

original: chos 'byung gi phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: chos 'byung gi phyag rgya ste /
translated: The seal of the source of phenomena🔽is the nature of the aggregates and so forth.

original: des rgyas btab pas na phyag rgya ni las kyi phyag rgya dang / dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang / de nyid bsgom pa'i shes rab ni ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang / phung po la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid phyag rgya chen po'o //
analyzed: des rgyas btab pas na phyag rgya ni las kyi phyag rgya dang / dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang / de nyid bsgom pa'i shes rab ni ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang / phung po la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid phyag rgya chen po'o //
translated: Since it is sealed by that, the seal is the karmamudra, the samayamudra, the wisdom of meditating on reality, the mahamudra, the nature of the purified aggregates, and so on.

original: de rnams kyis 'gro ba thams cad rgyas btab pas na phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis 'gro ba thams cad rgyas btab pas na phyag rgya'o //
translated: Since all migrating beings are sealed by those, they are seals.

original: yang na phung po dang skye mched dang khams rnams kyi rang bzhin ni sa la sogs pa khams bzhi po ste /
analyzed: yang na phung po dang skye mched dang khams rnams kyi rang bzhin ni sa la sogs pa khams bzhi po ste /
translated: Alternatively, the nature of the aggregates, sense bases, and elements is the four elements, earth, and so on.

original: spyan dang / m'a ma k'i dang / gos dkar mo dang / sgrol ma ste /
analyzed: spyan dang / m'a ma k'i dang / gos dkar mo dang / sgrol ma ste /
translated: They are Locana, Mamaki, Pandara, and Tara.

original: de rnams kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad ni khams gsum pa rgyas btab pas na phyag rgya zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad ni khams gsum pa rgyas btab pas na phyag rgya zhes bya'o //
translated: Since all mandalas are sealed by those, they are called “seals.”

original: de ni bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa dag go //
analyzed: de ni bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa dag go //
translated: That is the creation and completion.

original: phyi rol gyi rim pas mtshan ma'i phyag rgya bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rim pas mtshan ma'i phyag rgya bshad par bya ste /
translated: The external sequence will now be explained.

original: lcags kyu la sogs pa bzhi po ni 'dod pa'i rgyal po la sogs pa bzhi po'o //
analyzed: lcags kyu la sogs pa bzhi po ni 'dod pa'i rgyal po la sogs pa bzhi po'o //
translated: The four hooks and so on are the four kings of desire and so on.

original: grva ni sgo'i grva rnams su dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: grva ni sgo'i grva rnams su dgod par bya'o //
translated: The corners are the corners of the gates.

original: de'i 'khor lo dang rdo rje ni gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba dang gnod mdzes rgyal po'i mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: de'i 'khor lo dang rdo rje ni gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba dang gnod mdzes rgyal po'i mtshan ma ste /
translated: His wheel and vajra are the symbols of the uṣṇīṣa cakravartin and Sumbha-nīlāmbara-dhara-rāja.

original: steng dang 'og tu dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: steng dang 'og tu dgod par bya'o //
translated: They are to be placed above and below.

original: rig pa'i rgyal po drug po ni 'dod pa'i rgyal po drug po'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i rgyal po drug po ni 'dod pa'i rgyal po drug po'o //
translated: The six kings of knowledge are the six kings of desire.

original: phyag rgya drug po ste /🔽mtshan ma drug tu rab tu grags //
analyzed: phyag rgya drug po ste / mtshan ma drug tu rab tu grags //
translated: The six seals

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: are renowned as the six symbols.

original: sa nas brtsams te rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa gang yin pa de'i dkyil 'khor du rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du me long ni gzugs brnyan gyi rang bzhin dang / bi wam ni brag ce'i rang bzhin dang mtshungs pa'i sgra'i rang bzhin dang /
analyzed: sa nas brtsams te rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa gang yin pa de'i dkyil 'khor du rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du me long ni gzugs brnyan gyi rang bzhin dang / bi wam ni brag ce'i rang bzhin dang mtshungs pa'i sgra'i rang bzhin dang /
translated: Beginning from the earth element up to the consciousness element, the form vajrī and so on are in the maṇḍala in the same order as the mirror, which has the nature of a reflection, and the sound, which has the nature of an echo.

original: dung ni chos kyi tshul khrims te dri bzang po'i rang bzhin dang / snod ni bdud rtsi lngas @306a * //🔽gang ba ste /
analyzed: dung ni chos kyi tshul khrims te dri bzang po'i rang bzhin dang / snod ni bdud rtsi lngas @306a * // gang ba ste /
translated: The conch is the nature of the morality of Dharma, the nature of good smell, and the vessel is filled with the five nectars.🔽The nature of the enjoyment of the five sense objects is the nature of the purification of desire.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'i longs spyod kyi rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin dang / 'dod chags las ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i tsha ba sel bas /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'i longs spyod kyi rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin dang / 'dod chags las ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i tsha ba sel bas /
translated: Since desire is the cooling of the heat of desire and so on,🔽it is the nature of the bliss of supramundane wisdom.🔽The source of phenomena is the nature of the three vajras of body, speech, and mind and the three bodies and the three samadhis.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rig pa'i bde ba'i rang bzhin dang / chos 'byung ba ni sku gsung thugs dang / sku gsum dang ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi rang bzhin phyag rgya drug po de dag rdo rje'i bdag po ni rdo rje bdag po gang la yod pa de ni rdo rje'i bdag po ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rig pa'i bde ba'i rang bzhin dang / chos 'byung ba ni sku gsung thugs dang / sku gsum dang ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi rang bzhin phyag rgya drug po de dag rdo rje'i bdag po ni rdo rje bdag po gang la yod pa de ni rdo rje'i bdag po ste /
translated: Those six mudras are the vajra lord.

original: gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i phyag rgya dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i phyag rgya dgod par bya'o //
translated: One should place the mudras of Rupadharvaja and so on.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i dang khro bo'i rgyal po rnams kyi phyag rgya gang yin pa de dag rdo rje dang 'khor lo dang rin po che dang padma dang ral gri dang tho ba la sogs pa dang / de'i rigs kyi kha dog ste kha dog lnga pa dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i dang khro bo'i rgyal po rnams kyi phyag rgya gang yin pa de dag rdo rje dang 'khor lo dang rin po che dang padma dang ral gri dang tho ba la sogs pa dang / de'i rigs kyi kha dog ste kha dog lnga pa dgod par bya'o //
translated: One should arrange the mudras of the Buddhas, Bodhisattvas, and Wrathful Kings, which are the vajra, wheel, jewel, lotus, sword, hammer, etc., and the colors of their families, which are the five colors.

original: de las gzhan yang dpa' bo gcig ces bya ba ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa'i phyag rgya /
analyzed: de las gzhan yang dpa' bo gcig ces bya ba ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa'i phyag rgya /
translated: Moreover, the single hero is the mudra of Ksitigarbha, etc.

original: phyag rgya rigs kyi kha dog ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rigs kyi rjes su 'brang bar brtags pa ni dgod par bya ste /
analyzed: phyag rgya rigs kyi kha dog ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rigs kyi rjes su 'brang bar brtags pa ni dgod par bya ste /
translated: The color of the family of the mudra is to be imagined as following the family of Vairochana, etc.

original: de ni bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag go //
analyzed: de ni bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag go //
translated: That is the creation and perfection stages.

original: me tog 'dri ba'i lan bstan pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: me tog 'dri ba'i lan bstan pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: The reply to the question about the flower should be explained.

original: me tog ces bya ba ni lha mo nam mkha'i khams te shes rab kyi padma'i lte ba'i nang na khams sar pa ste rakta phral du dbyung ba'o //
analyzed: me tog ces bya ba ni lha mo nam mkha'i khams te shes rab kyi padma'i lte ba'i nang na khams sar pa ste rakta phral du dbyung ba'o //
translated: The flower is the goddess of the space element, who is the essence of the wisdom lotus. Inside means inside the center of the lotus. Element means the fresh element, i.e., blood.

original: de ni sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba ste /🔽sku la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor las lces blangs shing rigs kyi rim pa ste /
analyzed: de ni sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba ste / sku la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor las lces blangs shing rigs kyi rim pa ste /
translated: That is the division of body, speech, and mind.🔽From the maṇḍala of body, etc.,

original: rigs gsum gyi sa bon gyis byin gyis brlab cing dgod pa ni spyod par bya ste bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: rigs gsum gyi sa bon gyis byin gyis brlab cing dgod pa ni spyod par bya ste bsgrub pa'o //
translated: one should practice, i.e., accomplish, the conduct, which is the taking with the tongue and the consecration with the seed syllables of the three families.

original: yang na btsun mo'i nam mkha'i khams ni shes rab kyi nam mkha'i ste /
analyzed: yang na btsun mo'i nam mkha'i khams ni shes rab kyi nam mkha'i ste /
translated: Or else, the space element of the queen is the space of wisdom.

original: de la rtsa re re la padma 'dab ma brgyad dang lte ba ste dgu'o //
analyzed: de la rtsa re re la padma 'dab ma brgyad dang lte ba ste dgu'o //
translated: In that, each channel has eight petals and a center, making nine.

original: de las byung ba'i khams rnams ni rakta dang shu kra dang dri chab bo //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i khams rnams ni rakta dang shu kra dang dri chab bo //
translated: The elements that arise from that are rakta, śukra, and urine.

original: sku rdo rje la sogs pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sku rdo rje la sogs pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The body vajra, etc., are the nature of Vairocana, etc.

original: snga ma bzhin du dgong pa ni spyod pa ste sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du dgong pa ni spyod pa ste sgrub pa'o //
translated: Consecration as before is the conduct, i.e., the practice.

original: yang na lha mo ni dmigs pa med pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: yang na lha mo ni dmigs pa med pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: Or else, the goddess is nonreferential wisdom.

original: de'i nam mkha'i khams ni thams cad stong pa'o //
analyzed: de'i nam mkha'i khams ni thams cad stong pa'o //
translated: Her space element is the emptiness of everything.

original: de la sku la sogs pa dang khams rnams dang rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: de la sku la sogs pa dang khams rnams dang rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: There, the body and so on, the elements, and consciousness

original: dgod pa ni nye bar bya ste me tog ces bya'o //
analyzed: dgod pa ni nye bar bya ste me tog ces bya'o //
translated: are to be placed, that is, offered, like flowers.

original: de ni sems rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sems rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: That is the purification of the mind.

original: mchod rten dri ba'i lan bstan pa'i phyir bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: mchod rten dri ba'i lan bstan pa'i phyir bshad par bya ste /
translated: In order to explain the answer to the question about the caitya, it is said:

original: sangs rgyas thams cad ni @306b chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku'i rang bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gzhi ni bzhugs gnas te gzhi ni lus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad ni @306b chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku'i rang bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gzhi ni bzhugs gnas te gzhi ni lus zhes bya'o //
translated: The basis of all buddhas, that is, the abode, is the body, which is the nature of the dharmakāya, the saṃbhogakāya, and the nirmāṇakāya of the tathāgatas.

original: de ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That is the completion stage.

original: yang na sangs rgyas thams cad ni shu kra la sogs pa khams lnga ste /🔽de rnams kyi bzhugs gnas ni gzhi ste shes rab kyi padma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas thams cad ni shu kra la sogs pa khams lnga ste / de rnams kyi bzhugs gnas ni gzhi ste shes rab kyi padma zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, all buddhas are the five elements, semen, and so on.🔽The basis, that is, the abode, of those is the lotus of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi padma ni mchod rten zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi padma ni mchod rten zhes bya'o //
translated: The lotus of wisdom is called the caitya.

original: de yang rdo rje bdud rtsi'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i rigs ba nam mkha' lnga dang 'dab ma brgyad dang / lte ba ste mchod rten de nyid kyi 'khor lo bcu bzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang rdo rje bdud rtsi'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i rigs ba nam mkha' lnga dang 'dab ma brgyad dang / lte ba ste mchod rten de nyid kyi 'khor lo bcu bzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the five space, the eight petals, and the center of the very same stupa are called the fourteen wheels.

original: yang na sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rang bzhin byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can gyi rdo rje ni mchod rten zhes bya ste de ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rang bzhin byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can gyi rdo rje ni mchod rten zhes bya ste de ni rgyu'o //
translated: Or else, the vajra, which is the nature of all the buddhas, the nature of the bindu of the mind of enlightenment, is called the stupa, and that is the cause.

original: rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i ye shes sems dpa' nam mkha'i dbyings la zhugs pas reg pa ni de dang ldan ba 'khor lo ni dkyil 'khor pa'i 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i ye shes sems dpa' nam mkha'i dbyings la zhugs pas reg pa ni de dang ldan ba 'khor lo ni dkyil 'khor pa'i 'khor lo ste /
translated: The wheel, which is the wheel of the retinue, is touched by the natural, innate gnosis being who enters the realm of space, and is endowed with that.

original: de ni ye shes kyi 'khor lo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni ye shes kyi 'khor lo zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called the wheel of gnosis.

original: la la na re snying ga la gnas pa zhes bya ba de ni dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog go //
analyzed: la la na re snying ga la gnas pa zhes bya ba de ni dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog go //
translated: Some say that the one who is located in the heart is the supreme king of mandalas.

original: sa bon gyi yi ge bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: sa bon gyi yi ge bshad par bya ste /
translated: The seed syllables should be explained.

original: sa bon gyi yi ge ni bskyed pa'i don du yi ge rnams so //
analyzed: sa bon gyi yi ge ni bskyed pa'i don du yi ge rnams so //
translated: The seed syllables are the syllables for the purpose of generation.

original: gnas ni bskyed pa'i don te mi 'jig pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gnas ni bskyed pa'i don te mi 'jig pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The place is the meaning of generation, endowed with the power of indestructibility.

original: rdo rje gsum ni sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i mi 'gyur ba ni sa bon te /
analyzed: rdo rje gsum ni sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i mi 'gyur ba ni sa bon te /
translated: The three vajras are the vajras of body, speech, and mind, the unchanging Vairochana, etc. , are the seeds.

original: de bzhin du yi ge ni me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin du yi ge ni me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Similarly, the syllables are the nature of the mirror-like and other pristine wisdoms.

original: chos nyid rang bzhin gyis rtag pa mi 'jig pas na yi ge ni sa bon rnams so //
analyzed: chos nyid rang bzhin gyis rtag pa mi 'jig pas na yi ge ni sa bon rnams so //
translated: Since reality is eternal by nature and indestructible, the syllables are the seeds.

original: de ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That is the stage of generation.

original: skul ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: skul ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: The arousing should be explained.

original: sad na ni 'od gsal ba la bzhugs pa sems can gyi don du ldang bar bya bas sad pa ste /
analyzed: sad na ni 'od gsal ba la bzhugs pa sems can gyi don du ldang bar bya bas sad pa ste /
translated: When awakened, one abides in clearlight, and in order to benefit sentient beings, one should arise.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi de kho na nyid ni 'od gsal ba las ldang bar bya ba ni bskul ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi de kho na nyid ni 'od gsal ba las ldang bar bya ba ni bskul ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The reality of body, speech, and mind is the arising from clearlight, which is called the arousing.

original: las kyi rgyal po mchog gi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: las kyi rgyal po mchog gi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: This is the supreme king of actions meditative stabilization.

original: yang na sku gsung thugs ni 'dod pa'i gdugs la sogs pa ste gtso bo'i rtse gsum mo //
analyzed: yang na sku gsung thugs ni 'dod pa'i gdugs la sogs pa ste gtso bo'i rtse gsum mo //
translated: Alternatively, the body, speech, and mind are the principal three-pronged lightning, etc. ,

original: de'i sad ba ni sor mo'am lces bskul ba ste bskul ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i sad ba ni sor mo'am lces bskul ba ste bskul ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Its awakening is the stimulation by the fingers or the tongue, and is called the stimulation.

original: yang na sku gsung thugs kyi de nyid ni sa bon gsum mo //
analyzed: yang na sku gsung thugs kyi de nyid ni sa bon gsum mo //
translated: Or else, the reality of body, speech, and mind is the three seed-syllables.

original: de rnams kyi bdud rtsi lnga sad pa ni 'od gsal bar byas pas bskul ba ste sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bdud rtsi lnga sad pa ni 'od gsal bar byas pas bskul ba ste sgrub pa'o //
translated: The awakening of the five nectars of those is the stimulation by the illumination, and is called the accomplishment.

original: gtong ba dri ba'i lan bshad par bya ste /🔽'od zer spro ba ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten @307a * //
analyzed: gtong ba dri ba'i lan bshad par bya ste / 'od zer spro ba ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten @307a * //
translated: The answer to the question about the sending forth should be stated.🔽The sending forth of light rays is the sending forth of light rays into the world-realms of the ten directions for the sake of sentient beings.

original: gyi khams su sems can gyi ni don bya ba'i phyir 'od zer 'gyed pa gtong ba zhes bya ste las kyi rgyal po mchog go //
analyzed: gyi khams su sems can gyi ni don bya ba'i phyir 'od zer 'gyed pa gtong ba zhes bya ste las kyi rgyal po mchog go //
translated: It is called the sending forth, and is the supreme king of actions.

original: yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams la lha rnams kyi nus pa dgug par bya ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams la lha rnams kyi nus pa dgug par bya ba'i phyir ram /
translated: Or else, it is the sending forth of the obedient ones in order to summon the powers of the gods in the world-realms of the ten directions,🔽or in order to subdue the difficult to subdue.

original: gdul dka' gdul bar bya ba'i phyir bka' nyan gtong ba gang yin ba de ni gtong ba zhes bya ste sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: gdul dka' gdul bar bya ba'i phyir bka' nyan gtong ba gang yin ba de ni gtong ba zhes bya ste sgrub pa'o //
translated: That is called the sending forth, and is the accomplishment.

original: spyan 'dren pa'i dri ba'i lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: spyan 'dren pa'i dri ba'i lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the answer to the question about the invocation, he says:

original: spyan 'dren pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i dbyings la bzhugs pa'i rdo rje can thams cad de ting nge 'dzin gsum cir yang dgug cing gzhug pa de ni spyan 'dren pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: spyan 'dren pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i dbyings la bzhugs pa'i rdo rje can thams cad de ting nge 'dzin gsum cir yang dgug cing gzhug pa de ni spyan 'dren pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The so-called invocation is the invocation of all the vajra-holders who dwell in the realm of space, the three meditative stabilizations, in any way whatsoever, and that is called invocation.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That is the stage of generation.

original: de dag gong bu'i tshul ni sngags kyi yi ge'i thig le'i gzugs sam /
analyzed: de dag gong bu'i tshul ni sngags kyi yi ge'i thig le'i gzugs sam /
translated: The so-called gathering is the gathering of the seed syllables of the mantra into the form of a drop, or

original: yang byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le'i gzugs su bsdus pa ni gcig tu byas te /
analyzed: yang byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le'i gzugs su bsdus pa ni gcig tu byas te /
translated: the gathering of the drop of the thought of awakening into a single form, and

original: snying ga'am rdo rje'i padma'am gdong gi sna'i rtse mor 'chi nga ba ste /
analyzed: snying ga'am rdo rje'i padma'am gdong gi sna'i rtse mor 'chi nga ba ste /
translated: the placement of that at the heart, or at the vajra jewel, or at the tip of the nose in the face,

original: bsdams pa'am 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsdams pa'am 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and the binding or holding of that is called binding.

original: de las kyang mi g-yo ga dbang du bya ni bcings pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de las kyang mi g-yo ga dbang du bya ni bcings pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The so-called not moving from that is the subjugation of the mind, and that is called binding.

original: de ni las kyi rgyal po mchog dang rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: de ni las kyi rgyal po mchog dang rnal 'byor ro //
translated: That is the supreme king of actions and yoga.

original: bri ba'i dkyil 'khor dri ba'i lan bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bri ba'i dkyil 'khor dri ba'i lan bshad par bya ste /
translated: The reply to the question about the drawn mandala should be explained.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor rnam par snang mdzad la sogs ba'i dkyil 'khor gang gi tshe 'dri bar byed na /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor rnam par snang mdzad la sogs ba'i dkyil 'khor gang gi tshe 'dri bar byed na /
translated: The vajra of body, speech, and mind means that when yogins of Vairochana and so on draw the mandala of Vajra Body and so on,

original: de'i tshe thig skung 'dzin pa'i slob ma rnams sku la sogs pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe thig skung 'dzin pa'i slob ma rnams sku la sogs pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: at that time the disciples who hold the chalk lines are of the nature of Body and so on,

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ngo bo rgyas btab pas bskyed par byas la bri ba'i dkyil 'khor brtag pa ni thig gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ngo bo rgyas btab pas bskyed par byas la bri ba'i dkyil 'khor brtag pa ni thig gdab par bya'o //
translated: generated by sealing with the essence of Vairochana and so on.

original: de la dgongs pa 'di yin te rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas sku'i dkyil 'khor bri bar 'dod pas rang gi bdag nyid rnam par snang mdzad du bsgoms la /🔽slob ma ni 'od dpag med pa'am ni bskyod pa'am /
analyzed: de la dgongs pa 'di yin te rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas sku'i dkyil 'khor bri bar 'dod pas rang gi bdag nyid rnam par snang mdzad du bsgoms la / slob ma ni 'od dpag med pa'am ni bskyod pa'am /
translated: The intended meaning is as follows: A yogin of Vairochana who wishes to draw the mandala of Body should meditate on himself as Vairochana,🔽and the disciples should meditate on themselves as Amitābha, Akṣobhya,

original: bdud rtsi 'khyil par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi 'khyil par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: or Amṛtakuṇḍali.

original: 'od dpag med pa'i rnal 'byor pas gsung gi dkyil 'khor bri bar 'dod na bdag nyid ni 'od dpag tu med par bsgoms la /
analyzed: 'od dpag med pa'i rnal 'byor pas gsung gi dkyil 'khor bri bar 'dod na bdag nyid ni 'od dpag tu med par bsgoms la /
translated: If a yogin of Amitābha wishes to draw the maṇḍala of speech, he should meditate on himself as Amitābha.

original: slob ma ni rnam par snang mdzad dam /
analyzed: slob ma ni rnam par snang mdzad dam /
translated: The disciple should meditate on Vairocana,

original: mi bskyod pa'am bdud rtsi 'khyil par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'am bdud rtsi 'khyil par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: or Akṣobhya, or Amṛtakuṇḍali.

original: mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pas thugs kyi dkyil 'khor bri bar 'dod na bdag ni mi bskyod par bsgoms la /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pas thugs kyi dkyil 'khor bri bar 'dod na bdag ni mi bskyod par bsgoms la /
translated: If a yogin of Akṣobhya wishes to draw the maṇḍala of mind, he should meditate on himself as Akṣobhya.

original: slob ma ni rnam par snang mdzad dam /
analyzed: slob ma ni rnam par snang mdzad dam /
translated: The disciple should meditate on Vairocana,🔽or Amitābha,

original: 'od @307b dpag tu med pa'am /🔽bdud rtsi 'khyil par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: 'od @307b dpag tu med pa'am / bdud rtsi 'khyil par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: or Amṛtakuṇḍali.

original: yang na slob ma ni rdo rje sems dpa'i bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na slob ma ni rdo rje sems dpa'i bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Or the disciple should meditate on Vajrasattva.

original: de ni bskyed pa'i rim ba'o //
analyzed: de ni bskyed pa'i rim ba'o //
translated: That is the creation stage.

original: dbang bskur ba'i lan bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba'i lan bshad par bya ste /
translated: The explanation of the conferral of empowerment:

original: dbang bskur ba zhes bya ba rgyud 'di la ni dpal gsang 'dus pa rnam pa gsum yin te /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba zhes bya ba rgyud 'di la ni dpal gsang 'dus pa rnam pa gsum yin te /
translated: In this tantra called “empowerment,” there are three types of glorious Guhyasamāja:

original: lus dang ngag dang sems rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang sems rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the purity of body, speech, and mind.

original: de la bum pa'i dbang bskur gyis ni lus rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la bum pa'i dbang bskur gyis ni lus rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
translated: By the vase initiation, the body is purified.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the creation stage is primary.

original: gsang ba'i dbang gis ni ngag rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gsang ba'i dbang gis ni ngag rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
translated: By the secret initiation, the speech is purified.

original: bdud rtsi myang ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdud rtsi myang ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it has the nature of tasting nectar.

original: shes rab kyi dbang gis ni sems rnam par dag bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi dbang gis ni sems rnam par dag bar 'gyur te /
translated: By the wisdom initiation, the mind is purified.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the perfection stage is primary.

original: de rnams kyi dbye ba dang rim pa ni le'u bcu drug pa las bshad do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dbye ba dang rim pa ni le'u bcu drug pa las bshad do //
translated: Their divisions and sequence are explained in chapter sixteen.🔽The fourth is also like that.

original: bzhi pa de yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi ye shes de nyid kyang bla mas bstan pa ni bzhi pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa de yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi ye shes de nyid kyang bla mas bstan pa ni bzhi pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The wisdom initiation is also called the fourth, which is taught by the guru.

original: 'dir shes rab ye shes ni bde ba chen po zhes bshad de /
analyzed: 'dir shes rab ye shes ni bde ba chen po zhes bshad de /
translated: Here, the wisdom initiation is explained as great bliss.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is also of two kinds:

original: dpe'i bde ba dang dpe las byung ba'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: dpe'i bde ba dang dpe las byung ba'i bde ba'o //
translated: the bliss of example and the bliss that arises from the example.

original: de la dpe'i bde ba ni shes rab ye shes yin la /
analyzed: de la dpe'i bde ba ni shes rab ye shes yin la /
translated: The bliss of example is the wisdom initiation.

original: dpe las byung ba'i bde ba ni de yang zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: dpe las byung ba'i bde ba ni de yang zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod pa yin te /
translated: The pleasure that arises from an example is expressed by the word “also.”

original: rang gi mngon sum pa'i tshad mas khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro//🔽de nyid kyi phyir ye shes kyi sgras ma gsungs so //
analyzed: rang gi mngon sum pa'i tshad mas khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro// de nyid kyi phyir ye shes kyi sgras ma gsungs so //
translated: Because it is to be realized by one’s own direct valid knowledge and because it is nonconceptual.

original: 'on rtog pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: 'on rtog pa dang bcas pa /
translated: For that very reason, it is not expressed by the word “wisdom.”

original: dpe'i bde bas rnam par mi rtog pa'i de kho na nyid ji ltar 'byung bas yin te /
analyzed: dpe'i bde bas rnam par mi rtog pa'i de kho na nyid ji ltar 'byung bas yin te /
translated: But how does the nonconceptual thatness arise from the pleasure of an example?

original: 'bras bu ni rgyu dang mthun pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rgyu dang mthun pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the effect is in accordance with the cause.

original: de ltar ma yin te gang gi phyir de kho na nyid kyi rgyu yod pa ma yin te rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin te gang gi phyir de kho na nyid kyi rgyu yod pa ma yin te rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because the cause of thatness does not exist, because it is permanent.

original: rgyu dang bcas pa yin na skad cig ma can dang 'jig par yang thal bar 'gyur te bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pa yin na skad cig ma can dang 'jig par yang thal bar 'gyur te bum pa bzhin no //
translated: If it had a cause, it would follow that it would be momentary and perishable, like a pot.

original: chos nyid ni rang bzhin gyis rtag pa nyid kyis nam mkha' bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir dang / dpe'i bde ba ni skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir de nyid la rgyu mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos nyid ni rang bzhin gyis rtag pa nyid kyis nam mkha' bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir dang / dpe'i bde ba ni skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir de nyid la rgyu mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is not logical for the example to be the cause of that, because the example is momentary.

original: de nye bar mtshon pa nyid kyis de khas blangs pa yin la /
analyzed: de nye bar mtshon pa nyid kyis de khas blangs pa yin la /
translated: By merely indicating it, it is accepted.

original: nye bar mtshon pa'i rgyu nyid mi rigs te /
analyzed: nye bar mtshon pa'i rgyu nyid mi rigs te /
translated: It is not logical for the example to be the cause of that,

original: zla ba bstan pa'i sor mo yang rgyu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zla ba bstan pa'i sor mo yang rgyu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that the finger that points to the moon would be the cause of the moon.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin pa ni rang bzhin gyis gyur pa yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin pa ni rang bzhin gyis gyur pa yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: Since it is not a cause and effect, it is like space, because it is naturally transformed.

original: glo bur ba'i sprin dang 'dra ba'i dri ma sel bar byed pa dpe la brten pa'i rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: glo bur ba'i sprin dang 'dra ba'i dri ma sel bar byed pa dpe la brten pa'i rigs pa yin no //
translated: The reasoning based on example removes the stains that are like adventitious clouds.

original: de khas ma blangs na thams cad kyis @308a * //
analyzed: de khas ma blangs na thams cad kyis @308a * //
translated: If that is not accepted, then all

original: sangs rgyas nyid thob pa thal bar 'gyur ba dang / sgom pa la sogs pa don med pa dang rten par byed pa med par 'gyur ba dang / bsod nams dang sdig pa la sogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid thob pa thal bar 'gyur ba dang / sgom pa la sogs pa don med pa dang rten par byed pa med par 'gyur ba dang / bsod nams dang sdig pa la sogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that one would attain buddhahood, because meditation, etc. would be pointless, because there would be no basis, and because it would follow that there would be no merit, sin, etc.

original: de bas na dpe'i bde ba ni rgyu nyid ma yin te rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de bas na dpe'i bde ba ni rgyu nyid ma yin te rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Therefore, the pleasure of an example is not the cause, because it is conceptual.

original: / nye bar mtshon pa tsam nyid ni rigs te mar me bzhin no zhes sngar bshad zin te /
analyzed: / nye bar mtshon pa tsam nyid ni rigs te mar me bzhin no zhes sngar bshad zin te /
translated: It is only a metaphor, like a lamp, as explained above.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur bas chog go //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur bas chog go //
translated: Enough of this digression.

original: rig pa'i brtul zhugs kyi skabs su dbang gnyis po dka' ba yin pa'i phyir de'i rim pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: rig pa'i brtul zhugs kyi skabs su dbang gnyis po dka' ba yin pa'i phyir de'i rim pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: In the context of the spiritual discipline of knowledge, the two initiations are difficult, so their procedure should be explained.

original: sngags kyi tshul du snod du rung ba ni sngags kyi tshul du dung ba'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi tshul du snod du rung ba ni sngags kyi tshul du dung ba'o //
translated: One who is a proper vessel in the tantric way is one who is desirous in the tantric way.

original: snod du rung ba zhes bya ba rigs kyi dbye bas yin no //
analyzed: snod du rung ba zhes bya ba rigs kyi dbye bas yin no //
translated: A proper vessel is so called because of the division of spiritual gene.

original: gang gi phyir zhe sdang gi rigs kyi bud med gang yin pa de ni mi bskyod pa'i rigs la /🔽de bzhin du gti mug la sogs pa'i rigs can ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rigs can yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe sdang gi rigs kyi bud med gang yin pa de ni mi bskyod pa'i rigs la / de bzhin du gti mug la sogs pa'i rigs can ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rigs can yin no //
translated: Because a woman of the Vajra family is of the Akṣhobhya family.🔽Similarly, one of the Padma family is of the Amitābha family, and one of the Tathāgata family is of the Vairocana family.

original: kha dog gis kyang gang zhig nag po de ni mi bskyod pa'i rigs yin pa dang / de bzhin du dkar po la sogs pa'i kha dog de ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rigs su shes par bya'o //🔽las kyis kyang rigs shes par bya ste /
analyzed: kha dog gis kyang gang zhig nag po de ni mi bskyod pa'i rigs yin pa dang / de bzhin du dkar po la sogs pa'i kha dog de ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rigs su shes par bya'o // las kyis kyang rigs shes par bya ste /
translated: By color also: one who is dark is of the Akṣhobhya family, and one who is white, etc. is of the Vairocana family, etc.

original: drag po la sogs pa'i las byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: drag po la sogs pa'i las byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By action also: one who performs the actions of wrath, etc. is of the Akṣhobhya family, etc.

original: de ltar rigs dpyad nas sngags snod du rung ba shes rab yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rigs dpyad nas sngags snod du rung ba shes rab yin no //
translated: Thus, having examined the family, one should know whether or not one is a fit vessel for the mantra.

original: mig yangs sngags zhes bya ba 'dis gzugs kyi phun sum tshogs pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: mig yangs sngags zhes bya ba 'dis gzugs kyi phun sum tshogs pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: “Having wide eyes, a mantra” shows the perfection of form.

original: me tog bcas pa zhes bya ba 'dis na tshod dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: me tog bcas pa zhes bya ba 'dis na tshod dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: “With flowers” shows the perfection of age.

original: na tshod dang mi ldan na me tog mi ldan no //
analyzed: na tshod dang mi ldan na me tog mi ldan no //
translated: If one is not of age, one does not have the flower.

original: sa bon 'byung zhes bya ba 'dis ni sa bon 'dzad pa zhes 'jig rten las grags pa dang padma can no //
analyzed: sa bon 'byung zhes bya ba 'dis ni sa bon 'dzad pa zhes 'jig rten las grags pa dang padma can no //
translated: By this, the seed is born, which is well known in the world as the exhaustion of the seed, and the lotus.

original: yang na gang gi tshe de'i me tog 'byung ba de'i tshe blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na gang gi tshe de'i me tog 'byung ba de'i tshe blang bar bya'o //
translated: Or, when its flower arises, then it should be taken.

original: de dang 'dra bar shes par bya ba ni dam tshig la sogs pa legs par bzlas pa gzung zhing sngags pas slob ma las gsang ba'i dbang ni gsang ba'i dbang ste sbas ba'i bka' drin sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar shes par bya ba ni dam tshig la sogs pa legs par bzlas pa gzung zhing sngags pas slob ma las gsang ba'i dbang ni gsang ba'i dbang ste sbas ba'i bka' drin sbyin par bya'o //
translated: The secret empowerment should be given to the disciple by the mantra adept, who should hold the well-recited commitments and so on, which should be understood in the same way as that.

original: de nyid kyi rim pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rim pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: The sequence of that should be explained.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi dbus su bshad gci la sogs pa bdud rtsi lngas gang ba'i bum pa rnams bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa bsams la de de dang lhan cig rdo rje dang padma snyoms par 'jug pas gnas pa'i rdo rje slob dpon gyis mchog tu dga'
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi dbus su bshad gci la sogs pa bdud rtsi lngas gang ba'i bum pa rnams bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa bsams la de de dang lhan cig rdo rje dang padma snyoms par 'jug pas gnas pa'i rdo rje slob dpon gyis mchog tu dga'
translated: In the center of the realm of space, one should visualize the Blessed One, the Tathagata, in vases filled with the five nectars such as excrement and urine, and with him, the vajra master, abiding in union with the vajra and lotus, should bestow the supreme joy of the secret empowerment.

original: ba'i sgras de @308b dag dgug cing //
analyzed: ba'i sgras de @308b dag dgug cing //
translated: The word “also” indicates that they are summoned.

original: snying gar bcug ste /
analyzed: snying gar bcug ste /
translated: Having placed them in the heart,

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni rtsa gsum ro gcig par gyur pa'i rtsa dbus ma la zhu ste /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni rtsa gsum ro gcig par gyur pa'i rtsa dbus ma la zhu ste /
translated: the vajra of body, speech, and mind, which has become one taste with the three channels, melts into the central channel.

original: rdo rje'i lam nas byung zhing padma la gnas pa'i byang chub kyi sems dung phor la sogs par blangs te /
analyzed: rdo rje'i lam nas byung zhing padma la gnas pa'i byang chub kyi sems dung phor la sogs par blangs te /
translated: Having arisen from the vajra path, the bodhicitta located in the lotus is taken up in a conch cup, etc.,

original: slob ma'i khar sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: slob ma'i khar sbyin par bya'o //
translated: and given into the disciple’s mouth.

original: kha cig na re rdo rje de nyid khar gzhug par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re rdo rje de nyid khar gzhug par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that very vajra should be placed in the mouth.

original: dbang bskur ba ni rnam par rtog pa zad par byed pas na mchog ste dam pa'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba ni rnam par rtog pa zad par byed pas na mchog ste dam pa'o //
translated: The consecration is supreme, the best, because it causes the exhaustion of conceptual thought.

original: de bzhin du gsang sngags kun ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la sogs pa thob pa'i rgyu yin pas na go 'phang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsang sngags kun ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la sogs pa thob pa'i rgyu yin pas na go 'phang ngo //
translated: Similarly, all mantras are the state, because they are the cause of attaining the body of the Tathāgata, etc.

original: de bas dbang bskur ba 'di yis sngags kun dang sngags thams cad de /
analyzed: de bas dbang bskur ba 'di yis sngags kun dang sngags thams cad de /
translated: Therefore, by this consecration, all mantras and all mantras

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub dang / las mchog gi tshogs rnams ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub rnal 'byor pas grub par 'gyur ro zhes tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub dang / las mchog gi tshogs rnams ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub rnal 'byor pas grub par 'gyur ro zhes tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The supernormal accomplishments that transcend the world and the collection of supreme activities are the supernormal accomplishments of the world, such as pacification, that the yogin will accomplish.

original: de ni bskyed pa'i rim pa dang sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bskyed pa'i rim pa dang sgrub pa'o //
translated: This is the creation stage and the practice.

original: yang shes rab kyi dbang bskur bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang shes rab kyi dbang bskur bar bya ste /
translated: Then one should confer the wisdom initiation.

original: mchog tu dad pa can ni dkon mchog gsum la sems dad pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu dad pa can ni dkon mchog gsum la sems dad pa'o //
translated: One who has supreme faith is one whose mind is faithful to the Three Jewels.

original: shes rab chen po ni thos pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis phul du byung ba'i ye shes thob pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab chen po ni thos pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis phul du byung ba'i ye shes thob pa'o //
translated: One who has great wisdom is one who has attained the highest wisdom through the stages of hearing and so forth.

original: gzugs bzang ni mdzes pa dang sgeg pa dang / na tshod la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs bzang ni mdzes pa dang sgeg pa dang / na tshod la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: One who is beautiful is one who is attractive, graceful, and endowed with the qualities of youth and so forth.

original: sgrub pa po la dga' ba ni rnal 'byor dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa po la dga' ba ni rnal 'byor dang mthun pa'o //
translated: One who delights in the practitioner is one who is compatible with the yoga.

original: sbyor ba gcig ni zla med pa'i sbyor ba ste sngags kyi tshul lo //
analyzed: sbyor ba gcig ni zla med pa'i sbyor ba ste sngags kyi tshul lo //
translated: One who is single-minded is one who is devoted to the way of mantra.

original: nyel bya ba goms pa ni lam de nyid du sgom pa la sogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyel bya ba goms pa ni lam de nyid du sgom pa la sogs par byed pa'o //
translated: One who is devoted is one who meditates and so forth on that very path.

original: dam tshig dag ni bya ba'i rgyud la sogs pa'i dam tshig gi nang nas dam tshig can ni rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i dam tshig gi spyod pa dang ldan pa'i shes rab de blangs nas mchod pa dang / bstod pa dang / bsnyen bskur sngon du 'gro ba'i slob mas bla ma la yon du phul bar bya'o //
analyzed: dam tshig dag ni bya ba'i rgyud la sogs pa'i dam tshig gi nang nas dam tshig can ni rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i dam tshig gi spyod pa dang ldan pa'i shes rab de blangs nas mchod pa dang / bstod pa dang / bsnyen bskur sngon du 'gro ba'i slob mas bla ma la yon du phul bar bya'o //
translated: The one who is committed to the commitments is the wisdom who possesses the conduct of the commitments taught in the Yoga Tantras. Having taken her, the disciple who has made offerings, praises, and supplications should offer her as a gift to the guru.

original: slob ma zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: slob ma zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The disciple is understood to be the remainder of the sentence.

original: rdo rje slob dpon gyis kyang rigs lnga dang sku gsung thugs kyi sa bon byin gyis brlab par byas la m'a ma k'i la sogs pa'i gzugs su bskyed cing rnam par snang mdzad kyi ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i sgrub pa po la de sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje slob dpon gyis kyang rigs lnga dang sku gsung thugs kyi sa bon byin gyis brlab par byas la m'a ma k'i la sogs pa'i gzugs su bskyed cing rnam par snang mdzad kyi ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i sgrub pa po la de sbyin par bya'o //
translated: The vajra master should also bless the seed of the five families and the seed of body, speech, and mind, generate her in the form of Māmakī, and give her to the practitioner who is endowed with the meditative concentration of Vairocana.

original: de nas dam tshig dang sdom pa blang ba dang las su rung ba'i rdo rje la 'jug pa shes rab dang snyoms par 'jug par dang ldan par slob ma bltas te /🔽rang gi snying gnas gti mug @309a * //
analyzed: de nas dam tshig dang sdom pa blang ba dang las su rung ba'i rdo rje la 'jug pa shes rab dang snyoms par 'jug par dang ldan par slob ma bltas te / rang gi snying gnas gti mug @309a * //
translated: Then, having taken the vows and pledges, and having entered the vajra of serviceability, the master should look at the disciple, who is endowed with wisdom and union.

original: dga' ma la sogs pa spro zhing de'i khar gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: dga' ma la sogs pa spro zhing de'i khar gzhug par bya'o //
translated: From his heart, he should emit Mohapriyā, etc., and place her in the disciple’s mouth.

original: de nyid bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid bshad par bya ste /
translated: That should be explained.

original: gti mug sbyor ba ni rnam par snang mdzad dang snyoms par 'jug pa gti mug dga' ma spros shing de'i kha la bcug cing zhugs te /
analyzed: gti mug sbyor ba ni rnam par snang mdzad dang snyoms par 'jug pa gti mug dga' ma spros shing de'i kha la bcug cing zhugs te /
translated: The application of delusion is the emission of Mohapriyā, who is united with Vairocana, and placing her in the disciple’s mouth.

original: de las byung ba'i byang chub sems kyi rgyun gyis dbang bskur na /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i byang chub sems kyi rgyun gyis dbang bskur na /
translated: If he is consecrated with the stream of bodhicitta that arises from that,

original: slob ma gti mug rdo rjer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slob ma gti mug rdo rjer 'gyur ro //
translated: the disciple becomes Mohavajra.

original: de bzhin du zhe sdang dang 'dod chags dang shes rab dang ye shes kyi bdag nyid ni mi bskyod pa dang 'od dpag tu med pa dang don yod grub pa zhe sdang dga' ma dang 'dod chags dga' ma dang / rdo rje dga' ma dang snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldan par spros te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhe sdang dang 'dod chags dang shes rab dang ye shes kyi bdag nyid ni mi bskyod pa dang 'od dpag tu med pa dang don yod grub pa zhe sdang dga' ma dang 'dod chags dga' ma dang / rdo rje dga' ma dang snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldan par spros te /
translated: Likewise, one should emanate the union with Akṣobhya, Amitābha, and Amoghasiddhi, who are the nature of hatred, passion, wisdom, and intuition, and with the hatred-loving, passion-loving, and vajra-loving goddesses.

original: de'i khar bcug cing de las byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems kyi rgyun gyis zhe sdang la sogs pa dag par bya ba'i phyir zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rgyun gyis slob ma la dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i khar bcug cing de las byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems kyi rgyun gyis zhe sdang la sogs pa dag par bya ba'i phyir zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rgyun gyis slob ma la dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: One should insert that into the disciple’s secret place, and one should confer initiation on the disciple with the stream of bodhicitta that emerges from that, in order to purify the stream of hatred, etc.

original: de ni shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba'i cho ga ste bskyed pa'i rim pa dang 'bras bu dag go//
analyzed: de ni shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba'i cho ga ste bskyed pa'i rim pa dang 'bras bu dag go//
translated: That is the rite of conferring the wisdom-intuition initiation, and it is the creation stage and its result.

original: rig pa'i brtul zhugs bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: rig pa'i brtul zhugs bshad par bya ste /
translated: The spiritual deportment of the awareness should be explained.

original: de nas lha mo de nyid ni sngar bshad pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs dang ldan pa blangs nas rdo rje can gyi slob ma ste /
analyzed: de nas lha mo de nyid ni sngar bshad pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs dang ldan pa blangs nas rdo rje can gyi slob ma ste /
translated: Then, having taken up that goddess who is endowed with the previously explained collection of good qualities, the vajra holder, the disciple,

original: de'i lag pa gnyis su bzung ste /
analyzed: de'i lag pa gnyis su bzung ste /
translated: Holding him by both hands,

original: de'i bar na gnas pa'i slob dpon gyis slob ma'i spyi bor lag pa bzhag cing nam mkha'i dbyings la bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dbang por byas la /
analyzed: de'i bar na gnas pa'i slob dpon gyis slob ma'i spyi bor lag pa bzhag cing nam mkha'i dbyings la bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dbang por byas la /
translated: the master who is between them should place his hand on the head of the disciple, and in the presence of those Tathagatas who dwell in the realm of space,

original: de rnams kyi spyan sngar de de la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi spyan sngar de de la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: he should give him to them.

original: 'di yang brjod par bya ste /🔽thabs gzhan ni nyan thos pa la sogs pa'i sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / lus dal ba la sogs pa dang shin tu dka' ba byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa la sogs pa des 'tshang mi rgya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di yang brjod par bya ste / thabs gzhan ni nyan thos pa la sogs pa'i sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / lus dal ba la sogs pa dang shin tu dka' ba byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa la sogs pa des 'tshang mi rgya ba ni /
translated: This should be stated:🔽The other method is that one does not become enlightened by the ascetic practices of the Sravakas, etc.,

original: rdo rje 'chang nyid thob par mi 'gyur te ma dag pa'i thabs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang nyid thob par mi 'gyur te ma dag pa'i thabs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and by the difficult practices of the Bodhisattvas, such as the vow of the Bodhisattva, etc., because one is endowed with impure means.

original: de bas rig pa 'di ni 'od gsal ba'i rig pa 'dis rig pas shes rab bo //
analyzed: de bas rig pa 'di ni 'od gsal ba'i rig pa 'dis rig pas shes rab bo //
translated: Therefore, this knowledge is wisdom, because it is known by this knowledge of clear light.

original: 'di ni bdag gis bying yis brlabs pa yin la mchog ste dam tshig dang sdom pa mchog tu gyur pa long shing ces bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gis bying yis brlabs pa yin la mchog ste dam tshig dang sdom pa mchog tu gyur pa long shing ces bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: This is the supreme consecration, the supreme commitment and vow.

original: gang phyir chos thams cad ni phung po la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang phyir chos thams cad ni phung po la sogs pa ste /
translated: Since all phenomena are the aggregates and so forth,

original: de dag gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rtog pa med pas gnyis su med pa ste gnyis dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rtog pa med pas gnyis su med pa ste gnyis dang bral ba'o //
translated: they are nondual, free from duality, since they are devoid of the concepts of object and subject.

original: dri za'i grong khyer dang 'dra bar 'phrul pas dngos po gnyis te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i @309b dngos po nyid du snang ba yin no //
analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer dang 'dra bar 'phrul pas dngos po gnyis te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i @309b dngos po nyid du snang ba yin no //
translated: Like a gandharva city, they appear as the two things, the object and subject, by the magic of the two things, the object and subject.

original: de bas bzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gzhom par bya ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma'i ngo bor rig pa 'di dang khyod kyis ni brlab par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de bas bzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gzhom par bya ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma'i ngo bor rig pa 'di dang khyod kyis ni brlab par mi bya ste /
translated: Therefore, in order to destroy the concepts of object and subject, you should not consecrate this knowledge as the nature of the goddess of the realm of phenomena,🔽nor should you be separated from it.

original: 'di dang bral bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni rig pa'i brtul zhugs so //
analyzed: 'di dang bral bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni rig pa'i brtul zhugs so //
translated: This is the knowledge observance.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rgyu yin pas na sangs rgyas thab ste /
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rgyu yin pas na sangs rgyas thab ste /
translated: Since this is the cause of all the Buddhas, it is the Buddha's mother.

original: mar ni tshe zhes bya ba'i rig pas rig pa'i brtul zhugs so //
analyzed: mar ni tshe zhes bya ba'i rig pas rig pa'i brtul zhugs so //
translated: The butter is the knowledge of the life-force, which is the knowledge observance.

original: brtul zhugs ni sdom pa'o //
analyzed: brtul zhugs ni sdom pa'o //
translated: Observance is the vow.

original: bla na med pa ni bya ba'i rgyud la sogs pa la zhugs pas rnyed par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa ni bya ba'i rgyud la sogs pa la zhugs pas rnyed par dka' ba'o //
translated: Supreme is difficult to attain by one who has entered the Action Tantra, etc.

original: gang zhig rmongs pa ni 'khrul pa'am brjed ngas pas 'da' ba ni srung bar mi byed na de'i dngos grub mchog ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang gi mtshan nyid grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig rmongs pa ni 'khrul pa'am brjed ngas pas 'da' ba ni srung bar mi byed na de'i dngos grub mchog ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang gi mtshan nyid grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'o //
translated: If one who is confused by delusion or forgetfulness transgresses and does not observe, then his supreme attainment, characterized by the state of Great Vajradhara, will not be accomplished. This is the proof.

original: bdud rtsi lnga'i dri ba'i lan bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga'i dri ba'i lan bshad par bya ste /
translated: The answer to the question about the five nectars will now be given.

original: tha mal pa ni rang bzhin gyis grub pa dri ma ni bshad pa la sogs pa lnga dang / lnga ni lcags kyu lnga'o //
analyzed: tha mal pa ni rang bzhin gyis grub pa dri ma ni bshad pa la sogs pa lnga dang / lnga ni lcags kyu lnga'o //
translated: The ordinary is the naturally existing constituent, the impurity is the five such as feces, and the five are the five hooks.

original: snang ba ni dag pa nyid du snang ba ste /
analyzed: snang ba ni dag pa nyid du snang ba ste /
translated: Appearance is the appearance as pure,

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all phenomena are pure by nature.

original: de bas na 'khor gsum mi dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor pas gal te bdud rtsi dang / lcags kyu spyod na de'i tshe cung zad kyang skyon med de /
analyzed: de bas na 'khor gsum mi dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor pas gal te bdud rtsi dang / lcags kyu spyod na de'i tshe cung zad kyang skyon med de /
translated: Therefore, if a yogin who does not objectify the three spheres should use the nectar and the hook, then at that time there is not the slightest fault.

original: 'on kyang rnam par rtog pa'i 'ching ba las sems grol bar bya ba'i phyir sgom pa'i khyad par brten par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par rtog pa'i 'ching ba las sems grol bar bya ba'i phyir sgom pa'i khyad par brten par bya'o //
translated: However, in order to liberate the mind from the bondage of discursive thought, one should rely on the special meditation.

original: de nyid bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid bshad par bya ste /
translated: That itself should be explained.

original: ye shes lnga ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa bon lnga ste aom la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes lnga ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa bon lnga ste aom la sogs pa'o //
translated: The five intuitions are the five seed-mantras of the Tathagatas, Om and so on.

original: de rnams kyis byin gyis brlab par byas la /
analyzed: de rnams kyis byin gyis brlab par byas la /
translated: Having consecrated them,

original: bdud rtsi lnga ni bdud rtsi dang 'dra bar rims la sogs pa'i sogs pa'i skyon sel bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga ni bdud rtsi dang 'dra bar rims la sogs pa'i sogs pa'i skyon sel bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: the five nectars, which are like nectar, will remove the faults of fever and so on.

original: sba ra ba ni yi ge aom gyis me tog spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: sba ra ba ni yi ge aom gyis me tog spro bar bya'o //
translated: The flower should be emitted by the syllable Om.

original: sreg pa ni padma'i snod kyi 'og na gnas pa'i rlung dang me'i dkyil 'khor gyis so //
analyzed: sreg pa ni padma'i snod kyi 'og na gnas pa'i rlung dang me'i dkyil 'khor gyis so //
translated: The burning is by the wind and fire mandalas located under the lotus vessel.

original: snang ba ni sad pa ste g-yon du bskor bas 'khor ba dang bems po ma yin par bya'o //
analyzed: snang ba ni sad pa ste g-yon du bskor bas 'khor ba dang bems po ma yin par bya'o //
translated: Appearance is the waking state, and by turning to the left, one should not be in cyclic existence or be an insentient being.

original: gzugs snang ba ni sbyang ba ste dag pa'i ngo bo nyid du bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs snang ba ni sbyang ba ste dag pa'i ngo bo nyid du bya'o //
translated: The appearance of form is the purified state, and one should make it the nature of purity.

original: de dag dang yi ge a'a:dang h'um dag gis bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag dang yi ge a'a:dang h'um dag gis bya ba'o //
translated: These are done with the letters A, A, and Hum.

original: sngags kyi sku rab sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: sngags kyi sku rab sbyor ba ste /
translated: The mantra body is the union.

original: rang gi yi dam gyi lha'i sbyor bas lag pa dang lkog ma sbyang zhing nang gi sbyin sreg gi rim gyis bdud rtsi lnga ni rdzas lnga bsdus pa la las byung ba'i bdud rtsi byang chub kyi sems kyi ro bo bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi yi dam gyi lha'i sbyor bas lag pa dang lkog ma sbyang zhing nang gi sbyin sreg gi rim gyis bdud rtsi lnga ni rdzas lnga bsdus pa la las byung ba'i bdud rtsi byang chub kyi sems kyi ro bo bza' bar bya'o //
translated: By the union with one's pledged deity, one should purify the hands and throat, and by the process of inner fire sacrifice, one should eat the taste of the nectar of the bodhicitta, the nectar that arises from the five substances that are the collection of the five nectars.

original: de nyid rim par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid rim par bshad par bya ste /
translated: That very thing will be explained in stages.

original: bar snang ni snod kyi steng gi cha @310a * //
analyzed: bar snang ni snod kyi steng gi cha @310a * //
translated: The space is the upper part of the vessel.

original: ste ; de la yi ge h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje bsams la /
analyzed: ste ; de la yi ge h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje bsams la /
translated: There, one should visualize a vajra arisen from the letter Hum.

original: 'og tu ni yi ge a'a: las byung ba'i padma 'dab ma brgyad pas mtshan pa'i snod bsgoms te de la gnas pa'i bdud rtsi yi ge aom gyis tshim par byed pa'i bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin du bsams la /
analyzed: 'og tu ni yi ge a'a: las byung ba'i padma 'dab ma brgyad pas mtshan pa'i snod bsgoms te de la gnas pa'i bdud rtsi yi ge aom gyis tshim par byed pa'i bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin du bsams la /
translated: Below, one should meditate on a vessel marked with an eight-petaled lotus arisen from the syllable A, and one should imagine the nectar that is located there to be the nature of nectar that satisfies with the syllable Om.

original: yam dang ram las byung ba'i rlung dang me'i dkyil 'khor dag gis sbar la /
analyzed: yam dang ram las byung ba'i rlung dang me'i dkyil 'khor dag gis sbar la /
translated: One should heat it with wind and fire mandalas arisen from the syllables Yam and Ram,

original: rdo rje dang padma steng dang 'og tu mchod pa bzhin du 'dus par byas la /
analyzed: rdo rje dang padma steng dang 'og tu mchod pa bzhin du 'dus par byas la /
translated: and one should gather it above and below like a worship offering with the vajra and lotus.

original: tshim par bya ba'i ngo bo shel ltar dag pa ye shes kyi bdud rtsi bsam ste /
analyzed: tshim par bya ba'i ngo bo shel ltar dag pa ye shes kyi bdud rtsi bsam ste /
translated: One should imagine the nectar of pristine consciousness, which is the nature of satisfaction, pure like crystal.

original: rang gi snying pa las byung ba'i rno ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kyi mtshon chas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na gnas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bkug cing bdud rtsi la bcug ste /
analyzed: rang gi snying pa las byung ba'i rno ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kyi mtshon chas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na gnas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bkug cing bdud rtsi la bcug ste /
translated: One should summon the transcendent lords who reside in the world systems of the ten directions with the weapon of a mass of sharp light rays that arise from one's heart and dissolve them into the nectar.

original: sa bon lnga yongs su gyur pa la de bzhin gshegs pa lngar rang gi lha mo dang snyoms par zhugs pas yongs su gyur pas byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo yi ge gsum gyis bying yis brlabs pa de nyid kyis sbyang ba la sogs pa byas pa
analyzed: sa bon lnga yongs su gyur pa la de bzhin gshegs pa lngar rang gi lha mo dang snyoms par zhugs pas yongs su gyur pas byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo yi ge gsum gyis bying yis brlabs pa de nyid kyis sbyang ba la sogs pa byas pa
translated: The three syllables bless the bindu, the nature of the bodhicitta, with which one performs the purification and so forth.

original: lkog ma dang lce la sogs pa sbyang ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis bza' bar bya ba ni spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: lkog ma dang lce la sogs pa sbyang ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis bza' bar bya ba ni spyad par bya'o //
translated: One should consume the food by the process of purifying the throat, tongue, and so forth.

original: gzhan du ni gal te rnal 'byor pas de ltar mi byed na /
analyzed: gzhan du ni gal te rnal 'byor pas de ltar mi byed na /
translated: Otherwise, if the yogī does not do it that way,

original: de'i tshe 'grub mi 'gyur ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob par mi 'gyur te sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'grub mi 'gyur ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob par mi 'gyur te sgrub pa'o //
translated: then it will not be accomplished, one will not attain the state of Great Vajradhara.

original: tha mal pa'i dngos grub bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: tha mal pa'i dngos grub bshad par bya ste /
translated: The common accomplishments will now be explained.

original: mi snang ba la sos pa ni ri lu la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i sgo nas dngos grub dang / mig sman dang rkang mgyogs dang 'khor lo'i rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i dngos grub gang yin pa de dag ni tha mal pa'i dngos grub yin te longs spyod ster ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi snang ba la sos pa ni ri lu la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i sgo nas dngos grub dang / mig sman dang rkang mgyogs dang 'khor lo'i rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i dngos grub gang yin pa de dag ni tha mal pa'i dngos grub yin te longs spyod ster ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The common accomplishments are those accomplishments that are attained by means of holding a pill, etc., and any accomplishments such as eye-salve, fleet-foot, wheel, knowledge-holder, etc., because they bestow enjoyments.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas bsgrub par byas pas na sangs rgyas kyis bsgrubs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas bsgrub par byas pas na sangs rgyas kyis bsgrubs te /
translated: Likewise, Buddhahood is accomplished by the yoga of the completion stage, and so it is accomplished by the Buddha.

original: rdo rje 'chang nyid dang sangs rgyas nyid de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i go 'phang ngo //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang nyid dang sangs rgyas nyid de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i go 'phang ngo //
translated: That is the state of Vajradhara, Buddhahood, the state of the five Tathagatas.

original: gnyis po de yang de bzhin gshegs pa dang rdo rje 'chang gi dbugs dbyung ba'i mtshan nyid ni dngos grub mchog ces bya ste thar pa ster bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis po de yang de bzhin gshegs pa dang rdo rje 'chang gi dbugs dbyung ba'i mtshan nyid ni dngos grub mchog ces bya ste thar pa ster bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And those two are called the supreme accomplishment, which is the nature of the consolation of the Tathagatas and Vajradhara, because it bestows liberation.

original: de ni bsgrub pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bsgrub pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That is the stage of accomplishment and completion.

original: rim pa gnyis par bsnyen pa la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: rim pa gnyis par bsnyen pa la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: In the second stage, the approximation, etc. are to be explained.

original: thabs rnams bzhi po ni dbye ba rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: thabs rnams bzhi po ni dbye ba rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The four methods are the four divisions.

original: byang chub rdo rje ni rdo @310b rje 'chang chen pos so //
analyzed: byang chub rdo rje ni rdo @310b rje 'chang chen pos so //
translated: The Great Vajradhara, the Buddha Vajradhara,

original: sgrub pa ni lha'i sku sgrub par byed pa dang / 'od gsal la rtog par byed pa gsungs zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni lha'i sku sgrub par byed pa dang / 'od gsal la rtog par byed pa gsungs zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud gsungs pa'o //
translated: has taught the practice of the deity body and the realization of clear light.

original: rnal 'byor gyi rgyud thams cad ni rdo rje 'jigs byed dang rdo rje sa 'og gi rgyud la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi rgyud thams cad ni rdo rje 'jigs byed dang rdo rje sa 'og gi rgyud la sogs pa'o //
translated: All the Yoga Tantras are the Vajrabhairava Tantra, the Vajra- netherworld Tantra, etc.

original: rnal 'byor pa ni rnam pa gnyis kyi rnal 'byor pa ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ni rnam pa gnyis kyi rnal 'byor pa ste /
translated: The yogi is of two kinds:

original: sngags pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po thob par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sngags pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po thob par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa'o //
translated: The mantra practitioner is taught for the sake of attaining Great Vajradhara.

original: de ni bskyed pa'i rim pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag go //
analyzed: de ni bskyed pa'i rim pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag go //
translated: That is the creation stage and the perfection stage.

original: bsnyen pa la sogs pa ni yan lag bzhi po mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen pa la sogs pa ni yan lag bzhi po mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: The approximation, etc. are the brief explanation of the four branches.

original: thun mong zhes bya ba la sogs pa la tha mal pa dang mchog gi dbye bas rnam pa gnyis su bstan to //
analyzed: thun mong zhes bya ba la sogs pa la tha mal pa dang mchog gi dbye bas rnam pa gnyis su bstan to //
translated: The common and so forth. It is taught to be of two kinds, divided into ordinary and supreme.

original: rdo rje bzhi po ni mngon par byang chub lnga'i rim gyis bsnyen pa la sogs pa tha mal pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje bzhi po ni mngon par byang chub lnga'i rim gyis bsnyen pa la sogs pa tha mal pa'o //
translated: The four vajras are the ordinary approach and so forth by means of the five stages of manifest enlightenment.

original: yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor gyis ni mchog gi bsnyen pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor gyis ni mchog gi bsnyen pa'o //
translated: The supreme approach is by means of the yoga of the six branches.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa rgyud thams cad las gsungs pa'i dang po sbyor ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi nang du bsdus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa rgyud thams cad las gsungs pa'i dang po sbyor ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi nang du bsdus par 'gyur ro //
translated: The three samadhis of the first stage and so forth, which are taught in all the tantras, such as emptiness and so forth, are included within that.

original: de ni rdo rje bzhi po'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de ni rdo rje bzhi po'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: That is the definition of the four vajras.

original: tha mal pa'i bsnyen pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tha mal pa'i bsnyen pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: That is the ordinary approach and so forth.

original: de ni dang po sbyor ba dang dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog dang las kyi rgyal po mchog go //
analyzed: de ni dang po sbyor ba dang dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog dang las kyi rgyal po mchog go //
translated: That is the first stage, the mandala of the supreme victor, and the supreme king of activities.

original: ye shes ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa ste /
translated: Wisdom is the completion stage.

original: de nyid rga ba dang 'chi ba med pa'i go 'phang thob par byed pas na bdud rtsi ste /
analyzed: de nyid rga ba dang 'chi ba med pa'i go 'phang thob par byed pas na bdud rtsi ste /
translated: Since that itself causes the attainment of the state of immortality, it is nectar.

original: des ni bsnyen pa la sogs pa mchog ste /
analyzed: des ni bsnyen pa la sogs pa mchog ste /
translated: Therefore, supreme means that the approach, etc. are the best,

original: phul du byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phul du byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that is, the most excellent.

original: de nyid kyi phyir yan lag bzhi pa'i nang nas bsnyen pa gcig pu ni sbyor ba drug gis te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yan lag bzhi pa'i nang nas bsnyen pa gcig pu ni sbyor ba drug gis te /
translated: For that very reason, from among the four branches, the approach alone is to be done with the six applications,

original: so sor sdud pa la sogs pa sbyor ba drug gis bya'o //
analyzed: so sor sdud pa la sogs pa sbyor ba drug gis bya'o //
translated: that is, with the six applications of withdrawal, etc.

original: gzhan du na mchog gi dngos grub ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i dngos grub tu mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du na mchog gi dngos grub ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i dngos grub tu mi 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, the supreme attainment would not be the attainment of Great Vajradhara.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the completion stage.

original: so sor sdud pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: so sor sdud pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: The brief teaching of the yoga of the six limbs with withdrawal, etc.

original: dbang po bcu zhes bya ba la sogs dpas rgyas par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po bcu zhes bya ba la sogs dpas rgyas par bshad par bya'o //
translated: The extensive explanation with the ten faculties, etc.

original: dbang po ni mig la sogs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: dbang po ni mig la sogs pa lnga'o //
translated: The faculties are the five beginning with the eye.

original: don ni gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga'o //
analyzed: don ni gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga'o //
translated: The objects are the five objects beginning with form.

original: de dag bsdus pa ni dbang po dag go //
analyzed: de dag bsdus pa ni dbang po dag go //
translated: The collection of those is the faculties.

original: dbang po yul dang bcu po de dag ni rang gi yul gzung bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dbang po yul dang bcu po de dag ni rang gi yul gzung bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Those ten, the faculties and the objects, have the characteristic of apprehending their own objects.

original: de blangs nas so sor ni rang gi yul re re la nye @311a * //
analyzed: de blangs nas so sor ni rang gi yul re re la nye @311a * //
translated: Having taken them up, they are individually enjoyed in their own respective objects.

original: bar spyod pa dang / 'dod pa lnga nye bar spyod bas de ni so sor sdud pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bar spyod pa dang / 'dod pa lnga nye bar spyod bas de ni so sor sdud pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Since the five objects of desire are enjoyed, this is called “individual withdrawal.”

original: yan lag dang po'o //
analyzed: yan lag dang po'o //
translated: This is the first branch.

original: de rnam par dag pa'i phyir bsam gtan bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa'i phyir bsam gtan bshad par bya ste /
translated: In order to purify that, meditative concentration should be explained.

original: 'dod pa lnga ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul te /
analyzed: 'dod pa lnga ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul te /
translated: The five objects of desire are objects such as form.

original: de dag dbang po dang bcas pas gcig tu byas la de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin du brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag dbang po dang bcas pas gcig tu byas la de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin du brtag par bya ste /
translated: Having combined them with the sense faculties, they should be imagined as having the nature of the five tathāgatas.

original: bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “meditative concentration.”

original: de'i yang bye brag lnga ste /
analyzed: de'i yang bye brag lnga ste /
translated: It also has five divisions.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa ni rags pa dang phra ba'i rtog pa ste chags pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa ni rags pa dang phra ba'i rtog pa ste chags pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Conceptualization and analysis are coarse and subtle conceptualization, which have the nature of attachment.

original: dga' ba dang bde ba ni lus dang sems kyi bde ba'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: dga' ba dang bde ba ni lus dang sems kyi bde ba'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Joy and pleasure have the nature of physical and mental bliss.

original: chags pa dang chags pa dang bral ba'i ngo bo sems rtse gcig ni chags pa dang chags pa dang bral ba dang chags ba bar ma med pa 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: chags pa dang chags pa dang bral ba'i ngo bo sems rtse gcig ni chags pa dang chags pa dang bral ba dang chags ba bar ma med pa 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The mind of one passion, free from passion, and of the nature of one-pointedness, is the nature of clear light, free from passion, free from the middle, and free from passion.

original: de nyid bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid bshad par bya ste /
translated: That should be explained.

original: gsang ba gsum 'byung ba ni yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa'i reg pa las byung ba'i bde ba la 'khrugs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de nyid sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: gsang ba gsum 'byung ba ni yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa'i reg pa las byung ba'i bde ba la 'khrugs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de nyid sbyor ba ste /
translated: The arising of the three secrets is the bliss that arises from the contact of the object, faculty, and consciousness, and its characteristic is agitation. That itself is union.

original: rtog pa gsum yongs su spangs nas nyams su myong ba ni spyod pa ste gnyis po de dag ni chags pa dang snang ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa gsum yongs su spangs nas nyams su myong ba ni spyod pa ste gnyis po de dag ni chags pa dang snang ba'o //
translated: Having abandoned the three concepts, the experience is the practice. Those two are passion and appearance.

original: de nas dbang po thams cad kyi rnam par rtog pa yongs su spangs nas lus shin tu sbyangs pa tsam ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de nas dbang po thams cad kyi rnam par rtog pa yongs su spangs nas lus shin tu sbyangs pa tsam ni dga' ba'o //
translated: Then, having abandoned all conceptual thoughts of the faculties, the mere physical pliancy is joy.

original: de nas lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang bral bas na sems shin tu sbyang ba ste /
analyzed: de nas lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang bral bas na sems shin tu sbyang ba ste /
translated: Then, because of being free from physical pliancy, there is mental pliancy.

original: bsdus par gyur ba'i bde ba bsdus pa ste nyams su myong ba ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bsdus par gyur ba'i bde ba bsdus pa ste nyams su myong ba ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the experience of the bliss of the contracted state of the contracted.

original: gnyis po de dag chags pa dang chags pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: gnyis po de dag chags pa dang chags pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: These two states are the state of passion and the state of passionlessness.

original: snang ba mched pa dang snang ba nye bar thob pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba mched pa dang snang ba nye bar thob pa'o //
