analyzed: gzugs brnyan ni de dang 'dra ba'i gzugs te /
translated: and the image is a form like it.

original: khro bos khyab pa'i sems ni drag shul dang ldan pa'i sems kyis gcer bu dang skra grol bar gyur cing rdo rje lcags kyus mtshan pa'i rkang pa g-yon pas de mnan cing g-yas brkyang bas gnas bas lho phyogs su kha bltas te /🔽gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i khro bo'i sngags brjod pas rang gi snying ga nas khro bo'i 'khor lo spros te /
analyzed: khro bos khyab pa'i sems ni drag shul dang ldan pa'i sems kyis gcer bu dang skra grol bar gyur cing rdo rje lcags kyus mtshan pa'i rkang pa g-yon pas de mnan cing g-yas brkyang bas gnas bas lho phyogs su kha bltas te / gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i khro bo'i sngags brjod pas rang gi snying ga nas khro bo'i 'khor lo spros te /
translated: The mind pervaded by wrath is the mind endowed with violence.

original: sna tshogs ni bran dang bran mo dang / pho nya dang pho nya mo'i bka' dang bka' nyan mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba ni 'khor dang bcas pa yi ge h'um gis brdeg par bya ba'i phyir bka' bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs ni bran dang bran mo dang / pho nya dang pho nya mo'i bka' dang bka' nyan mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba ni 'khor dang bcas pa yi ge h'um gis brdeg par bya ba'i phyir bka' bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Having emanated the wheel of wrathful ones from one's heart, one should command the various servants, male and female, and messengers, male and female, and the assembly of female listeners, the retinue, with the syllable hūṃ, in order to strike.

original: de dag song zhing sgrub pa rdo rje can ni rnal 'byor pa'i bka' bsgrub par bya ba'i don du /
analyzed: de dag song zhing sgrub pa rdo rje can ni rnal 'byor pa'i bka' bsgrub par bya ba'i don du /
translated: Having gone there, the practitioner who possesses the vajra, the yogī, should accomplish the command.

original: bsgrub bya ni zhags pas bcings la tho bas brdeg / khro bo'i rgyal po ni khro bo'i tshogs kyis bkug cing 'jigs pa ni 'jigs pas khyab cing brdung ba ni skyabs med pa /
analyzed: bsgrub bya ni zhags pas bcings la tho bas brdeg / khro bo'i rgyal po ni khro bo'i tshogs kyis bkug cing 'jigs pa ni 'jigs pas khyab cing brdung ba ni skyabs med pa /
translated: The one who is frightened is pervaded by fear.🔽The one who is beaten is without refuge.

original: skrag pa ni skyabs dang bral ba /
analyzed: skrag pa ni skyabs dang bral ba /
translated: The one who is terrified is separated from refuge.

original: gyur pa ni mig @317b bzlog pa /
analyzed: gyur pa ni mig @317b bzlog pa /
translated: The one who is turned away is the victim.

original: bsgrub bya ni dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bya ni dgug par bya'o //
translated: The one who is to be summoned is the victim.

original: de nas sgrub pa po la bsgrub bya de don du gnas par mthong zhing de'i gzugs brnyan la phab pa ni gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sgrub pa po la bsgrub bya de don du gnas par mthong zhing de'i gzugs brnyan la phab pa ni gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Then, the adept should see the victim standing for the sake of the adept, and should cause him to enter the image.

original: de'i rdo rje gsum ni sku gsung thugs kyi sa bon tshar du gnas pa /
analyzed: de'i rdo rje gsum ni sku gsung thugs kyi sa bon tshar du gnas pa /
translated: His three vajras are the seed syllables of body, speech, and mind.

original: phur bu'i sngags mi gnod mdzes kyi rgyal po'i sngags kyis gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: phur bu'i sngags mi gnod mdzes kyi rgyal po'i sngags kyis gdab par bya'o //
translated: He should drive in the dagger with the mantra of Ucchuṣma, the king of wrathful ones.

original: spyi bo dang lkog ma dang snying ga la sku gsung thugs kyi sa bon gyi gzugs la phur bus gdab pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: spyi bo dang lkog ma dang snying ga la sku gsung thugs kyi sa bon gyi gzugs la phur bus gdab pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that he should drive in the dagger at the head, throat, and heart, which are the forms of the seed syllables of body, speech, and mind.

original: de nas yams ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: de nas yams ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Then, the plague is suffering.

original: nye bar 'tshe ba ni sha za la sogs pa dang / nad ni rims la sogs pa dang / sna tshogs yul las byung ba ni dug nag po brtsegs pa la sogs pa dang / 'byung ba ni gang las byung ba de ni 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: nye bar 'tshe ba ni sha za la sogs pa dang / nad ni rims la sogs pa dang / sna tshogs yul las byung ba ni dug nag po brtsegs pa la sogs pa dang / 'byung ba ni gang las byung ba de ni 'byung ba ste /
translated: The harm is from flesh-eating spirits, etc., the disease is from contagious fever, etc., the various is from the black-stacked poison, etc., and the elemental is from whatever it arises.

original: mche ba'i dug dang / dran pa'i dug dang / reg pa'i dug dang / lta ba'i dug la sogs pa'i sprul rnams so //
analyzed: mche ba'i dug dang / dran pa'i dug dang / reg pa'i dug dang / lta ba'i dug la sogs pa'i sprul rnams so //
translated: The poisons of the snakes are the poison of the fangs, the poison of memory, the poison of touch, the poison of sight, etc.

original: sprul rnams kyi dug de bkug cing gzugs brnyan de'i mgo bo la sogs pa la gzhug cing snga ma bzhin du phur bus gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: sprul rnams kyi dug de bkug cing gzugs brnyan de'i mgo bo la sogs pa la gzhug cing snga ma bzhin du phur bus gdab par bya'o //
translated: The poison of the snakes is summoned and inserted into the head, etc., of the effigy, and as before, it is nailed down with the kīla.

original: de nas sbyor ba thams cad kyis cho ga ji skad gsungs pa bzhin bya ba ni phyogs dang / yul dang / dus dang / rim pa dang mthun pa'i sngags kyis ni khro bo'i sngags dang / 'khrul 'khor ni 'khrul 'khor gyi sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: de nas sbyor ba thams cad kyis cho ga ji skad gsungs pa bzhin bya ba ni phyogs dang / yul dang / dus dang / rim pa dang mthun pa'i sngags kyis ni khro bo'i sngags dang / 'khrul 'khor ni 'khrul 'khor gyi sbyor ba dang /
translated: Then, all the rites should be performed according to the instructions, in accordance with the directions, the country, the time, and the sequence. The mantra is the wrathful mantra, the yantra is the application of the yantra,

original: stsogs pa'i sgras ni rdzas la sogs pa dang / phyag rgya rnams kyis kyang sbyor bar bya ba ni sbyor ba bzhi'i rim gyis rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: stsogs pa'i sgras ni rdzas la sogs pa dang / phyag rgya rnams kyis kyang sbyor bar bya ba ni sbyor ba bzhi'i rim gyis rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: One should perform the union by the process of the four unions.

original: yang na sngar bshad pa'i khro bo'i gzugs dang khro bo'i sngags dang ldan pas khro bo'i sngags zlos pas 'gro ba'i gzugs brnyan mtshan ma gcig la sogs pa'i sa ru /
analyzed: yang na sngar bshad pa'i khro bo'i gzugs dang khro bo'i sngags dang ldan pas khro bo'i sngags zlos pas 'gro ba'i gzugs brnyan mtshan ma gcig la sogs pa'i sa ru /
translated: Or else, endowed with the wrathful form and the wrathful mantra explained previously, one who recites the wrathful mantra should, in a place with a single sign and so forth,🔽consecrate the vajra hook with the left foot, and standing in the center of the wrathful mandala, with the fire of madana wood, the yogin of Akṣobhya should cut up the effigy into pieces and burn it.

original: rdo rje lcags kyus byin gyis brlabs pa ni rkang pa g-yon pas mnan cing shing ma da na'i mel khro bo'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su gnas pa ni mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pas gzugs brnyan du ma bu dum bur gtub cing bsregs na dgra 'chi bar 'gyur
analyzed: rdo rje lcags kyus byin gyis brlabs pa ni rkang pa g-yon pas mnan cing shing ma da na'i mel khro bo'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su gnas pa ni mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pas gzugs brnyan du ma bu dum bur gtub cing bsregs na dgra 'chi bar 'gyur
translated: Then the enemy will die.

original: ro // yang na gdug pa'i sems can ni re zhig mkha' la spyod pa ste /
analyzed: ro // yang na gdug pa'i sems can ni re zhig mkha' la spyod pa ste /
translated: Or else, the wicked beings are those who fly in the sky for a while,

original: bya rog dang bya rgod dang kang ka la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bya rog dang bya rgod dang kang ka la sogs pa'o //
translated: such as crows, vultures, and herons.

original: sa la spyod pa ni spyang ki dang dom dang dred la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sa la spyod pa ni spyang ki dang dom dang dred la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those who move on the earth are wolves, bears, and hyenas.

original: sa 'og la spyod pa ni chu srin dang rus sbal la sogs pa'o //🔽de dag khros par gyur pa ni kha sbyor phye zhing 'jigs pa mig zlog pa la rdul gyis @318a * //
analyzed: sa 'og la spyod pa ni chu srin dang rus sbal la sogs pa'o // de dag khros par gyur pa ni kha sbyor phye zhing 'jigs pa mig zlog pa la rdul gyis @318a * //
translated: Those who move under the earth are crocodiles, turtles, and so on.🔽When they are enraged, they open the mouth of the union, and the blood that comes from above and below, from the eyes rolling in fear, and from the body smeared with dust,

original: lus byugs pas steng dang 'og las khrag byung bas zos par gyur pa ni dum bu dum bur zos par gyur pas rab tu brtags pa bsams na dgra bo 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus byugs pas steng dang 'og las khrag byung bas zos par gyur pa ni dum bu dum bur zos par gyur pas rab tu brtags pa bsams na dgra bo 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: is eaten, that is, devoured, by the pieces, and the enemy dies when imagined in this way.

original: khyad par ni yi ge h'um gi rnam pa'i shes pa dpal ldan mi bskyod pa'i gzugs can dkyil 'khor pas yongs su bskor ba chos ston pa'i drung du song bar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par ni yi ge h'um gi rnam pa'i shes pa dpal ldan mi bskyod pa'i gzugs can dkyil 'khor pas yongs su bskor ba chos ston pa'i drung du song bar bsam par bya'o //
translated: The difference is that one should imagine that one has gone into the presence of the Dharma teacher, who is in the form of the syllable hūṃ, surrounded by the maṇḍala, in the form of Śrī Acala.

original: yang na rang gi snying ga'i ye shes sems dpa'i sa bon gyi thig le la 'jug go //
analyzed: yang na rang gi snying ga'i ye shes sems dpa'i sa bon gyi thig le la 'jug go //
translated: Or else, one should enter into the drop of the seed syllable of the gnosis being in one’s heart.

original: 'o na srog gcod pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde de dang der rnam par smin pa bzod dka' bar gsungs te /
analyzed: 'o na srog gcod pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde de dang der rnam par smin pa bzod dka' bar gsungs te /
translated: and that:

original: gang zhig srog gcod pa ni mi gdug pa //🔽drag po khrag gis lag pa byug / sdig pa'i las ni kun spyod pa //
analyzed: gang zhig srog gcod pa ni mi gdug pa // drag po khrag gis lag pa byug / sdig pa'i las ni kun spyod pa //
translated: One who kills is a cruel person,🔽his hands smeared with blood,🔽he always engages in sinful actions,

original: rtag tu du 'bod skye bar 'gyur //🔽de bzhin 'tshe bas tshe thung 'gyur //
analyzed: rtag tu du 'bod skye bar 'gyur // de bzhin 'tshe bas tshe thung 'gyur //
translated: and is born in a hell of wailing.🔽And that:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs na /
translated: Likewise, through violence, one’s life is short.

original: de bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung ji ltar 'gal ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung ji ltar 'gal ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: How is this not contradictory to the words of the Bhagavån?

original: smras pa / srog chags zhes bya ba ni thams cad do //
analyzed: smras pa / srog chags zhes bya ba ni thams cad do //
translated: We reply: All living beings are called living beings.

original: 'tshe bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'tshe bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: They are not violent.

original: 'on kyang gang zhig sdig pa chen po'i las can thabs mkhas kyis kyang gdul bar mi nus na mnar med pa'i dmyal bar lhung ba dang / nye bar bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pas sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas gsod cing de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku skyed par byed de tshar gcod pa'i sgo nas phan 'dogs par byed do //
analyzed: 'on kyang gang zhig sdig pa chen po'i las can thabs mkhas kyis kyang gdul bar mi nus na mnar med pa'i dmyal bar lhung ba dang / nye bar bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pas sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas gsod cing de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku skyed par byed de tshar gcod pa'i sgo nas phan 'dogs par byed do //
translated: However, if someone with great evil karma cannot be tamed even by skillful means, then the practitioner who has great compassion, in order to protect the person and to cast them into the Avīci hell, kills them by the stage of mantra and mudra and generates the body of a tathāgata.

original: gal te gcig ni gsod 'gyur na //
analyzed: gal te gcig ni gsod 'gyur na //
translated: If one person is killed

original: mang po bde ba ldan gyur te //
analyzed: mang po bde ba ldan gyur te //
translated: and many people are made happy,

original: de ni bsod nams tshogs chen po //
analyzed: de ni bsod nams tshogs chen po //
translated: that is a great accumulation of merit.

original: gzhan du na ni sdig pa che //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni sdig pa che //
translated: Otherwise, it is a great sin.

original: zhes gsung pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes gsung pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement.

original: 'o na bsad pa ni tshe dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: 'o na bsad pa ni tshe dang bral ba ste /
translated: Well then, killing is the separation of life from the body.

original: de ji ltar na mtshon cha la sogs pas gnad gcod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid yin pa de bzhin du sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas kyang yin te /
analyzed: de ji ltar na mtshon cha la sogs pas gnad gcod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid yin pa de bzhin du sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas kyang yin te /
translated: How is it that by the stage of mantra and mudra, it is the suffering of severing the vital points with weapons and so on?

original: de bas na de'i rnam par smin pa ni mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na de'i rnam par smin pa ni mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the maturation of the karma is the same.

original: gang gi phyir pha rol po ni bdag nyid kyi srog dang bral ba ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir pha rol po ni bdag nyid kyi srog dang bral ba ni mi 'dod de /
translated: But if the opponent does not want to deprive the other of life,

original: de ni thams cad 'dod do zhes pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ni thams cad 'dod do zhes pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because he wants everything,🔽then let him not say that, because it is the same.

original: de ltar ma smra shig / sngags la sogs pa'i rim gyis srog dgug par byas pa ni pha rol ni sdug bsngal 'byung bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ltar ma smra shig / sngags la sogs pa'i rim gyis srog dgug par byas pa ni pha rol ni sdug bsngal 'byung bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: By the process of mantra and so on, the life of the other is drawn in, and the other does not experience the arising of suffering.

original: 'on kyang rmi lam du sna tshogs @318b kyi kun dga' ra ba la sogs pa mthong ba bzhin du yid bde ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro zhes mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rmi lam du sna tshogs @318b kyi kun dga' ra ba la sogs pa mthong ba bzhin du yid bde ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro zhes mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: But just as one sees a park and so on in a dream, one experiences mental pleasure.

original: thams cad kyi srog gces shes smras pa gang yin pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi srog gces shes smras pa gang yin pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, it is not reasonable to say that all cherish their own lives.

original: de ltar yin na 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / srid pa'i longs spyod bcos ma ma yin na yang thams cad ni zhen pa spang bar bya ba'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis don med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yin na 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / srid pa'i longs spyod bcos ma ma yin na yang thams cad ni zhen pa spang bar bya ba'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis don med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then even if desire, etc., and the enjoyments of existence are not artificial, it follows that the twelve branches of the scriptures of the Lord are meaningless, because they are for the purpose of abandoning attachment.

original: de bas na de'i sdig pa spong ba'i don du srog gces pa yin na yang 'gugs na skyon ni cung zad med de /
analyzed: de bas na de'i sdig pa spong ba'i don du srog gces pa yin na yang 'gugs na skyon ni cung zad med de /
translated: Therefore, if one is concerned about the sin of that, there is not the slightest fault in summoning, even if it is for the purpose of abandoning that sin.

original: gzhon nu don thams cad grub pas 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid kyi longs spyod bor ba bzhin du ha cang thal bar 'gyur zhes sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: gzhon nu don thams cad grub pas 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid kyi longs spyod bor ba bzhin du ha cang thal bar 'gyur zhes sgrub pa'o //
translated: It is established that it would be an extreme absurdity, like the prince Sarvārthasiddha abandoning the enjoyments of a universal monarch.

original: zhi ba la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, pacification, etc., should be explained.

original: zhi ba 'dod par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pas /
analyzed: zhi ba 'dod par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pas /
translated: The yogi who wishes for pacification

original: zhi ba'i sems ni 'jam pa'i sems dang phyi rol gyi yo byad kyang 'jam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhi ba'i sems ni 'jam pa'i sems dang phyi rol gyi yo byad kyang 'jam par 'gyur ro //
translated: has a peaceful mind and also the external requisites become peaceful.

original: rgyas par byed par 'dod na sems ni rgyas pa dang rdzas kyang gser gyi kha dog lta bur bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par byed par 'dod na sems ni rgyas pa dang rdzas kyang gser gyi kha dog lta bur bya'o //
translated: If one wishes to expand, one should expand the mind and the substance should be like the color of gold.

original: dbang ni rgyal po la sogs pa dbang du byed na sems chags pa dang phyi rol gyi rdzas rnams kyang dmar por bya'o //
analyzed: dbang ni rgyal po la sogs pa dbang du byed na sems chags pa dang phyi rol gyi rdzas rnams kyang dmar por bya'o //
translated: If one wishes to enthrall a king and so forth, one should make the mind attached and the external substances red.

original: gtum pa ni drag po'i las te gsod pa'i las byed na sems khro ba dang phyi rol gyi rdzas rnams kyang nag por bya'o //
analyzed: gtum pa ni drag po'i las te gsod pa'i las byed na sems khro ba dang phyi rol gyi rdzas rnams kyang nag por bya'o //
translated: If one wishes to perform a violent rite, such as killing, one should make the mind angry and the external substances black.

original: zlum po dang gru bzhi dang zur gsum dang zla gam gyi rnam pa ste me thab po //
analyzed: zlum po dang gru bzhi dang zur gsum dang zla gam gyi rnam pa ste me thab po //
translated: The shapes are round, square, triangular, and half-moon shaped.

original: bram ze dang rgyal rigs dang rje'i rigs dang dmangs rigs kyi khyim la me'o //
analyzed: bram ze dang rgyal rigs dang rje'i rigs dang dmangs rigs kyi khyim la me'o //
translated: The fires are in the houses of Brahmins, Kshatriyas, Vaishyas, and Shudras.

original: 'o ma can gyi shing dang ma da na'i shing dang padma'i rtsa ba dang tsher ma rnams ni yam shing ngo //
analyzed: 'o ma can gyi shing dang ma da na'i shing dang padma'i rtsa ba dang tsher ma rnams ni yam shing ngo //
translated: The kindling woods are of the milky trees, Madana trees, lotus roots, and thorns.

original: wa sham dang boo sha ta dang dza:hri dang h'um phat ni sngags spel ba'o //
analyzed: wa sham dang boo sha ta dang dza:hri dang h'um phat ni sngags spel ba'o //
translated: The mantras for increasing are vaushtam, jhrum, hrih, and hum phat.

original: dkar po dang ser po dang dmar po dang nag po ni gos so //
analyzed: dkar po dang ser po dang dmar po dang nag po ni gos so //
translated: White, yellow, red, and black are the colors of the cloth.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin no //
translated: The rest is the same.

original: shel dang gser dang bzhi mnyam dang mi rus kyi phreng ba'o ;
analyzed: shel dang gser dang bzhi mnyam dang mi rus kyi phreng ba'o ;
translated: The rosaries are of crystal, gold, the four metals, and human bone.

original: /'o ma dang mar dang padma dang / bil ba dang / gur gum dang / tsandan dang / sha chen la sogs pa ni bsreg rdzas so //
analyzed: /'o ma dang mar dang padma dang / bil ba dang / gur gum dang / tsandan dang / sha chen la sogs pa ni bsreg rdzas so //
translated: The burnt offerings are milk, clarified butter, lotus, bilva fruit, saffron, sandalwood, human flesh, and so forth.

original: sems dpa'i skyil mo krung dang / rdo rje'i skyil mo krung dang / rdo rje'i skyil mo krung dang / g-yas brkyang ba dang g-yon brkyang ba ni stang stabs so //
analyzed: sems dpa'i skyil mo krung dang / rdo rje'i skyil mo krung dang / rdo rje'i skyil mo krung dang / g-yas brkyang ba dang g-yon brkyang ba ni stang stabs so //
translated: The postures are the bodhisattva posture, the vajra posture, the extended right leg posture, and the extended left leg posture.

original: sna rtse la gtad @319a * //
analyzed: sna rtse la gtad @319a * //
translated: The gazes are the tip of the nose,

original: ba dang / mnyam pa dang / g-yon la zur du blta ba dang / dpral ba lta ba ni lta ba'o //
analyzed: ba dang / mnyam pa dang / g-yon la zur du blta ba dang / dpral ba lta ba ni lta ba'o //
translated: the equal gaze, the oblique gaze to the left, and the forehead gaze.

original: skra mnyam pa dang / skra bcings pa dang / g-yon sku skra yo ba dang / grol ba ni cha lugs so //
analyzed: skra mnyam pa dang / skra bcings pa dang / g-yon sku skra yo ba dang / grol ba ni cha lugs so //
translated: The styles are equal hair, bound hair, hair hanging to the left, and loose hair.

original: rtse lnga pa dang / rtse dgu pa dang / rtse gsum pa dang / rtse gcig pa ni rdo rje dril bu'o //
analyzed: rtse lnga pa dang / rtse dgu pa dang / rtse gsum pa dang / rtse gcig pa ni rdo rje dril bu'o //
translated: The five-pointed, nine-pointed, three-pointed, and single-pointed [vajras] are the vajra and bell.

original: dngul dang gser dang zangs dang lcags las brdungs pa ni phur bu'o //
analyzed: dngul dang gser dang zangs dang lcags las brdungs pa ni phur bu'o //
translated: The [vajra] stakes are made of silver, gold, copper, and iron.

original: dkar po dang ser po dang dmar po dang / nag po ni thig skud do //
analyzed: dkar po dang ser po dang dmar po dang / nag po ni thig skud do //
translated: The threads are white, yellow, red, and black.

original: 'o ma dang chu dang ga bur gyi chu dang khrag gis gang ba ni mchod yon no //
analyzed: 'o ma dang chu dang ga bur gyi chu dang khrag gis gang ba ni mchod yon no //
translated: The libation is filled with milk, water, camphor water, and blood.

original: dpal gyi dbyangs dang / dga' ba'i dbyangs dang / drag po'i dbyangs dang / 'dod pa'i dbyangs ni glu'o //
analyzed: dpal gyi dbyangs dang / dga' ba'i dbyangs dang / drag po'i dbyangs dang / 'dod pa'i dbyangs ni glu'o //
translated: The songs are the glorious melody, the joyful melody, the fierce melody, and the passionate melody.

original: rnam par snang mdzad dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / snang ba mtha' yas dang / mi bskyod pa ni lha'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / snang ba mtha' yas dang / mi bskyod pa ni lha'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The deity yoga is Vairocana, Ratnasaṃbhava, Amitābha, and Akṣobhya.

original: gtsug lag khang dang / khang bzangs dang / rgyal po'i nags tshal dang / dur khrod ni gnas so //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang dang / khang bzangs dang / rgyal po'i nags tshal dang / dur khrod ni gnas so //
translated: The places are the temple, the palace, the king's forest, and the charnel ground.

original: shar dang / byang dang / nub dang / lho phyogs ni phyogs so //
analyzed: shar dang / byang dang / nub dang / lho phyogs ni phyogs so //
translated: The directions are east, north, west, and south.

original: srod dang / nang par dang / nyin mo dang mtshan phyed ni dus so //🔽rgyal stod dang / rgyal smad dang / lag pa dang / nam mthong gong ma ni rgyu skar ro //
analyzed: srod dang / nang par dang / nyin mo dang mtshan phyed ni dus so // rgyal stod dang / rgyal smad dang / lag pa dang / nam mthong gong ma ni rgyu skar ro //
translated: Evening, morning, day, and night are the times.🔽The first, second, third, and fourth parts of the night are the watches.🔽The moon, Mercury, Venus, Mars, and Jupiter are the planets.

original: zla ba dang / gza' lag pa dang / pa ba sangs dang / mig dmar dang / spen pa ni gza'o byis pa dang / gzhon nu dang / dar la bab pa dang / rgan pa ni 'khor ro //
analyzed: zla ba dang / gza' lag pa dang / pa ba sangs dang / mig dmar dang / spen pa ni gza'o byis pa dang / gzhon nu dang / dar la bab pa dang / rgan pa ni 'khor ro //
translated: Childhood, youth, adulthood, and old age are the periods.

original: dbyar dang / ston ka dang / dpyid ka dang / so ga ni dus so //
analyzed: dbyar dang / ston ka dang / dpyid ka dang / so ga ni dus so //
translated: Summer, autumn, winter, and spring are the seasons.

original: dbyar zla 'bring po dang / dbyar zla tha chungs dang / ston zla ra ba dang / ston zla 'bring po dang / dpyid zla 'bring po dang / dpyid zla tha chungs dang / dbyar zla ra ba ste zla ba rnams so //
analyzed: dbyar zla 'bring po dang / dbyar zla tha chungs dang / ston zla ra ba dang / ston zla 'bring po dang / dpyid zla 'bring po dang / dpyid zla tha chungs dang / dbyar zla ra ba ste zla ba rnams so //
translated: The months are: the middle month of summer, the last month of summer, the first month of autumn, the middle month of autumn, the middle month of spring, the last month of spring, and the first month of summer.

original: lce gcig pa dang / lce gnyis pa dang / lce gsum pa dang / lce bzhi pa ni dril bu rnams so //
analyzed: lce gcig pa dang / lce gnyis pa dang / lce gsum pa dang / lce bzhi pa ni dril bu rnams so //
translated: The bells are: the single-tongued, the double-tongued, the triple-tongued, and the four-tongued.

original: dung dang / rdza rnga dang / pi wang dang / zangs dung ni rol mo rnams so //
analyzed: dung dang / rdza rnga dang / pi wang dang / zangs dung ni rol mo rnams so //
translated: The conch, clay drum, lute, and brass horn are the musical instruments.

original: bram ze mo dang / rgyal rigs mo dang / rje'u rigs mo dang / sme sha can ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya ma'o //
analyzed: bram ze mo dang / rgyal rigs mo dang / rje'u rigs mo dang / sme sha can ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya ma'o //
translated: The Brahmin woman, Kshatriya woman, Vaishya woman, and Shudra woman are the pledge seal women.

original: mu tig dang / gser dang / byi ru dang / mi rus ni rgyan no //
analyzed: mu tig dang / gser dang / byi ru dang / mi rus ni rgyan no //
translated: Pearl, gold, coral, and human bone are the ornaments.

original: lug dang / glang dang / 'khrig pa dang / seng ge ni khyim mo //
analyzed: lug dang / glang dang / 'khrig pa dang / seng ge ni khyim mo //
translated: Sheep, bull, copulation, and lion are the houses.

original: zla ba gzas zin pa'i dus su zhi ba dang rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba gzas zin pa'i dus su zhi ba dang rgyas pa'o //
translated: At the time of the moon eclipse, there is pacification and increase.

original: nyi ma gzas zin pa'i dus su dbang dang mngon spyod do //
analyzed: nyi ma gzas zin pa'i dus su dbang dang mngon spyod do //
translated: At the time of the sun eclipse, there is power and assault.

original: nyi ma byang du ldog pa'i dus su @319b zhi ba dang rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: nyi ma byang du ldog pa'i dus su @319b zhi ba dang rgyas pa'o //
translated: At the time of the sun's northern course, there is pacification and increase.

original: lho phyogs su ldog pa'i dus su dbang dang mngon spyod do //
analyzed: lho phyogs su ldog pa'i dus su dbang dang mngon spyod do //
translated: At the time of the sun's southern course, there is power and assault.

original: g-yas su 'khyil pa dang / g-yon du 'khyil pa dang / steng du 'gro ba dang lho ru 'gro ba ni me'i rtags so //
analyzed: g-yas su 'khyil pa dang / g-yon du 'khyil pa dang / steng du 'gro ba dang lho ru 'gro ba ni me'i rtags so //
translated: Coiling to the right, coiling to the left, ascending, and going south are the signs of fire.

original: ngang pa dang / khu byug dang / phug ron dang / 'ug pa'i skad ni mtshan ma rnams so //
analyzed: ngang pa dang / khu byug dang / phug ron dang / 'ug pa'i skad ni mtshan ma rnams so //
translated: The sounds of geese, cuckoos, doves, and owls are the signs.

original: mkhas pa dang / tshong pa dang / rgyal sras dang / zhar ba'am /🔽sgur ba'am / 'theng ba'am /
analyzed: mkhas pa dang / tshong pa dang / rgyal sras dang / zhar ba'am / sgur ba'am / 'theng ba'am /
translated: The wise, merchants, princes, and those who are one-eyed,🔽hunchbacked, lame,

original: 'phye bo'am / lkugs pa'am /
analyzed: 'phye bo'am / lkugs pa'am /
translated: crippled, mute,

original: 'on pa'am / long ba la sogs pa ni glo bur ba'i rtags so //
analyzed: 'on pa'am / long ba la sogs pa ni glo bur ba'i rtags so //
translated: deaf, blind, and so forth are the temporary signs.

original: gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / phur bu rnams ni cod pan no //
analyzed: gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / phur bu rnams ni cod pan no //
translated: Umbrellas, victory banners, flags, and daggers are the crowns.

original: mdung dang / mda' dang / 'khor lo dang / autpala dang / padma dang / gzhu dang / thod pa dang / ral gri rnams ni phyag mtshan rnams so //
analyzed: mdung dang / mda' dang / 'khor lo dang / autpala dang / padma dang / gzhu dang / thod pa dang / ral gri rnams ni phyag mtshan rnams so //
translated: Spears, arrows, wheels, blue lotuses, red lotuses, bows, skulls, and swords are the hand implements.

original: rta rin po che dang / glang po rin po che dang / khyim bdag rin po che dang / yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che dang / btsun mo rin po che dang / dmag dpon rin po che dang / 'khor lo rin po che ni nor yin no //
analyzed: rta rin po che dang / glang po rin po che dang / khyim bdag rin po che dang / yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che dang / btsun mo rin po che dang / dmag dpon rin po che dang / 'khor lo rin po che ni nor yin no //
translated: The precious horse, the precious elephant, the precious householder, the precious wish-fulfilling gem, the precious queen, the precious general, and the precious wheel are the wealth.

original: mngar gsum dang / zho dang 'o ma dang / sha dang cha dang tsha ba gsum ni lha bshos so //
analyzed: mngar gsum dang / zho dang 'o ma dang / sha dang cha dang tsha ba gsum ni lha bshos so //
translated: The three sweets, curd, milk, meat, alcohol, and the three hot spices are the sacrificial cakes.

original: de rnams ni gtor ma'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni gtor ma'o //
translated: These are the sacrificial offerings.

original: padmas bskor ba'i phyag rgya dang / autpala'i phyag rgya dang / chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya dang sdud pa'i phyag rgya ni phyag rgya'o//
analyzed: padmas bskor ba'i phyag rgya dang / autpala'i phyag rgya dang / chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya dang sdud pa'i phyag rgya ni phyag rgya'o//
translated: The mudra of the lotus circle, the mudra of the blue lotus, the mudra of the source of phenomena, and the mudra of gathering are the mudras.

original: tsandan dang / aa ga ru dang / ga bur dang / sha chen ni spos so //
analyzed: tsandan dang / aa ga ru dang / ga bur dang / sha chen ni spos so //
translated: Sandalwood, agarwood, camphor, and human flesh are the incense.

original: yungs kar gyi mar khu dang / til mar dang / mar dang / dri zhim pa'i til mar dang / til mar chen po ni mar me'o //
analyzed: yungs kar gyi mar khu dang / til mar dang / mar dang / dri zhim pa'i til mar dang / til mar chen po ni mar me'o //
translated: Mustard oil, sesame oil, butter, fragrant sesame oil, and ghee are the lamps.

original: padma'i rtsa ba'i snal ma dang / 'o ma can gyi shing gi pags pa dang / ras dmar po dang zhag ni sdong bu'o //
analyzed: padma'i rtsa ba'i snal ma dang / 'o ma can gyi shing gi pags pa dang / ras dmar po dang zhag ni sdong bu'o //
translated: Lotus root fibers, the bark of a milky tree, red cloth, and marrow are the wicks.

original: rgyal mo kha ra dang / kha ra dang / chang dang / khrag ni btung ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal mo kha ra dang / kha ra dang / chang dang / khrag ni btung ba'o //
translated: King sugar, sugar, beer, and blood are the drinks.

original: ma li ka dang / dz'a ti dang / autpala sngon po dang / ka ra b'i ra ni me tog go //
analyzed: ma li ka dang / dz'a ti dang / autpala sngon po dang / ka ra b'i ra ni me tog go //
translated: Mallika, nutmeg, blue lotus, and betel are the flowers.

original: gtsang po gnyis 'dres pa dang / shing drung gi rtsa ba dang / lha khang dang / sum mdo ni gnas kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: gtsang po gnyis 'dres pa dang / shing drung gi rtsa ba dang / lha khang dang / sum mdo ni gnas kyi khyad par ro //
translated: The confluence of two rivers, the root of a tree, a temple, and a crossroads are special places.

original: rlung med pa dang / sprin med pa dang / rlung dang bcas pa dang / sprin dang bcas pa ni zhag go //
analyzed: rlung med pa dang / sprin med pa dang / rlung dang bcas pa dang / sprin dang bcas pa ni zhag go //
translated: Windless, cloudless, windy, and cloudy are the days.

original: gtsang po la khrus byed pa dang / mtsho la khrus byed pa dang / tsandan la sogs pas khrus byed pa dang / dri ma can ma bkrus pas ni lus kyi cha lugs kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: gtsang po la khrus byed pa dang / mtsho la khrus byed pa dang / tsandan la sogs pas khrus byed pa dang / dri ma can ma bkrus pas ni lus kyi cha lugs kyi khyad par ro //
translated: Washing in a river, washing in a lake, washing with sandalwood, and washing without dirt are the special bodily conditions.

original: @320a * // de ni bye brag nyis brgya ston to //
analyzed: @320a * // de ni bye brag nyis brgya ston to //
translated: This shows two hundred variations.

original: rnam pa gzhan ni rig pa 'dzin pa'i sde snod kyi las rjes su 'brang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan ni rig pa 'dzin pa'i sde snod kyi las rjes su 'brang bar bya'o //
translated: Other variations should be followed from the scriptures of the knowledge holders.

original: de ni sgrub pa'o /
analyzed: de ni sgrub pa'o /
translated: This is the practice.

original: // de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byams pa la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi the tshom rnams ni sngar bshad pa 'dri ba rnams rtsom pa ni lan btab nas /
analyzed: // de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byams pa la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi the tshom rnams ni sngar bshad pa 'dri ba rnams rtsom pa ni lan btab nas /
translated: Then, etc. The doubts of the bodhisattvas such as Maitreya, which were previously explained, are raised in the questions.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni bya ba rdzogs pa'i phyir sku gsung thugs rdo rje ni rig pa ji lta ba bzhin du sku gsung thugs la bzhugs shing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni bya ba rdzogs pa'i phyir sku gsung thugs rdo rje ni rig pa ji lta ba bzhin du sku gsung thugs la bzhugs shing /
translated: Since all tathāgatas have completed their activities, the vajra of their body, speech, and mind abides in the body, speech, and mind just as they are.

original: mi bsrung bar bzhugs par gyur pa ni ro gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: mi bsrung bar bzhugs par gyur pa ni ro gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ro ;
translated: Abiding without protection, they become of one taste.

original: / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dri ba lus pa tsam gyi phyir /
analyzed: / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dri ba lus pa tsam gyi phyir /
translated: Then, since the question is only partially answered,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin rdo rje 'chang chen po la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin rdo rje 'chang chen po la /
translated: those tathāgatas praise Mahāvajradhara, the nature of all tathāgatas,

original: 'di ni 'og nas bshad pa'i bstod pa'i rgyal po ni mchog tu gyur pa'i bstod pas byams pa la sogs pa bstod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni 'og nas bshad pa'i bstod pa'i rgyal po ni mchog tu gyur pa'i bstod pas byams pa la sogs pa bstod par 'gyur ro //
translated: with the king of praises that will be explained below, the supreme praise, and so on.

original: thams cad sku ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: thams cad sku ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: With “All bodies” and so on,

original: sku'i rigs thams cad kyi rang bzhin dang / thugs kyi rigs thams cad kyi rang bzhin dang / gsung gi rigs thams cad kyi rang bzhin dang / thams cad mdzad pa ni rin chen dang / don yod grub pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: sku'i rigs thams cad kyi rang bzhin dang / thugs kyi rigs thams cad kyi rang bzhin dang / gsung gi rigs thams cad kyi rang bzhin dang / thams cad mdzad pa ni rin chen dang / don yod grub pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The nature of all the families of body, the nature of all the families of mind, the nature of all the families of speech, and the nature of all the deeds are the nature of Ratnasaṃbhava, Amoghasiddhi,🔽and Vajradhara.🔽Homage to you!

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po khyed la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba la ni lus ngag yid kyis 'dud pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po khyed la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba la ni lus ngag yid kyis 'dud pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: This shows the bowing of body, speech, and mind.

original: phyag btsal pa gnyis pa bstan pa ni dad pa'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phyag btsal pa gnyis pa bstan pa ni dad pa'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The second homage is taught in order to show the difference in faith.

original: rab tu byed pa las kyang ji skad du /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa las kyang ji skad du /
translated: As it is said in the treatise:

original: phyag 'tshal 'dud ces bya ba la sogs pas dad pa'i khyad par gyis phyag btsal ba drug kyang bstan pa ste /
analyzed: phyag 'tshal 'dud ces bya ba la sogs pas dad pa'i khyad par gyis phyag btsal ba drug kyang bstan pa ste /
translated: Homage, bowing, and so forth show the six kinds of homage with the difference in faith.

original: de ni las kyi rgyal po mchog gi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de ni las kyi rgyal po mchog gi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: This is the supreme king of actions samādhi.

original: kye bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sku gsung thugs ni rdo rje'i zhes bya ba rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa dang ro gcig par gyur pas rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid do //
analyzed: kye bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sku gsung thugs ni rdo rje'i zhes bya ba rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa dang ro gcig par gyur pas rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid do //
translated: O Bhagavān, the tathāgatas’ body, speech, and mind are vajra,

original: de'i sku la sogs pa thob par bya ba'i phyir ni /
analyzed: de'i sku la sogs pa thob par bya ba'i phyir ni /
translated: in order to attain their body and so forth.

original: sku la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pas na sems can thams cad ni sangs rgyas thams cad dang mtshungs pa nyid de /
analyzed: sku la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pas na sems can thams cad ni sangs rgyas thams cad dang mtshungs pa nyid de /
translated: Since they have the nature of body and so forth, all sentient beings are the same as all buddhas.

original: de'i rigs dang ldan pa ni sems can thams cad yin no zhes rgya cher gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rigs dang ldan pa ni sems can thams cad yin no zhes rgya cher gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since they possess that lineage, all sentient beings are so.”

original: de @320b dang 'dra bar sems can yin na /
analyzed: de @320b dang 'dra bar sems can yin na /
translated: If sentient beings are like that,

original: sngar bshad pa'i drag po'i las kyis gal te gsod par gyur na /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i drag po'i las kyis gal te gsod par gyur na /
translated: if they are killed by the violent actions explained above,

original: de'i tshe sangs rgyas thams cad kyang gsod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe sangs rgyas thams cad kyang gsod par 'gyur ro //
translated: at that time all buddhas would be killed.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad bsad pas na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad bsad pas na /
translated: Since all buddhas are killed,

original: sgrub pa'i dbang po rnal 'byor pa ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i dbang po rnal 'byor pa ste /
translated: the lord of adepts is a yogin.

original: de dag la ji ltar sdig pas gos par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag la ji ltar sdig pas gos par mi 'gyur /
translated: How could he be tainted by sin?

original: gal te gos par gyur na 'bras bu ni rdo rje 'chang nyid de ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te gos par gyur na 'bras bu ni rdo rje 'chang nyid de ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were to be covered, how could the result be Vajradhara?

original: de ni rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rdzogs pa'o //
translated: That is the completion.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: Then, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
translated: the Tathagata

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin can /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin can /
translated: having the nature of all the Tathagatas,

original: rdo rje 'chang chen pos byang chub sems dpa' de rnams la 'di skad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen pos byang chub sems dpa' de rnams la 'di skad ces gsungs so //
translated: the Great Vajradhara, said this to those Bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po ni sku rdo rje'i rang bzhin dang / mchod pa chen po ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po ni sku rdo rje'i rang bzhin dang / mchod pa chen po ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The great Bodhisattvas are of the nature of Vajra Body, and the great worship is of the nature of the Great Vajradhara.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams la bod pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams la bod pa'o //
translated: They are worshipped by the great Bodhisattvas.

original: de nyid kyi phyir legs bzhi ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir legs bzhi ste /
translated: For that very reason, they are the four good ones,

original: shin tu phul du byung ba'i gnas su zhugs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shin tu phul du byung ba'i gnas su zhugs pa'i phyir /
translated: because they have entered the state of the very best.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis legs so legs so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis legs so legs so zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Tathagatas say, “Good! Good!”

original: gsang ba 'dus par dbang bskur ba'i slob dpon rnal 'byor gang yin pa de ni sngar bshad pa'i rigs pas tha mi dad pa yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gsang ba 'dus par dbang bskur ba'i slob dpon rnal 'byor gang yin pa de ni sngar bshad pa'i rigs pas tha mi dad pa yin pa'i phyir //
translated: The master who confers initiation into the Guhyasamaja is a yogi, and he is not different from the one explained above.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi bdag po ni rdo rje 'chang chen po ste /🔽bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan pas na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi bdag po ni rdo rje 'chang chen po ste / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan pas na /
translated: The lord of all buddhas is the Great Vajradhara.

original: dpal ldan no //
analyzed: dpal ldan no //
translated: He is glorious because he possesses the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: byang chub rdo rje can ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams te /🔽rang bzhin yin pas na /
analyzed: byang chub rdo rje can ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams te / rang bzhin yin pas na /
translated: He is the one who possesses the vajra of enlightenment, the tathagatas.

original: byang chub rdo rje can no //
analyzed: byang chub rdo rje can no //
translated: He is the one who possesses the vajra of enlightenment because he is their nature.

original: dngos rnams thams cad ni sgyu ma bzhin du shes pa dang / spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rim gyis sems can gyi don byed pa'o //
analyzed: dngos rnams thams cad ni sgyu ma bzhin du shes pa dang / spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rim gyis sems can gyi don byed pa'o //
translated: All things are like illusions, and he benefits sentient beings through the process of emanation and re-absorption.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa de la bsod nams dang sdig pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni med de /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa de la bsod nams dang sdig pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni med de /
translated: The yogi who has attained nondual wisdom has no concepts of merit or sin.

original: gang gi phyir 'od gsal ba la bzhugs pa'i bsod nams dang sdig pa dang / de'i 'bras bu ni bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro med pas na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'od gsal ba la bzhugs pa'i bsod nams dang sdig pa dang / de'i 'bras bu ni bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro med pas na /
translated: Because in the clear light, there is no merit or sin, and no result of those, such as happy or bad rebirths.

original: de'i tshe byang chub ni rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid de /
analyzed: de'i tshe byang chub ni rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid de /
translated: At that time, enlightenment is the state of Great Vajradhara.

original: thar par rab tu gsungs so //
analyzed: thar par rab tu gsungs so //
translated: It is taught to be liberation.

original: 'gro ba rnams kyang yang dag bshad //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams kyang yang dag bshad //
translated: And also, the world is explained.

original: las rnams 'bras bu dang bcas pa //
analyzed: las rnams 'bras bu dang bcas pa //
translated: Karma and its results

original: de yi rang bzhin yongs shes pas //
analyzed: de yi rang bzhin yongs shes pas //
translated: Are fully known in their nature.

original: ma skyes pa yang bstan pa yin //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //🔽de ni rdzogs @321a * //
analyzed: ma skyes pa yang bstan pa yin // zhes 'byung ngo // de ni rdzogs @321a * //
translated: Non-arising is also taught.

original: pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That is the completion stage.

original: mgon po de ni rdo rje 'chang dang 'dra ba'i rnal 'byor pa gang yin pa des ni /🔽gdug pa can bla ma la sogs smod par byed pa la /
analyzed: mgon po de ni rdo rje 'chang dang 'dra ba'i rnal 'byor pa gang yin pa des ni / gdug pa can bla ma la sogs smod par byed pa la /
translated: The protector, the yogi who is like Vajradhara,🔽If he performs wrathful action

original: sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas mngon spyod byed na /🔽de'i tshe sems can thams cad rang gis byas pa'i las kyis /
analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas mngon spyod byed na / de'i tshe sems can thams cad rang gis byas pa'i las kyis /
translated: With the stages of mantra and seal against the wicked who slander the guru and so forth,

original: ngan song ni mnar med pa la sogs par skye bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: ngan song ni mnar med pa la sogs par skye bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: At that time, all sentient beings will not be born in the lower realms, such as the Avici hell, due to their own karma.

original: 'on kyang shin tu rnyed par dka' ba bskal pa bye bas 'thob pa'i byang chub ni rdo rje 'chang nyid de /
analyzed: 'on kyang shin tu rnyed par dka' ba bskal pa bye bas 'thob pa'i byang chub ni rdo rje 'chang nyid de /
translated: However, the enlightenment that is attained in ten million eons, which is very difficult to attain, is Vajradhara himself.

original: rnyed mi dka' ba ni rnyed sla'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnyed mi dka' ba ni rnyed sla'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Not difficult to attain is easy to attain, is the meaning of the words.

original: sngar byas pa'i las kyis mi zad pa'i dmyal ba'i 'bras bu skye bo de dag gis nyams su myong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sngar byas pa'i las kyis mi zad pa'i dmyal ba'i 'bras bu skye bo de dag gis nyams su myong ba'i phyir /
translated: Because those beings experience the result of the hell realms that is not exhausted by previous karma,

original: gal te dmyal bar skyes par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dmyal bar skyes par gyur na /
translated: if they are born in the hells,

original: de'i rnal 'byor pa des /
analyzed: de'i rnal 'byor pa des /
translated: then that yogin

original: ye shes ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rgyas btab pa ni byin gyis brlabs par gyur pa /
analyzed: ye shes ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rgyas btab pa ni byin gyis brlabs par gyur pa /
translated: seals them with the gnosis of the dharmadhatu, which is to say, he blesses them.

original: byang chub rdo rje can ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub rdo rje can ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bor 'gyur ro //
translated: They become the essence of the great Vajradhara.

original: de bas na de ni mchog tu phan btags pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na de ni mchog tu phan btags pa ste /
translated: Therefore, he is the one who bestows the highest benefit.

original: mchog tu gyur pa'i bka' drin sems can de rnams te /
analyzed: mchog tu gyur pa'i bka' drin sems can de rnams te /
translated: Those beings who are the highest recipients of his kindness,

original: gdug pa rnams la rnal 'byor pa des byas pa yin no zhes shes par bya ba ni rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gdug pa rnams la rnal 'byor pa des byas pa yin no zhes shes par bya ba ni rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: those who are the most wicked, are to be known, that is to say, they are to be realized, by that yogin.

original: de ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That is the completion stage.

original: thabs bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: thabs bshad par bya ste /
translated: The method is explained:

original: bdag nyid chen po ni rnal 'byor pa ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po ni rnal 'byor pa ste /
translated: The great being is the yogi/ni.

original: rnal 'byor pa des phan 'dogs pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa dang / tshar gcod pa ni gsod pa la sogs pa'i las byed na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa des phan 'dogs pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa dang / tshar gcod pa ni gsod pa la sogs pa'i las byed na /
translated: When that yogi/ni performs the activities of pacifying, etc. and killing, etc. to benefit,

original: de'i tshe sgrub pa chen po bskyed pa'i rim pas las kyi rgyal po mchog dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pas ni bde ba chen po ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe sgrub pa chen po bskyed pa'i rim pas las kyi rgyal po mchog dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pas ni bde ba chen po ste /
translated: at that time, the great accomplishment is the supreme king of activities through the creation stage, and great bliss through the completion stage.

original: byas nas ni skyed par byas la /
analyzed: byas nas ni skyed par byas la /
translated: Having done that, having created,

original: las rnams ni sngar bshad pa rtsom par byed na de'i tshe 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las rnams ni sngar bshad pa rtsom par byed na de'i tshe 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: if one undertakes the activities explained previously, then one will be successful.

original: de ni dang po sbyor ba la sogs pa dang rang bzhin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni dang po sbyor ba la sogs pa dang rang bzhin la sogs pa'o //
translated: That is the first application, etc. and the nature, etc.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, etc.

original: rdo rje thams cad ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i thugs rdo rje gtso bor gyur pa'i chos te /
analyzed: rdo rje thams cad ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i thugs rdo rje gtso bor gyur pa'i chos te /
translated: All vajras are the phenomena of the mind vajra of Great Vajradhara, which is the principal.

original: gsod pa'i las kyang thugs rje chen pos byas pa /
analyzed: gsod pa'i las kyang thugs rje chen pos byas pa /
translated: Even the activity of killing is done with great compassion.

original: thos shing mnyan nas dga' zhing ni thos pas so //🔽mgu ba ni bsam pas so //
analyzed: thos shing mnyan nas dga' zhing ni thos pas so // mgu ba ni bsam pas so //
translated: Having heard and listened, he is delighted by hearing.🔽He is pleased by reflection.

original: rab tu dga' ba ni sgom pas dga' bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba ni sgom pas dga' bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: He is very pleased by meditation.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po la legs so zhes gsol to //🔽mgon po chen po ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po la legs so zhes gsol to // mgon po chen po ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: He says, “Excellent!” to Bhagavān Mahāvajradhara.🔽The great lord is Mahāvajradhara.

original: thub pa chen po ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: thub pa chen po ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: The great sage is Vairocana.

original: chos rnams chen po ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams chen po ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: The great dharmas are Amitābha.

original: thugs rje chen @321b po ni bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: thugs rje chen @321b po ni bskyod pa'o //
translated: The great compassion is Akṣobhya.

original: de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir legs so zhes bya ba ni bzhi'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir legs so zhes bya ba ni bzhi'o //
translated: Since he has that nature, “Excellent!” is the fourth.

original: dad pa'i dbang gis ni tshig gnyis so //
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang gis ni tshig gnyis so //
translated: By the power of faith, there are two phrases.

original: la lan re thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyis zer ro //
analyzed: la lan re thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyis zer ro //
translated: Some say that each is the nature of method and wisdom.

original: de ni las kyi rgyal ba mchog go //
analyzed: de ni las kyi rgyal ba mchog go //
translated: That is the King of Victories.

original: ae ma ho zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: ae ma ho zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: “Amazing!” is the amazement.

original: kun du bzang po ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i thugs rje chen po ste /
analyzed: kun du bzang po ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i thugs rje chen po ste /
translated: Samantabhadra is the great compassion of Mahāvajradhara.

original: mchog ni nyan thos pa la sogs pa las phul du byung ba las /
analyzed: mchog ni nyan thos pa la sogs pa las phul du byung ba las /
translated: Supreme means that it is superior to the disciples and so forth.

original: dri ma med ni thabs la mkhas pa nyid kyis bsdus pa /
analyzed: dri ma med ni thabs la mkhas pa nyid kyis bsdus pa /
translated: Stainless means that it is included in the very skillful means.

original: gang zhig mi bzad pa'i las kyis gsod pa'i las byas na yang /
analyzed: gang zhig mi bzad pa'i las kyis gsod pa'i las byas na yang /
translated: Whoever, even though he has committed the karma of killing by means of the unbearable,

original: gdug pa'i sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu nyid stsol ba ni ster bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gdug pa'i sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu nyid stsol ba ni ster bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: bestows the fruit of Buddhahood to the wicked sentient beings.

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das la kho bo cag the tshom dang bral ba rnyed pa yang brnyes so zhes bya ba ste sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das la kho bo cag the tshom dang bral ba rnyed pa yang brnyes so zhes bya ba ste sgrub pa'o //
translated: Therefore, we have attained the discovery of freedom from doubt with regard to the Lord.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin rdo rje 'chang chen pos byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin rdo rje 'chang chen pos byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then, the great Vajradhara, the nature of all the Tathagatas, said this to the Bodhisattvas.

original: rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
translated: Son of good family means that he is invited.

original: rdo rje rigs la sogs pa las byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje rigs la sogs pa las byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The Bodhisattva who has arisen from the Vajra family and so forth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud 'di la dbang bskur ba gang yin pa ni sngags pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud 'di la dbang bskur ba gang yin pa ni sngags pa ste /
translated: The empowerment of this tantra of the glorious Guhyasamaja, the nature of all tathagatas, is for the mantrin,

original: rnal 'byor pa de zab mo'i chos thos nas /🔽sgra ji bzhin pa tsam la brten cing 'jigs par mi bya ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa de zab mo'i chos thos nas / sgra ji bzhin pa tsam la brten cing 'jigs par mi bya ste /
translated: the yogi, who, having heard the profound dharma,🔽should not be afraid, should not be frightened,🔽should not be terrified,

original: sun dbyung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: sun dbyung bar mi bya'o //
translated: should not be alarmed,🔽should not be scared,🔽should not be scared stiff,🔽should not be scared witless,

original: skrag par gyur par mi bya ba ni bsam pas so //
analyzed: skrag par gyur par mi bya ba ni bsam pas so //
translated: should not be scared out of one's wits,🔽should not be scared out of one's shoes,🔽should not be scared out of one's skin,🔽should not be scared to death,🔽should not be scared stiff to death,

original: yang dag par skrag par mi bya ba ni bsgom pas so //
analyzed: yang dag par skrag par mi bya ba ni bsgom pas so //
translated: should not be scared to death by the mere literal meaning.🔽Why is that?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas ni gtan tshigs gsungs te gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams byang chub rdo rje las byung ba ni /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas ni gtan tshigs gsungs te gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams byang chub rdo rje las byung ba ni /
translated: Because the bodhisattvas who arise from the vajra of enlightenment

original: zhe sdang las skyes pa'i khro bo'i rgyal po'i rang bzhin gyi sku gang yin pa de rnams kyis gsod pa la sogs pa'i phrin las gang yin pa de ni khro bo zhe sdang gnas las skyes zhes gsungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhe sdang las skyes pa'i khro bo'i rgyal po'i rang bzhin gyi sku gang yin pa de rnams kyis gsod pa la sogs pa'i phrin las gang yin pa de ni khro bo zhe sdang gnas las skyes zhes gsungs pa'i phyir /
translated: are the nature of the wrathful kings born from anger, and the activity of killing and so on is the wrathful one born from the abode of anger.

original: de dag thams cad byang chub rdo rje ni rdo rje 'chang chen po las skyes pa ni byung ba'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad byang chub rdo rje ni rdo rje 'chang chen po las skyes pa ni byung ba'o //
translated: All of them are born from the Vajra of Awakening, that is, from Great Vajradhara.

original: chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rigs pas /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rigs pas /
translated: Since all phenomena are of the nature of clear light,🔽if one wishes to perform any action with the yoga of any family,

original: gang yang rung ba'i rigs kyi rnal 'byor gyis las byad par 'dod na de rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i chos nyid dang / snying rje chen po la dmigs par @322a * //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba'i rigs kyi rnal 'byor gyis las byad par 'dod na de rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i chos nyid dang / snying rje chen po la dmigs par @322a * //
translated: if one does it with the focus on the nature of phenomena, which is pure by nature, and on great compassion,

original: byed na / de'i tshe skyon cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: byed na / de'i tshe skyon cung zad kyang med do //
translated: then at that time there is not the slightest fault.

original: 'on kyang sgra ji bzhin pa tsam bzung nas chos nyid spangs te /
analyzed: 'on kyang sgra ji bzhin pa tsam bzung nas chos nyid spangs te /
translated: However, if one grasps it as just literal meaning and abandons the nature of phenomena,

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i rnam par spyod pa spangs nas /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i rnam par spyod pa spangs nas /
translated: and if one abandons the conduct of the former and later tantras,

original: chos spong bar mi bya ba ni smod par mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos spong bar mi bya ba ni smod par mi bya ba ste /
translated: one should not abandon the Dharma, that is, one should not disparage it.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung ni zab pa dang don du ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung ni zab pa dang don du ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the speech of the Tathāgata is profound and has multiple meanings.

original: de bas na kye byang chub sems dpa' rnams rgyud ni chos nyid de /
analyzed: de bas na kye byang chub sems dpa' rnams rgyud ni chos nyid de /
translated: Therefore, O bodhisattvas, the continuum is the nature of phenomena.

original: bsdus pa ni rjes su dran pa dang bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: bsdus pa ni rjes su dran pa dang bsam par bya'o //
translated: The concise [version] is to be remembered and contemplated.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dag pa dang / bdag kyang rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o zhes bsams nas stong pa nyid ni chos nyid la 'jug cing gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor gyis las thams cad bya'o zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dag pa dang / bdag kyang rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o zhes bsams nas stong pa nyid ni chos nyid la 'jug cing gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor gyis las thams cad bya'o zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: Having contemplated that all phenomena are pure by nature and that one's self is pure by nature, one should engage in the reality of emptiness and perform all activities with the yoga of non-duality. This is the completion stage.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la byams pa la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams the tshom bral bar gyur cing bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la 'og nas bshad pa'i tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis bstod pa ni 'dud do //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la byams pa la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams the tshom bral bar gyur cing bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la 'og nas bshad pa'i tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis bstod pa ni 'dud do //
translated: Then, the bodhisattvas such as Maitreya, free from doubt, bow with the following verses of praise to the Blessed One, the Tathagata of all.

original: de nyid bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid bshad par bya ste /
translated: That should be explained.

original: ston pa dang bstan pa dang bstan par bya ba'i bye brag gis bstod pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: ston pa dang bstan pa dang bstan par bya ba'i bye brag gis bstod pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The praise is threefold, by the distinction of teacher, teaching, and what is to be taught.

original: de la ston pa ni rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: de la ston pa ni rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: There, the teacher is Vajradhara.

original: de'i 'khor dang bcas pa de nyid la bstod pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'khor dang bcas pa de nyid la bstod pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: The retinue and so forth of that [Vajradhara] are to be praised.

original: gang zhig dus gsum rdo rje ni dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin ni rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: gang zhig dus gsum rdo rje ni dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin ni rang bzhin can no //
translated: The one who is the vajra of the three times is the nature of the Tathagatas of the three times.

original: thugs ni spro ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: thugs ni spro ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The mind is the nature of the emanation.

original: srid dang thar gyur pa ni thar pa ster pa de dag la mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: srid dang thar gyur pa ni thar pa ster pa de dag la mi gnas pa'o //
translated: Liberation is the giver of liberation, and he does not abide in those.

original: zhi ba ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin dang / sgrib pa med pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i rang bzhin dang / dag pa ni smon pa med pa'i rang bzhin dang / nam mkha'i ngo bo ni mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: zhi ba ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin dang / sgrib pa med pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i rang bzhin dang / dag pa ni smon pa med pa'i rang bzhin dang / nam mkha'i ngo bo ni mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Peace is the nature of emptiness, signlessness is the nature of the absence of obscurations, wishlessness is the nature of purity, and the nature of space is the nature of non-composition.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi lhag pa'i byang chub ni ye shes lnga ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi lhag pa'i byang chub ni ye shes lnga ste /
translated: The supreme enlightenment of the Buddhas is the five wisdoms.

original: dbang phyug dam pa rnams ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dbang phyug dam pa rnams ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The supreme lords are the nature of the wisdom of the dharmadhatu.

original: byang chub ni rdo rje 'chang chen po ste /
analyzed: byang chub ni rdo rje 'chang chen po ste /
translated: Enlightenment is the Great Vajradhara.

original: de lta bu khyed la lus dang ngag dang yid kyis rtag tu phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: de lta bu khyed la lus dang ngag dang yid kyis rtag tu phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I always bow to you with my body, speech, and mind.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga ni rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid can de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid dang / skye mched drug rnam par dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bdag nyid dang / yul rnam @322b par dag pa'i bdag nyid gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga ni rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid can de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid dang / skye mched drug rnam par dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bdag nyid dang / yul rnam @322b par dag pa'i bdag nyid gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa dang /
translated: The five aggregates of form and so on are the nature of the five Tathagatas, which are characterized by purity, the six sense bases are the nature of the Bodhisattvas, which are pure, and the objects are the nature of the pure ones, such as Rupavajra.

original: sa la sogs pa'i khams rnams par dag pa'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i khams rnams par dag pa'i bdag nyid de /
translated: The elements of earth and so on are the nature of the pure ones.

original: spyan dang m'a ma k'i dang na bza' dkar mo dang / sgrol ma dang / m'a ma k'i chen mo'i rang bzhin to /
analyzed: spyan dang m'a ma k'i dang na bza' dkar mo dang / sgrol ma dang / m'a ma k'i chen mo'i rang bzhin to /
translated: They are the nature of Locana, Mamaki, Pandara, Tara, and Mahamaya.

original: byang chub kyi sems ni don dam pa dang de dang 'dra ba ni kun rdzob ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ni don dam pa dang de dang 'dra ba ni kun rdzob ste /
translated: The bodhicitta is the ultimate, and that which is similar to it is the relative.

original: de'i bdag nyid khyed la lus la sogs pa rnams kyis de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid khyed la lus la sogs pa rnams kyis de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I bow to you, whose nature is that.

original: de bzhin du gti mug la sogs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa la sogs pa dang / phung po la sogs pa'i bdud dang / log par lta ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gti mug la sogs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa la sogs pa dang / phung po la sogs pa'i bdud dang / log par lta ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Likewise, ignorance and so on are the obscurations of affliction and so on, the māras of the aggregates and so on, and wrong views and so on.

original: de'i rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo 'phags pa gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa sgo srung bzhi'i rang bzhin dang / rig pa ni rdo rje ro langs ma la sogs pa khro bo'i lha mo ste /
analyzed: de'i rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo 'phags pa gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa sgo srung bzhi'i rang bzhin dang / rig pa ni rdo rje ro langs ma la sogs pa khro bo'i lha mo ste /
translated: The nature of their purification is the four gate guardians such as Ārya Yāma, and the awareness goddesses such as Vajra Vetālī.

original: de dang lhan cig tu sbyor ba ni snyoms par 'jug pas 'byung ba ni skyed par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: de dang lhan cig tu sbyor ba ni snyoms par 'jug pas 'byung ba ni skyed par 'gyur ba /
translated: The union with them is the arising, the generation, through meditative concentration.

original: rtag tu rab tu 'brel ba ni dus thams cad du ste /
analyzed: rtag tu rab tu 'brel ba ni dus thams cad du ste /
translated: The constant, perpetual connection is at all times.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa ni byed pa dang yan lag gi bya ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de gtso bor gyur pa'i dga' ba ni rab tu dga' ba ste /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa ni byed pa dang yan lag gi bya ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de gtso bor gyur pa'i dga' ba ni rab tu dga' ba ste /
translated: The various things that are done, such as the actions of the limbs, are the main joy, which is supreme joy.

original: des myos pa'i dngos po ni dga' ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: des myos pa'i dngos po ni dga' ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The state of intoxication with that is the joy and so on.

original: der gyur pa ni thob pa ste khro bo'i rgyal po rnams so //
analyzed: der gyur pa ni thob pa ste khro bo'i rgyal po rnams so //
translated: The attainment of that is the state of the wrathful kings.

original: de ltar rnam par dpyad na byang chub sems dang 'dra ba ste rdo rje 'chang chen po dang mtshungs pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par dpyad na byang chub sems dang 'dra ba ste rdo rje 'chang chen po dang mtshungs pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Having thus analyzed, I pay homage to him who is like the Thought of Enlightenment, who is equal to Great Vajradhara.

original: spros pa la sogs pa ni sngar bshad pa sems 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa /
analyzed: spros pa la sogs pa ni sngar bshad pa sems 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa /
translated: Elaboration, etc. are the causes of the arising of the mind, as explained above.

original: de'i rang bzhin ni 'dod pa'i rgyal po la sogs pa gtsug tor drug go //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni 'dod pa'i rgyal po la sogs pa gtsug tor drug go //
translated: His nature is the six tufts, beginning with the King of Desire.

original: de bzhin du rmongs pa ni gti mug go //
analyzed: de bzhin du rmongs pa ni gti mug go //
translated: Similarly, delusion is stupidity.

original: zhe sdang ni sdang ba'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang ni sdang ba'o //
translated: Hatred is hostility.

original: 'dod chags ni chags pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni chags pa ste /
translated: Desire is attachment.

original: de dag ni khams gsum pa yin te de nyid sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni khams gsum pa yin te de nyid sgrib pa'o //
translated: They are the three realms, and they are the obscurations.

original: rdo rje ni snying rje dang shes rab gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje ni snying rje dang shes rab gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: Vajra is that which has compassion and wisdom.

original: khams gsum gyi shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he is the nature of the wisdom and means of the three realms.

original: byang chub sems dang 'dra ba ni snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dang 'dra ba ni snga ma bzhin te /
translated: Like the Thought of Enlightenment, as before.

original: phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba dang sbyor ro //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba dang sbyor ro //
translated: I pay homage is to be supplied.

original: bstan pa la bstod pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bstan pa la bstod pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: The praise of the teaching should be explained.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The one who, etc.

original: thog med dngos med ni rdo rje 'chang chen po thob pa'i thabs su gyur pa shes rab dang thabs las byung ba ni stong pa dang snying rje'i bdag nyid can /
analyzed: thog med dngos med ni rdo rje 'chang chen po thob pa'i thabs su gyur pa shes rab dang thabs las byung ba ni stong pa dang snying rje'i bdag nyid can /
translated: The beginningless non-entity is the means of attaining Great Vajradhara.

original: spros pa dang rnam par bral ba ni rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba ste /🔽shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba'i @323a * //
analyzed: spros pa dang rnam par bral ba ni rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba ste / shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba'i @323a * //
translated: The one who is free from proliferation and conceptualization is free from all conceptualization.

original: mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the characteristic of the empowerment of the wisdom consort.

original: de bzhin du gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba'i mtshan nyid dang / brtul zhugs ni rigs pa'i brtul zhugs dang / dam tshig sbyor ba ni dam tshig sgom pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin du gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba'i mtshan nyid dang / brtul zhugs ni rigs pa'i brtul zhugs dang / dam tshig sbyor ba ni dam tshig sgom pa la sogs pa la /
translated: Similarly, the characteristic of the secret empowerment, the conduct is the conduct of the family, and the commitment yoga is the meditation on the commitment, etc.

original: sgom par byed pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: sgom par byed pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The one who meditates on that

original: byang chub rdo rje dang 'dra ba ni rdo rje 'chang chen po dang 'dra ba de la rtag tu phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: byang chub rdo rje dang 'dra ba ni rdo rje 'chang chen po dang 'dra ba de la rtag tu phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: is always prostrating to the one who is like the vajra of enlightenment, i.e., like Great Vajradhara.

original: gang zhig rnyed pa la sogs pa yan lag bzhi gtso bor gyur pa /
analyzed: gang zhig rnyed pa la sogs pa yan lag bzhi gtso bor gyur pa /
translated: The one who is primarily engaged in the four branches of obtaining, etc.

original: dngos grub thabs kyi mchog ni bsgrub bya /
analyzed: dngos grub thabs kyi mchog ni bsgrub bya /
translated: The supreme means of attainment is the object of attainment.

original: sgrub pa'i sbyor ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa rdzogs pa'i rim pa gtso bor gyur pa sgom par byed pa de dag rdo rje 'chang chen po dang 'dra bar bltas nas /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i sbyor ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa rdzogs pa'i rim pa gtso bor gyur pa sgom par byed pa de dag rdo rje 'chang chen po dang 'dra bar bltas nas /
translated: Those who practice the yoga of the perfection stage and so forth, which is the supreme, should be viewed as similar to Great Vajradhara and

original: de la rtag tu phyag 'tshal bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la rtag tu phyag 'tshal bar bya'o //
translated: should always be worshipped.

original: de bzhin du bsnyen pa la sogs pa yan lag de nyid rdo rje bzhi'i rim gyis sgrub par byed pa dang / dman pa'i dngos grub ni rtogs pa'i lha'i sgrub par byed pa sangs rgyas dang / bla ma'i drin gyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin rdo rje slob dpon gyi bka' drin gyis sgrub par byed pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsnyen pa la sogs pa yan lag de nyid rdo rje bzhi'i rim gyis sgrub par byed pa dang / dman pa'i dngos grub ni rtogs pa'i lha'i sgrub par byed pa sangs rgyas dang / bla ma'i drin gyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin rdo rje slob dpon gyi bka' drin gyis sgrub par byed pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Similarly, the practice of the branches of approach and so forth by means of the four vajra stages, the practice of the lower attainments, the practice of the deity of realization, and the practice by the kindness of the guru, which is by the kindness of the vajra master who is the nature of all tathagatas, is as before.

original: bstan par bya ba la bstod par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bstan par bya ba la bstod par bshad par bya ste /
translated: The praise of the teaching should be explained.

original: rgyud 'di bshad par gyur pa'i tshe nyan pa ni don dang bral ba sgra tsam thos pa dang / 'don pa ni rgyun ma chad par kha ton byed pa dang / klog pa ni res 'ga' 'don pa dang / sems pa ni thos nas bsam par byed pa dang /
analyzed: rgyud 'di bshad par gyur pa'i tshe nyan pa ni don dang bral ba sgra tsam thos pa dang / 'don pa ni rgyun ma chad par kha ton byed pa dang / klog pa ni res 'ga' 'don pa dang / sems pa ni thos nas bsam par byed pa dang /
translated: contemplating is contemplating after hearing it,

original: yang na glegs bam la dad pas mchod par byed pa dang / rang 'dri ba'am gzhan 'drir 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: yang na glegs bam la dad pas mchod par byed pa dang / rang 'dri ba'am gzhan 'drir 'jug pa'am /
translated: or it is making offerings with faith in the book, or writing it oneself or having others write it,

original: de dag la zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: or those [who do those], as before.

original: gang zhig sgrub pa po rgyud 'di nyid kyi zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs dang / sngags dang 'khrul 'khor dang phyag rgya sgrub par byed pa de la zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gang zhig sgrub pa po rgyud 'di nyid kyi zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs dang / sngags dang 'khrul 'khor dang phyag rgya sgrub par byed pa de la zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Whoever, the practitioner, accomplishes the collection of pacifying and so forth of this very tantra, and accomplishes the mantras, yantras, and mudras, for them, as before.

original: de bzhin du gang zhig mthong ba ni glegs bam tsam mthong ba dang / reg pa ni lag pas reg pa dang / grong dang dgon pa la sogs par yang glegs bam dran pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang zhig mthong ba ni glegs bam tsam mthong ba dang / reg pa ni lag pas reg pa dang / grong dang dgon pa la sogs par yang glegs bam dran pa'am /
translated: Whoever sees it is seeing just the book, touches it is touching it with the hand, and remembers it in towns, monasteries, and so forth,

original: de'i don dran pa'am /
analyzed: de'i don dran pa'am /
translated: The meaning of that is recollection,

original: ming ni 'dus pa zhes bya ba thob pa'am /
analyzed: ming ni 'dus pa zhes bya ba thob pa'am /
translated: or the name is obtained called “the assembly,”

original: tsam ni phyogs gcig gi ming ste gsang ba'am /
analyzed: tsam ni phyogs gcig gi ming ste gsang ba'am /
translated: or “mere” is the name of one part, secret,

original: 'dus pa zhes thos pa'am /
analyzed: 'dus pa zhes thos pa'am /
